loans.name: Nilda Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica is a young woman, aged 28. She can't share many happy moments with her husband, because he is a policeman in a distant county called Huasahuasi. This has been a difficult situation, especially with their 6 year old daughter. Nonetheless, Jessica is now focusing a great deal of her time in the administration of her small store. Thanks to her hard work she has now started the construction of her own house since she is currently living with her mom.

Jessica sees a great opportunity in the upcoming Christmas season to generate enough revenue to finish her house. She is asking for a loan to buy Christmas articles and toys for her store. We are counting on your generosity and support so that the work of this noble woman has a better opportunity.

Translated from Spanish with the help of DVG by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Jessica es una joven mujer de 28 años, su esposo es policía y trabaja en la lejana localidad de Huasahuasi, motivo por el cual no puede compartir muchos momentos de felicidad a su lado y al de su pequeña hija de 6 años debido a la gran distancia que existe entre ambas ciudades.Esta realidad fue muy difícil de superar para Jessica, sin embargo, ahora a concentrado gran parte de su tiempo a la administración de su librería y mercería, negocio que gracias a su diligencia, le ha permitido iniciar la construcción de su casa, ya que por ahora viven en la casa de su mamá. Jessica ha visto en la próxima campaña navideña una brillante oportunidad para concluir la construcción de su pequeña vivienda.Es por ello solicita un préstamo con los que podrá adquirir juguetes y artículos navideños para surtir su local y así generar los ingresos económicos que le permitan lograr sus anhelos.Contamos con vuestro apoyo y generosidad para que la labor de esta noble dama tenga mayor oportunidad.

loans.use: Purchasing of toys and other articles for her small store / Compra de juguetes y más artículos para implementar el pequeño bazar.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Dilorom A. sells children's clothes in the popular bazaar in her home town of Spitamen. She received her first loan from Microinvest earlier this year, and immediately proved herself to be an enthusiastic, hard-working and very responsible client. Her customers like doing business with her because she is an excellent saleswoman with an outstanding selection of goods. She has come to us for a new loan to expand the inventory of goods she has to sell in her shop.

loans.use: Increasing the assortment of goods for sale

loans.name: Elvia Celina

texts.es:
Elvia Celina began giving bus service for two reasons, the main reason being helping her husband with finances. The second reason was to help the neighborhood moms who didn'thave a way to transport their children to school. She's been able in improve her financial life and at the same time help others in her town.

However, the bus she uses to transport the children needs repairs. This is why Celina is requesting a credit of $650 which she is willing to repay in 6 months. With this money she will be able to give maintenance to the bus, get new tires, among other things. With your help she will be able to improve her bus and offer her own children a better future

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Elvia Celina comenzó a brindar servicio de transporte escolar por dos razones, la principal fue para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y sus dos hijos y la segunda razón fue para ayudar a las madres de familia que se encuentran en su colonia y no tienen en qué llevar a sus hijos a la escuela en con la confianza de que no les pase nada. Hasta hoy ha ido creciendo poco a poco y así a podido salir adelante a su familia en todas las cuestiones económicas.

Sin embargo la camioneta en la que transporta a los niños ya necesita reparación es por eso que Elvia Celina está solicitando un crédito de US $650 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Elvia podrá comprar refacciones, y darle mantenimiento en pintura, llantas, entre otras cosas. Con tu ayuda Elvia podrá sacar adelante su negocio y así poder brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

loans.use: Maintenance for her school bus

loans.name: Banda Bbb A Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Fatuma N..  She sells vegetable and is requesting a loan to expand.  Fatuma is 38 years old and is married to a business man.  She has 4 children ranging from age 8 to 14 and her children go to school.  Each week, Fatuma makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the increased profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a piece of land.  Fatuma has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time. Fatuma is joined in her small group by Rashida N., Sarah N., Joyce N., and Mary Z..  Rashida N. has a business selling matooke and wants to purchase more mattoke for sale.  Sarah N. is currently operating a canteen and wants a loan to buy a fridge.  Joyce N. operates a salon and wants to buy a hair dryer.  Mary Z. is currently in the business of chapati making and selling and is requesting a loan to buy more baking ingredients.

loans.use: To expand vegetable business

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
I am Rani B. from the small town of Arifwala, Pakistan. I am married and have five kids. My husband and I operate a grocery store from our house. We need to purchase some inventory for our store.

I would like to borrow in a group of several other women. Parween A. will invest the loan in her husband’s CD and movie shop; Sajida B. requires a loan to buy a rickshaw in installments; Wazira B. needs this loan to expand her family's fruit business; and Nazia B. is borrowing for her bother, who sells watches.

loans.use: Buy inventory for the grocery store

loans.name: Hawa's Utulivu 2 Group

texts.en:
Hawa is 30 years old and is a single parent with 2 children, ages 7 and 10 years old. Hawa is a soft drink seller, a business she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 10am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in cosmetics sales and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the cultivation of rice

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria is a member of the communal bank of Villa Huatatas. Victoria is from the town of Huatatas which is located 20 minutes away from the city of Ayacucho. It is a small valley where the people dedicate themselves to farming and raising cattle.

Victoria is widowed, is 47 years old and has 6 children. Victoria buys grains at the different towns and fairs in the region. She then processes the grains in a rented mill. She sells her products in the city of Pisco which is located 6 hours from the city of Ayacucho. She also makes dried potatoes and farms.

Victoria needs a loan of $375.00 which she will invest in the purchase of barley and potatoes.

Victoria’s dream is to purchase land to build her house and that her children will have secure jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas, Victoria es natural D. la comunidad D. Huatatas que se encuentra a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, es un valle pequeño donD. la población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Victoria es viuda, tiene 47 años y 6 hijos, Victoria compra cereales D. los diferentes pueblos y ferias D. la región, posteriormente procesa los cereales en un molino alquilado, sus productos los venD. en la ciudad D. Pisco que queda a 6 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, también elabora papa seca. Además Victoria se dedica a la agricultura.

Victoria necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cebada y papa.

Los sueños D. Victoria son comprar un terreno para construir su casa, sus hijos tengan trabajos seguros.

loans.use: Purchase of barley and potatoes.

loans.name: Fua

texts.en:
Fua F., 34, is married with 5 children. She has 3 years of experience in selling bananas and taro. She sells to the public and villagers 2 days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

SPBD loans are Fua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will also use the loan to buy cement and timber for home repairs.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals and pesticides

loans.name: Thi Ly

texts.vi:
As a family with tradition in farming and owned 7 pieces of farm land, Mrs. N. Thi Ly's family relied on mainly farming and raising livestock for a living. Even though Mrs. Ly's house was right next to the People's Representative Office of Tan Minh village and enjoyed the high accessibility from other villages, she still faced poverty because of her lack of capital. In 1996, she joined the TYM Fund and borrowed 300,000VND (18.50USD) to invest in breeding pigs and chickens. The profit was not high but she continued to use the subsequent loans to raise livestock. In 1998, the road connecting the centre of Soc Son town and Tan Minh village was upgraded and paved. Seeing the opportunity for business, her family opened a breakfast restaurant and cafe, thus their income has been increasing and Mrs. Ly has been able to accumulate an amount of capital. In 2005, with the profits made and borrowed money from her relatives, she was able to build a 3-storey house and expand her restaurant. Her family's average monthly income from livestock and the restaurant is about 4,500,000VND (about 300USD). This time, she would like to borrow 19,000,000VND (1,150.00USD) to invest in her restaurant and cafe.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Là một gia đình thuần nông, với 7 sào ruộng nên kinh tế gia đình chị chủ yếu trông vào đồng ruộng và chăn nuôi thêm lợn, gà. Mặc dù gia đình chị nằm ngay cạnh UBND xã Tân Minh rất thuận tiện giao thông liên thôn, xã và buôn bán nhưng thiếu vốn. Năm 1996 chị xin tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương, được vay 300.000 đồng chị đầu tư vào nuôi lợn, gà, thu nhập không nhiều, sau mỗi vòng vốn chị lại tiếp tục đầu tư và mở rộng chăn nuôi. Năm 1998 khi tuyến đường liên xã nối từ trung tâm huyện đi qua xã Tân Minh được nâng cấp và trải nhựa, thấy có điều kiện làm ăn, gia đình chị đã mở cửa hàng phục vụ ăn sáng và bán hàng giải khát, thu nhập của gia đình chị ngày một tăng so với trước đây. Cuộc sống của gia đình đã đầy đủ hơn và chị đã tích lũy được một số vốn. Năm 2005 với số vốn tiết kiệm được và vay từ anh em họ hàng chị đã xây nhà 3 tầng khang trang và mở rộng cửa hàng. Thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng của gia đình chị từ chăn nuôi, buôn bán khoảng 4.500.000 đồng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng ăn và giải khát.

loans.use: Invest in restaurant

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 41 years old and the single mother of three children, who are all students.

She is a strong and hardworking woman, who has always looked after the well-being of her three children. She works at home, making clothing, clay decorations, wallets, etc. or whatever she sees and has the creativity to make. She currently makes clay decorations which she sells at her shop named "Modas Hary´s" in the city of Juliaca. The production is steady and she has support from her three children, which in their free time help to make and finish the pieces. Maria likes to create and decorate new models, but the production and purchase of supplies takes time and effort.

She would like to consolidate her business, making it a source of income and economic support for her three children.

With money from a loan, Maria will be able to buy supplies for making her crafts, improve her production and grow the business. In the future, she would like to have branches of "Modas Hary´s" throughout the city of Juliaca.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Maria tiene 41 años, es madre soltera de tres hijos, los cuales son estudiantes.

Es una mujer, fuerte y trabajadora, siempre ha velado por el bienestar de sus tres hijos, trabaja en su casa confeccionando prendas de vestir, adornos de barro, carteras, etc. o lo que vea y tenga la creatividad de fabricar, en la actualidad confecciona adornos de barro que vende en su local llamado “Modas Hary’s” en la ciudad de Juliaca, usualmente la producción es buena, ella recibe el apoyo de sus tres hijos, que en sus horas libres la ayudan en la confección y acabado de las piezas.A Maria le gusta crear y confeccionar nuevos modelos, pero la producción y adquisición de material toma tiempo y esfuerzo.

Quiere consolidar su negocio, para hacer de él, la fuente de ingresos de sus tres hijos y donde puedan apoyarse económicamente

Con el dinero del préstamo Maria podrá comprar material para la elaboración de las artesanías que realiza, mejorar la producción para crecer como negocio y en el futuro tener sucursales de Modas Hary’s por toda la ciudad de Juliaca.

loans.use: Buy supplies for making crafts.

loans.name: Cesar Jesus

texts.es:
Cesar inicio el negocio para tener un ingreso extra ya que no tenia trabajo y con el sueldo de su esposa no completaban para los gastos. Comenzó hace 2 años elaborando y vendiendo comida entre familiares después se hizo de un puesto el cual lo puso frente a su casa y ya después empezó a tener clientela ya que tiene muy buen punto de venta en la colonia.

El necesita un préstamo por US $650 que pagara en 6 meses para la compra de materia prima ya que sus ventas se han incrementado. Con tu apoyo el saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Cesar began his business in order to have extra income as he didn’t have a job and his wife’s wages didn’t meet their expenses. 2 years ago he began making and selling food to relatives and then he made a stand that he placed in front of his home and then he began to have customers as he has a very good location in his neighborhood. He needs a loan for US $650, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy raw ingredients as his sales have been increasing. With your help he will be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw ingredients to make food

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru:
Шарифова Саида, 1988 года рождения, Начала свой бизнес с продажи продуктов питания. У нее 2 года опыта в этой деятельности. Саида арендовала магазин и переоборудовал его под продовольственный магазин. У нее в ассортименте все необходимые продукты питания, мука, растительное масло, сахар, разновидность конфет производства России и Ирана, хлебобулочные и кондитерские изделия, печени, пряники, консервная продукция и т.д. Также в продаже имеются товары народного потребления и хозтовары. У илхома много постоянных клиентов. Покупает свой товар в магазинах Сафар-Центра.
Саида хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 4000 сомони чтоб закупить масло и муки.
texts.en:
Saida S. was born in 1988. She started her own business selling food and produce and has two years experience. Saida has rented out a shop and renovated it as a food store. In her assortment of inventory there are all kinds of necessary food products such as flour, vegetable oil, sugar, candies from Russia and Iran, baked good and confectionery products, cookies, gingerbread and canned goods. There are also household and daily use products available. Saida has many regular customers. She buys her merchandise from stores in Safar-center. Saida wants to receive a loan with the help of Kiva for the amount of 4000 somoni (USD$1,200) to buy oil and flour.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oil and flour

loans.name: Ismat

texts.ru: Вохидов Исмат проживает в городе Вахдат. Рботает на своей маршрутке"Газель" по маршруту Душанбе-Вахдат. Занимается извозом уже 10 лет. Но для того , чтобы увеличить прибыль, а так же снизить стоимость за проезд, хочет установить газовое оборудование. Это поможет привлечь много постянных клиентов. для того, чтобы установить данное оборудование он должен получить кредит в размере 1200 долларов США. А погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.Исмат имеет большую семью. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Старшая дочь уже взрослая и для того, чтобы дать ей образование он должен много, много работать.
texts.en:
Ismat V. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is married and has four children. His oldest daughter is now grown, and Ismat has to work a lot to help her obtain education. He drives a shuttle bus “Gazel” on the Dushanbe-Vahdat route. He has been in the transportation business for 10 years. To increase profitability and decrease transportation cost, Ismat wants to install gas equipment. This will help retain many return clients. In order to install this equipment, he needs a loan of $1200, repayable within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of gas equipment

loans.name: Majuline

texts.en:
Majuline T. is married to a farmer and they have three children. She opened up a small store located closer to her village, so her fellow villagers don't need to travel too far into town to buy basic commodities.

The income from their store has helped Majuline's family in their daily needs. They are thinking of buying additional products in order to earn more profit and to be able to save for their children's education and for their future.They thought of asking a loan of PHP7,000 from a local financial institution that helps people like them who dream to have a better life.

If she would be given the amount that she borrows, she promised to pay them off timely.
  
With her passion in managing her business, she believes that her family's living status will improve.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata F. est une femme mariée. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt acheter des tissus afin d’en faire des robes qu’elle va vendre. Elle projette aussi de préparer de l’encens traditionnel afin de le commercialiser. Cette activité va lui permettra de  mieux améliorer les conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Aminata F. is married. She will use this loan to buy cloth which she will make into dresses and then sell. She also plans to make traditional incense to sell. In this way she will improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth to make dresses and then sell as well as make incense for resale.

loans.name: Hung's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hung K. is a group leader of four wH. all live in Tang Kruos Lech village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a chicken breeder. Her husband, Mr. Suos Hak, is a farmer wH. owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy rice seed to grow on his field. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Hung K. decided to request a loan to buy rice seed to support the field. She is 47 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, another is a farmer wH. helps their father work and the others are enrolled in the local school. Mrs. Norn T. could not come to take a loan but her husband did, so he is presented in the picture instead.

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds to grow on the field.

loans.name: Mosurat

texts.en: Mosurat lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She sells electrical materials. She is 25 years old and married with a child. She needs a loan of N50000 to purchase more electrical materials to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical  materials to sell

loans.name: Antonia Digna

texts.es: La Sr. Antonia de 42 años de edad, habitante del barrio Hialeah, ama de casa que al ver la necesidad de una entrada económica mas ella tomo la decisión de crear su pequeño negocio y ser parte de muchas mujeres emprendedora. Es casada y  tiene una niña de 12 años de edad, estudiante de secundaria, su esposo de profesión albañil. Doña Antonia vende productos como: gorras, cables, fajas y otros productos con tres años de experiencia en ventas y iniciándolo con fondos propios. Con planes de bienestar para su familia terminar de construir su casa ofreciéndoles seguridad y protección. La solicitud de este préstamo es para invertir en su negocio para incrementar el volumen de venta con la compra de productos de electricidad como: cables de televisión, controles para equipo de sonido, antenas para televisor y mayores cantidades de gorras, fajas. Con esta nueva inversión obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Antonia is 42 years old and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood. She is a homemaker who saw the necessity to join the work force. Antonia therefore made the decision to start a small business and join the ranks of the women entrepreneurs. She is married and has a 12 year old daughter, who is in high school. Antonia's husband is a bricklayer by profession. Antonia sells products such as: hats, cables, girdles, and other products. She's been in sales for three years, having started with her own funds. This loan will be used to increase her sales volume by adding electronics products such as: television cables, sound equipment controllers, television antennae, and large quantities of hats and girdles. With this new investment she'll increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hats, girdles, TV antennae, and TV remote controls.

loans.name: Abdugafor

texts.ru: Абдугаффору 58 лет, женат и имеет 4 детей. Находится на пенсии, старшие сыновья присылают денежные переводы из России и на это живут. Так как Абдугаффор живет в доме с земельным участком он  держит дома домашний скот. Излишки молока которые остаются, продают соседям, а тот приплод который растет приносит прибыль когда они его продают. Абдугаффор видя что цены на скот на рынке немного упали, решил получить займ и прикупить еше одну корову.
texts.en:
Abdugafor is 58 years old, married, and has four children. He is retired, and lives on the remittances his oldest sons send from Russia. Since Abdugafor lives in a house with a plot of land, he maintains a few domestic livestock. Extra milk is sold to neighbors, and the offspring that he raises are later sold for a profit. Noticing that prices for livestock have fallen a little, Abdugafor decided to obtain a loan and buy one more cow.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en: K. Moses is a young hard working man who has run a salon business for six years. He began working at a young age after he dropped out of school for financial reasons. He has been working longer hours in order to make his children’s lives easier and more bearable in the future. With his previous loan, he was able to purchase a chair and a shaving machine and with this is why he needs to buy others, plus combs, spirits, and fumes for his customers.

loans.use: Buying fumes, spirits, combs and others for his barber shop.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Joven Juan Carlos es  habitante de la zona # 5 de Nueva Guinea, esta solicitando su tercer  crédito a la institución de AFODENICpara invertirlo en construccion de los servicios higienicos y de esta forma mejorar las condiciones de vida del nucleo familiar, el no tiene hijos, vive con sus ancianos padres  de escasos recursos economicos pero si son  una familia muy unida, Juan Carlos se caracteriza por ser muy responsable, honesto, trabajador y ha demostrado buena conducta en la sociedad, el es muy querido por sus compañeros de trabajo y maestros por ser  muy humilde, su sueño es tener salud, estabilidad laboral y seguir estudiando para ser un excelente  profesional con mucha experiencia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a young man who lives in Zone #5 of the Nueva Guinea neighborhood and is requesting his third loan from Kiva partner AFODENIC so he can build a bathroom, and in this way improve the conditions of his nuclear family. He has no children and lives with his elderly parents who have few financial resources, although they are a very close family. Juan Carlos is a very responsible, honest, hard-working person and has demonstrated good social conduct. He is well-liked by his coworkers and teachers because he is so humble. His dream is to be healthy, have a stable job, and finish studying so he can be an excellent professional with a lot of experience.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bathroom

loans.name: Santos Manuel

texts.es: El Señor Santos Manuel T. V. cuenta con 26  años de edad, casado,  Actualmente está trabajando como trabajador prestando sus servicios en la tejeduría elaborando manteles Típicos reside en el caserío Xapatan Aldea Chipuac municipio y departamento  de Totonicapán, Guatemala, pero en las condiciones a las que vive no son suficientes por lo que solicito un préstamo y acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitarlo  y así poder comprar una pequeña maquina industrial para la fabricación de Algodón el cual es otro fuentes más de sus ingresos  para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y a la de su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Santos Manuel T. V. is 26 years old and is married. Currently he is working as a worker, providing his services in a weaver’s shop making traditional blankets. He lives in the rural town Xapatan Aldea Chipuac, municipality and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala, but the conditions in which he lives are not adequate, and because of this he asked for a loan from ASDIR. He is asking for one so that he can buy a small industrial machine in order to make cotton as another source of income for him, in order to improve his condition of life and that of his family

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a machine to make cotton

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Tomasa es casada, tiene 48 años y 5 hijos, Tomasa vive en la comunidad D. Huayllapampa que se ubica a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, Tomasa junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación artesanal D. ladrillos, los cuales los comercializa en la misma comunidad. Además Tomasa compra y venD. tara, cochinilla y tuna dependiendo D. la temporada.
Tomasa necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago D. los peones.
Los sueños D. Tomasa son construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a member of the Sonrisa Microfinance Institute.

She is a 48-year-old married mother of 5 children. She lives in the Huayllapampa community, located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Tomasa and her husband make bricks by hand for a living, which they then sell in their community. Additionally, Tomasa buys and sells tara pods, cochineal insects and prickly pears, depending on the season.

Tomasa needs a 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in paying workers.

Tomasa dreams of building her own house and of providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying workers

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fish vending is the source of income of Mrs. Fe B. of Buenavista, Santiago City, Isabela. She buys fish, specifically milkfish, in the market and sells them in their village. With this business she is able to earn PHP 500 a week and this income is just enough to support their daily food requirement. Thus, she is really working hard for her business to grow for the future of their children.

Fe wishes to borrow PHP 5,000 from Kiva to have additional capital. She can use the loan for buying more milkfish or other kinds of fish so that her customers will have other choices. Through this, she is hoping that her income will increase so that her children can go back to school again for they were forced to quit before because of her financial problems.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Damarys Johanna

texts.es: La señora Damaris P., madre soltera de tres hijos de 10,11 y 16 años de edad, tiene 33 años, reside  en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua. Sus planes es poder terminar de hacer su casa y dar estudios a sus tres hijos. Ella trabaja en servicio domestico un trabajo agotador pero tiene que trabajar para poder ayudar a su familia. Con este crédito comprar materiales de construcción para levantar su casa la mitad de piedra y el resto de madera, para poder vivir con su hijo en mejores condiciones ya que su casa es de lamina de zinc ya muy viejas y tiene mucho zarro es por eso le urge hacer las mejoras. Ya que se hace difícil solo ella trabajar. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios de las mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Damaris P. is the single mother of three children ages 10, 11, and 16. She is 33, and she lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of the capital of Managua. Her plans are to be able to finish making her house and to give an education to her three children. She works in domestic services. It is exhausting work, but she has to work to be able to help her family. With this loan she will buy construction materials to raise her house, which is half stone and the rest wood. She will do this to be able to live in better conditions with her children. Her house is made of very old zinc sheeting, and it is very rusty. That is why she wants to make the improvements now. It is difficult for her to be the only one working. She is grateful to the institution for the benefits of improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to make improvements on her house

loans.name: Sapo-Ben Group

texts.en:
These are a group of local entrepreneurs in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 4,000,000 to help them improve their businesses. With such a loan, they will be able to add more goods into their businesses so that both sales and profit will increase. In this way, these entrepreneurs’ living conditions will improve; they will be able to better look after themselves and children.

Abdul S. C. is the leader of this group. Abdul is thirty-three years of age.  He is married to a businesswoman and they have four children.  Abdul is a motorbike driver and he has been in this business for five years.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Dixsa

texts.es: Dixsa B. Rodríguez tiene 32 años. Ella dio inicio al negocio de la venta de ropa usada hace 3 años. Empezó a distribuirla entre sus amistades más y así logro observar que obtenía muy buenos ingresos que serian de buena ayuda para su familia. Y con los financiamientos logro comprar una amplia variedad de ropa. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones, camisetas, faldas y talla extra grande por lo que es la mayor demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary W. is a 34-year-old single mother, with one school-going child. She has been in the cereals business for the last six years within Gilgil town.

Mary has never borrowed from any micro-finance institution before, but a need arose and after research, she was introduced to KADET by a friend who was also a KADET client.

This will be Mary’s first time borrowing from KADET, and she will use this loan to stock all types of cereals in her shop. Her future aspiration is to be a wholesale distributor of cereals in Naivasha town.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Restocking all types of cereals

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Lidia S. from Tukuyu. She is married with 2 children, aged 2 and 4. Lidia has been running a business selling used clothes since 2007. The business involves importing second-hand clothes across the oceans from America and Europe, which are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Tanzania to retailers. The retailers then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets and in the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost and the general appeal of anything modern. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Lidia currently earns about $80 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more clothes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Lidia thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Shirmen

texts.en: Munkhbayar is 28 years old and lives with his wife and six-year-old daughter in the Tuv province of Mongolia. He operates a local coal and wood transportation business. Coal and wood are two types of fuel used to heat gers and houses during the Mongolian winter. Munkhbayar opened this business earlier this year, after closing a retail business he had run for several years. His daily earnings are between 15,000 and 25,000 tugrugs (about $10-17). He has been so successful in his new line of work that he has been able to build a house for his family and a small shop near his home. He plans to sell food in this shop in order to further improve his family’s quality of life and stabilize his earnings when fuel sales decrease in the summer. Munkhbayar is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (about $1,400 USD) loan to buy coal and wood for his fuel business and food items for his new shop.

loans.use: To purchase coal and wood for his fuel transportation business and food items for his new shop

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es:
Miriam R. se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa en el departamento de Managua donde ofrece ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Ella se ha destacado por ser una excelente trabajadora y ha logrado llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación habiendo beneficiado a su pequeño hijo en edad escolar.

La razón por la que ha solicitado el crédito es para invertirlo en la compra de la ropa ya que se le ha agotado y requiere invertir a lo inmediato para obtener las utilidades y seguir manteniendo su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Miriam R. sells clothing for men, women, and children in the department of Managua. She is known as an excellent worker who manages to maintain her household. Miriam has a young son who is in school.

She is requesting a loan to buy more clothing since she has exhausted all of her funds and needs to invest in her business so that she can generate immediate profits and continue supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito S. is from the village of Zone 4, Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 47 years old, married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Juanito owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Juanito has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Juanito joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. He is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his second from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luisa De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Luisa de los Ángeles G. O. es una joven de 24 años de edad emprendedora de un negocio de tortillas el cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$2000.00 que le dio su esposo hace 5 años. Este negocio está ubicado en el Barrio la URSS, al este de la capital Managua. 

Ella se levanta a palmear con su mamá a las 4:00 am de la mañana para  terminar de palmear la primera ronda de tortillas a las 8:00 am mañana estas tortillas las termina de vender hasta la una de la tarde cuyo costo es de C$ 1:00. Y la segunda ronda comienza a las 2:00pm y termina a las 6:00 pm de la tarde. A la par de las tortillas también vende cuajaditas a C$1.00 y frijoles cocidos C$5.00.

Los insumos que ella utiliza son Leña a un costo de C$120.00 las 60 rajas, Maseca a C$155 las 25 libras o arroba, y los frijoles a C$ 8.00 la libra.

El crédito lo solicita para reparar el techo de su cocina que tiene 6 láminas de Zinc en mal estado, unos cuartones (vigas), y el restante es para invertir en la compra de insumos del negocio.

Actualmente el negocio se encuentra en el patio de su casa; el contorno de la cocina es de puro zinc, con piso de suelo, un fogón tradicional, una ventana y una mesa de madera con un área de 4 metros cuadrados.

Ella es casada, con 5 hijos a su cargo 3 de ellos en edad escolar. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella vendía ambulante Posol y tiste, y ahora está agradecida con CEPRODEL porque tiene mejores condiciones en su cocina, vende más tortillas, ya que no tiene que dejar de trabajar cuando llueve.
texts.en:
Luisa de los Ángeles G. O., 24, is a tortilla merchant. She began her work with an initial investment of 2000 colones she got from her husband 5 years ago. The tortilla shop is located in the URSS neighborhood in the eastern part of Managua. She and her mother get up at 4am to start making the tortillas so that they can have the first batch done by 8am. These tortillas will be sold by 1pm and she charges 1 colon. The second batch is started at 2pm and ends at 6pm. Besides the tortillas, she also sells cuajaditas (a local cheese) for 1 colon and cooked beans, for 5 colones. The raw materials she consumes are: firewood, which costs 120 colones for 60 pieces, Maseca (corn meal) at 155 colones for 25 pounds, and beans, at 8 colones per pound. The financing is to repair her kitchen's roof which has 6 zinc metal sheets in very poor condition, and some wood beams; the remainder is to buy raw materials for the tortillas. Currently, the shop is in her yard. The kitchen's walls are all zinc metal, it has a dirt floor, a traditional firepit, a window, and a wood table that measures 4 square meters. She is married and has 5 children, 3 of whom are school age and still under her care. She states that, before having her tortilla shop, she was a street vendor of posol (a corn drink) and tiste (a cactus fruit blended with lime and sugar, has a dark purple color and seedy pulp) and now she is grateful to CEPRODEL because she has a better kitchen, sells more tortillas, and doesn't have to stop working when it rains.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her kitchen's roof and purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline B. is from the village of Cabaruan,Naguilian,Isabela. She is 18 years old and married. To make a living, Caroline owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish to the local community. Caroline earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Caroline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Caroline is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Caroline from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mahanaim Group

texts.es:
Beatriz  O. C. tiene 42 años de edad (en la foto tiene sueter cafe), ella vive la comunidad de san Miguel Xico 2da sección de valle de Chalco Solidaridad, Estado de México es acreditado activa de la Ude  Mahanaim.
La señora Beatriz se dedica a la elaboración de piñatas desde hace seis años, tenia la inquietud de emprender un negoció, por lo que una amiga le ofreció a enseñarle a elaborar piñatas, y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la escuela de sus tres hijos  y  con los ingresos de su esposo que  se dedica  a la albañilería  solo cubre los gastos de alimentación, fue de ahí, que le pareció la idea e improviso herramientas que le fueran útil para la elaboración de piñatas porque sus pedidos cada vez son mas grandes por esa razón se unio con otras personas que tenian las mismas necesidades  y formaron un grupo y solicitar un crédito a travez de fundación realidad porque su negocio a prosperado y todo el al año se tiene que dedicar, para que en temporada pueda surtir todos sus pedidos a tiempo y entregarlos  en mercados de su localidad, logrando esto con la ayuda de su familia y pretendiendo crecer el negocio  y contar con su propio medio de transporte el cual tendría mayores ganancias que le permitirían tener una fuente de empleo para otra persona.

Los miembros de grupo son:

Víctor Fidel R. C.                           Taxi
Beatriz O. C.                                   Manualidades ( elaboración de piñatas)
Raquel C. Álvarez                                Agua de garrafón
Leticia  García C.                                  Venta de catalogo ( cosméticos)
Aquilina Z. Hernández                            Venta de catalogo ( cosméticos)
Lidia Janette López López                             Venta de ropa ( interior)
Paula López López                                     Dulcería
Olivia García C.                                    Albañilería
Alejandra Sánchez O.                              Venta de catalogo ( cosméticos y joyería)
Guadalupe María Guzmán C.                         peletería
Zeferina Hernández Hernández                          Florería
Rosa María B. Juárez                          Manualidades  ( elaboración de piñatas
María Magdalena Juárez L.                           Carnicería
Sara Z. Hernández                                Florería
texts.en:
Beatriz O. C. is 42 years old (she's wearing a brown sweatshirt in the photo). She lives in the community of San Miguel Xico, in the second section of the Chalco Solidaridad valley in the Ude Mahanaim State of Mexico.

Beatriz has been working making piñatas for six years. As her husband's salary from brick laing only covered their food costs, Beatriz was anxious to learn a trade in order to help him out with their kids' school fees; so a friend of hers offered to teach her how to make piñatas. From there she thought it was a good idea, and so improvised some tools to help her make the piñatas. As her orders grew larger she decided to get together with other people who had the same needs as her to form a group that would ask for credit through the Realidad Foundations. Her business has prospered & throughout the year she works very hard so that when the high season arrives she has enough stock to offer in local markets. She has achieved all this with the help of her family. She wants her business to grow & to get her own mode of transport which would help to increase her earnings & allow her to be a source of employment for someone else. The members of the group are: Víctor Fidel R. C. Taxi driver Beatriz O. C. Crafts (making piñatas) Raquel C. Álvarez Water cooler bottles Leticia García C. Sales from a catalogue (cosmetics) Aquilina Z. Hernández Sales from a catalogue (cosmetics) Lidia Janette López López Selling clothes (underwear) Paula López López Sweet shop Olivia García C. Brick layer Alejandra Sánchez O. Sales from a catalogue (cosmetics & jewellery) Guadalupe María Guzmán C. Fur trade Zeferina Hernández Hernández Florest Rosa María B. Juárez Crafts (making piñatas) María Magdalena Juárez L. Butcher Sara Z. Hernández Florest

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.use: To buy materials to make piñatas, as well as to buy products from catalogues/Compra de Material para la elaboracion de piñatas así como productos de catalogo

loans.name: Guido Manuel

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO - SAYLLA”, Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Saylla, ubicado a 30 minutos en bus local de la ciudad del Cusco. Saylla es lugar de los restaurantes más famosos al aire libre, aquí se pude venir cualquier día de la semana a disfrutar del paisaje mientras se saborea de un deliciosos plato típico de Perú y en especial de a ciudad del Cusco, el chicharrón, (elaborado a base de carne de cerdo son trozos de 3 a 4 acompañadas con papas doradas y choclo dulce o salado con una ensalada de cebolla y hierba buena tipo menta).

El socio es el Sr Guido, tiene 40 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 10 años de edad, nuestro socio se dedica al comercio minorista, Él tiene un restaurante chicharronería en casa junto a su esposa, ellos venden el tradicional chicharrón desde hace varios años, nuestro socio también vende otros platos como sopas y cónsones en base a gallina y pollo y la trucha frita o al horno. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería e insumos para la cocina, el desea comprar carnes ala por mayor, papa, maíz, para el negocio familiar.

El socio agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Guido is a member of the Communal Bank “Ahorro Es Progresso – Saylla” (Saving is Progress). He lives in the District of Saylla, which is located 30 minutes away by bus from the city of Cusco. Saylla is well-known for its open air restaurants, where people can come to enjoy the scenery while savoring a delicious Peruvian meal. The specialty of the city of Cusco is “chicharrón” (a dish containing 3 or 4 pieces of pork with roasted potatoes, sweet corn, or onion and herb salad).

Sr. Guido is 40 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a ten year old child. He is a small businessman who manages a chicharrón restaurant with his wife in their home. They have been selling traditional chicharrón for several years. He also sells other dishes such as soups or platters containing chicken or trout (either baked or fried). Guido is requesting a loan in order to acquire merchandise and supplies for cooking. He wants to buy meats in bulk, potatoes, and corn for his family business.

Guido is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en:
Alejandrina is a special loan client with Esperanza and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. She is located in El Seibo, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her two children.

Alejandrina is excited to be taking her fifth individual loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing by purchasing blouses, skirts, pants, underwear and shirts in the capital to sell at a profit. She will use the profits to invest in her home by replacing the wooden walls with cement block which is more hurricane resistant and termite resistant. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Myrna's Group

texts.en:
Myrna A. is from the village of Canubay, Oroquieta City. She is 40 years old. Myrna is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Myrna is married. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP that will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Myrna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mujeres Latinas Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. ZOILA, TIENE 45 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES CASADA. TIENE CUATRO HIJOS DOS PEQUEÑOS Y DOS MAYORES DE EDAD. ELLA INTEGRA EL GRUPO "MUJERES LATINAS" HACE 8 MESES, Y HA SIDO ELEGIDA POR SUS COMPAÑERAS EN RECONOCIMIENTO A SUS CUALIDADES MORALES, COMO LA PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO, EL CUAL ESTA FORMADO POR 9 INTEGRANTES RESIDENTES DE LA ZONA DE LA FLOR EN EL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO.
LA SRA. ZOILA SE DEDICA AL ALQUILER DE AUTOS PARA SERVICIO DE TAXI. HACE CINCO AÑOS SU ESPOSO OBTUVO UN TERRENO POR HERENCIA, EL CUAL VENDIÓ PARA PODER ADQUIRIR SU PRIMER AUTOMOVIL, CON EL FRUTO DE LOS SERVICIOS DE TAXI Y AHORRANDO POCO A POCO PUDO ADQUIRIR SU SEGUNDO CARRO.
HOY EN DÍA EL PRODUCTO DEL ALQUILER DE LOS TAXIS SIRVEN PARA MANTENER A SU FAMILIA, LOGRAR UNA TRANQUILIDAD ECONÓMICA Y SOBRE TODO EL PAGO DE COLEGIO DE SUS DOS MENORES HIJOS.
SU PROXIMA META ES ADQUIRIR SU TERCER AUTO, PARA LO CUAL ESTAN TRABAJANDO Y AHORRANDO.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZARAN PARA EL MANTENIMIENTO DE LOS AUTOS, REQUISITO INDISPENSABLE PARA TRABAJAR BRINDANDO SERVICIO DE TAXI EN LIMA.
texts.en:
Zoila is 45 years old, married, and has four children, two small and two grown. She joined the “Latin Women” group 8 months ago, and in recognition of her good character, she was elected president. The group consists of 9 members living in the La Flor zone, Carabayllo district. Zoila’s business is renting out automobiles for taxi service. Five years ago, her husband inherited some land, which was sold to purchase her first car. With earnings from her taxi services, and by saving money little by little, she was able to buy her second car. Today, her taxi-rental business is sufficient to support her family, feel comfortable economically, and especially to pay for schooling for her two younger children. Her next goal is to purchase a third automobile, and she is working and saving towards that goal. The loan requested will be used for car maintenance, which is a requisite for providing taxi service in Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Auto maintenance

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
La señora Juana J. tiene su propio negocio de venta de repuestos de bicicleta en el Mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua. Ella inició el negocio desde hace 20 años y ha ido mejorando su condición ya que ella es una dama muy trabajadora.

Está solicitando el crédito para la compra de los repuestos de bicicleta para continuar ofertándolos y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juana J. has her own business; she sells bicycle spare parts in the Iván Montenegro Market of Managua. She started this business 20 years ago, and ever since she has been working hard to improve her economic situation. Juana is requesting a loan for the purchase of bicycle spare parts so that she can continue to sell them, thus allowing her to get by and improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en: Mrs. Emerenciana R. is from Balamban, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 43 years old and married with three children. One is already married and two of them are students. She operates a sari-sari store and her husband is a carpenter and a driver. Aside from her sari-sari store, she also sells gasoline and smartload. From her business, she earns approximately 5,000 a month. Emerenciana successfully repaid her previous loan of 6,000 from PMPC. As of now, she has a new loan of 7,000 from PMPC which will be used for additional capital for her business. This is her fourth loan cycle from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Alvaro Reynaldo

texts.es: El Sr. Alvaro, llego a nuestra Institución a través de la recomendacion de uno de nuestros clientes, con la necesidad de buscar un apoyo económico para invertir en el cambio de llantas y mantenimiento de su herramienta de trabajo como es su auto. El se caracteriza por ser un buén esposo y padre  de una pequeña, vive actualmente en la zona de Villa Israel, el cuenta afortunadamente con domicilio propio, lo cual garantiza estabilidad a la familia que recien se va forjando debido a ser una pareja joven. Ellos anteriormente obtuvieron un préstamo para la compra de una movilidad a medio uso para asi de esta manera pueda trabajar independientemente y generar ingresos, sin embargo despues de un tiempo la movilidad como toda maquina empieza a sufrir desperfectos y requiere cambios y mantenimiento. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de frutas en el mercado campesino, y de esta manera contribuye economicamente en su hogar, es de esta manera que quisimos ser partícipes en mejorar su calidad de vida brindando un apoyo económico para el destino del crédito antes mencionado y asi pueda lograr los objetivos que se propone de generar ingresos que le permitan asumir sus obligaciones y realizar mejoras en su pequeño domicilio con el fin de dar mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Alvaro came to our institution by way of a recommendation from one of our clients. He came with the need to look for economic support to invest in changing the tires and maintenance of his work tool, his automobile. He is characterized as being a good husband and a good father to his little one. He currently lives in the Villa Israel area. Fortunately, he has his own home, which guarantees his family stability. They are a young couple who recently started their family. They had a previous loan to buy a used vehicle. That way he could work independently and generate income without garnishment. After a time the automobile, like all machinery, is starting to have problems. It needs changes and maintenance. His wife sells fruit in the country market. This way she contributes economically to their household. We want to help them improve their quality of life by offering economic support. The loan is for the reasons previously mentioned. That way he will be able to achieve his objective of generating income, which will allow him to assume his obligations. He will make improvements to his small home in order to make his family more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires and maintenance of his vehicle

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Gabriela.
Elena es casada, tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Elena tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realizaba todos los días. Además Elena vende canchas y golosinas de manera ambulatoria en el centro de la ciudad.
Elena necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Elena son tener una tienda mas grande y construir su casa de material noble.
texts.en:
Elena, 33, is a member of the Gabriela communal bank. She is married and has four children. She has a store in her house where she sells groceries like meats and vegetables; she is open for business every day. In addition, Elena sells snacks and canchas (roasted corn kernels) along streets downtown. She needs a 1050 sol loan to buy rice and sugar. Elena’s dreams are to have a larger store and to build her house with substantial materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Muao

texts.en:
Muao C. is 31 and married with four children. She owns a business selling food products in the local community.  Muao has one year of experience in this business.  Muao needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Muao joined SPBD.  Muao joined the program to assist her business development. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Muao's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD:
 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as to Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.es:
EL señor Gerónimo P. Castellón tiene 43 años, está casado con la señora Nemesia Mérida de P. por más de 23 años tiene 6 hijos. Viven en Segunda Candelaria comunidad Chaupy Suyo zona rural hacia el norte de Colomi

El señor Gerónimo trabaja como agricultor y su esposa le ayuda con la venta de los productos que cosecha en los días de feria en Colomi. La señora Nemesia se levanta temprano para mandar a la escuela sus hijos, y posterior mente se dedica al cuidado de sus animales.
                                                                                                                                                                                    El señor Gerónimo P. se apersono a nuestras oficinas a solicitar un préstamo para comprar Abono Orgánico (gallinaza). Nos cuenta que hizo construir una vivienda invirtiendo sus recursos en eso, de tal modo le falto recurso para compa el abono para su actividad agrícola. Su meta principal es poder en un futuro solicitar un segundo crédito con el cual poder terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gerónimo P. Castellón is 43 years old and has been married to Nemesia Mérida de P. for more than 23 years. They have six children and live in the Segunda Candelaria community in the rural area of Chaupy Suyo, to the north of Colomi. Gerónimo works as a farmer and his wife helps him sell the products that he harvests at the Colomi market. Nemesia gets up early to send her children to school and afterwards she takes care of the animals. Geronimo came to our office in person to request a loan to purchase organic fertiliser (chicken manure). He told us that he has invested his savings in building his house, which means he doesn’t have the money to purchase fertiliser for his farm. His main goal is to request a second loan so he can finish building his house.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase organic fertiliser

loans.name: Kov

texts.en: Mrs. Kov C. is 39 years old. She lives in Trapeang Khlout village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land where she cultivates rice.  She also breeds pigs and is able to earn a small income to support her family. Her husband sells ice cream in the local village. In order to improve the pig business, Mrs. Kov C. decided to ask for a loan to buy three piglets and pig food.  This couple has three children, all of whom are students and also support their mother's businesses. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy three piglets and pig food for breeding

loans.name: Kang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kang P. is 48 years old and is the village bank president having been selected by fifteen members which located in Puothi Reamea, Kandal province. With the loans, the members hope to increase income to improve their family living.
Mrs. Kang P. and her husband, Mr. Keng Korn, are farmers who work very hard to support their family living. With their farming, they have a problem because their rice fields do not have enough water to support the rice plants. Thus, Mrs. Kang P. will use the loan that asked from AMK to buy a water machine to grow rice.  Aside from farmer, Mr. Keng Korn is also fisherman and construction worker. This couple has three children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory while another one is attending in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a water machine to grow rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Family expenses.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K.  is currently in the business of selling dresses, trousers, and bedsheets in an open place at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bedsheets and trousers to sell.  Mary is 41 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop as a sales point.

loans.use: Stock more bedsheets and trousers to sell

loans.name: Erika Manuela

texts.es: La Sra. Erika Manuela R. C. es trabajadora activa del Colegio “La Fortuna” el crucero tiene  diez  años de trabajarle a esta institución desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación primaria, tiene dos niños en Edad Escolar. Ha tenido  cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para comprar materiales de construcción y mejorar su casa de habitación los créditos le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Erika Manuela R. C. has been an Elementary School Teacher at “La Fortuna” School for ten years. She has two school age children. She has had four CEPRODEL loans that she used to buy building materials and supplies to do some home improvements. The loans have been of great benefit to her in that they have improved her and her family’s living conditions

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paint for her house, cement, sand and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Learnie's Group

texts.en:
Learnie B. is from the village of Sta. Isabel Norte. She is 32 years old. Learnie is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Learnie B..

Learnie is married and has 3 school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Learnie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Learnie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Learnie is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Learnie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Nay

texts.en:
The man shown in the picture is Mr. Nay M., 36, a fisherman. He usually needs to take eight hours a day to fish, in and around Tunle Sap River. He catches around 12 kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to his customers, who are retail sellers in the market. 

His wife’s name is Dan; she is 41 and works with him in the fishing trade. This couple has five children who are single. One of them earns about $1 a day as a fish currying worker. 

This family normally earns an average of $7 per day to help cover their family’s daily living needs. Currently, the fishing is temporarily interrupted because the fishing equipment is broken. That is why Mr. Nay M. requested a loan in order to buy additional fishing equipment.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy men's underwear, children's underwear, American rice, oil, eggs and chicken.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: El JOVEN Ivan Q. es soltero estudiante y trabajador es primer crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL, este será utilizado para pagar mensualidades que tiene pendientes, agradece a CEPRODEL porque de esta manera podrá seguir estudiando ya que tenía pendiente varios meses de pago.
texts.en:
This young man, Ivan Q., is a single student and a hard worker. This is the first time he has requested a loan from CEPRODEL. He will use it to make several outstanding monthly payments to the university.

 Mr. Q. is grateful to CEPRODEL because after making the payments, he will be able to continue his studies.

loans.use: To make university payments

loans.name: Francisca Elizabeth

texts.es: Francisca Elizabeth R. D. A. D. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután, en donD. vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil, y junto a sus tres hijos D. 12, 11 y 6 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. María se dedica a elaborar pupusas para vender, las cuales son el platillo más famoso D. este país, por lo que posee gran demanda, así mismo comercializa fresco D. horchata, una bebida muy típica D. esta región. María es una persona muy responsable con su familia, es por ello que solicita un préstamo a Integral con el deseo D. mejorar sus ventas y brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así mismo una vida mejor a su familia. Con el dinero María comprará: maíz, queso, frijoles, y todo lo necesario para invertir en el negocio.
texts.en: Francisca Elizabeth R. D. A. is 35 years old.  She lives in Usulután department with her husband, who works as a bricklayer, and her three children, aged 12, 11 and 6, who attend school.  María makes and sells pupusas (thick corn tortillas with a savory filling).  'Pupusas' are the most famous dish of the country and for this reason she has high demand.  She also sells fresh 'horchata' which is a typical drink in this region.  María is a very responsible person as far as her family is concerned.  For this reason she is requesting a loan from Integral in order to improve her sales and proviD. her customers with a better service.  In this way she can proviD. a better life for her family.  With her money María will buy corn, cheese, beans and everything she needs to invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans and cheese to make 'pupusas'

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en: Marie Grace O. is from the village of Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old. Marie Grace is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marie Grace buys and sells ready-to-wear clothing products in the local community. Marie Grace has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2010, Marie Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marie Grace is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Marie Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda R. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 36 years old. Florenda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Florenda owns & operates a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community, like chicken/pork adobo, afritada & caldereta. Florenda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Florenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florenda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Florenda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food & drinks for restaurant

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia D., who lives in Brgy. Ubo, Dalaguete, Cebu, earns her living by operating a buy and sell vegetable business. Her husband, Joselito D., 47, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have eight children ranging in age from 7 to 22 years old.

Eufemia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Eufemia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5600, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10000, which she intends to use to fund her business operations so that she can continue to save up for her children's future. Eufemia D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For business operations

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando U. is from the village of Punta, Dipolog City. He is 43 years old. Armando is separated and has three school-aged children. Armando owns & operates a business providing video game services to the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over eight years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Armando joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He successfully paid his previous loan from PMPC of 12,000 PHP. He is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair the video game units used in his business. This will be his 2nd loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials and accessories for video game repair

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid is 49 years old, married, and has two children who are fourteen and eighteen years old. Currently, both of her children attend school.  Enid sells snacks, which she has done for one and a half years. Her husband is a lecturer.  She has decided to request this loan to add more snacks to her business inventory.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Enid plans to reinvest in her business. She dreams of having a dairy because she has realized that it can generate more income in the future.

loans.use: To buy more snacks to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn C. is from the town of Banga. She is 50 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Jocelyn dreams of having a stable business.

Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
