Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anna Victoria

texts.en:
Just as she is taught in her entrepreneurial training as a community partner in CCT, Anna Victoria C., 36, chooses not to settle for anything less than what she can get. She is only a high school graduate but at present she has a business she can call her own. Anna is married to Bobby, a printing operator. They have four children of which three are already studying. The youngest is still not of school age. Their family resides in Pasay City, Metro Manila.

Anna’s business centers on electronic load for mobile phones. She capitalizes on the huge demand for mobile communication and the means to be connected to others via call or text. She sells electronic load for Smart, Globe, and Sun network clients. Also, she buys and sells biscuits like choco chips in the neighborhood. With no assistants hired to help her, she is able to earn 11,000 Philippine pesos monthly.

To level up her business, she borrowed 11,000 PHP. This will greatly help her grow her business as she needs more money on hand to stock load for sale. With this loan, she can be assured that she will not run out of load to sell to customers who need it anytime of the day. Also, she plans to venture into the rice selling business, as rice is also a sought-after commodity elsewhere in the country. The loan also helps her save up and be able to buy things her children need.

The problem of lacking finances to stock electronic load for retailing pushed Anna to get a loan and set things right in her business. She also finds it hard to collect payments from neighbors with long lists of debts. Her health is also one major problem. Nevertheless, the encouragement she gains from the fellowship in CCT helps her not to lose hope. She dreams of having a bigger store and a bigger home which they can really call their own. To reach this goal, she looks for other possible sources of income. Just like any other parent, it is her desire to see her children finish their studies.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase electronic load for retailing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase firewood and start a charcoal business

loans.name: Sergio Norberto

texts.es:
Sergio de 35 años, es un hombre trabajador que trabaja en una empresa de créditos Polo ya hace varios años.

El trabaja  verificando las cobranzas de lunes a sábados de 9:00 am a 16:00 pm. Le afecta mucho es la delincuencia ya que el sector donde traslada dinero es peligroso. Con el préstamo el quiere comprar materiales de construcción y así ponerse un negocio de soldadura para mejorar sus ingresos y ser independiente para sacar adelante a su familia en lo que necesiten.
texts.en:
Sergio is 35 years old. He is a hard-working man who has worked for Polo, a credit institution, for several years. 

He works verifying payments from Monday through Saturday, from 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. He is affected greatly by crime, because the area where he carries money is dangerous. With the loan, he would like to buy construction materials in order to open a soldering business. His aim is to improve his income and be independent, so he can help his family get ahead and make sure they have what they need.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is 32 years old and lives in the village of Khuntsi, Martvili District. He is married and lives together with his wife, parents, and children. Koba’s parents are retired. His daughter is three years old and his son is eight years old; he goes to school. 

Koba's family is actively involved in agriculture. They have four cows, one bull and four goats. They produce cheese and sell it once a week on local market. The family also owns a 0.8 ha plot of land where they grow maize and nuts. 

With the requested amount Koba will purchase an additional cow so the family will be able to produce and sell more cheese. This will positively impact the family’s income. Koba plans to renovate his house with the increase in income to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Andrew Wambari

texts.en:
Andrew has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last twelve years.  He is 35 years old, married to Cecilia Wanjiru, and they have three children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of 20,000 KES well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Andrew hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Larem

texts.es: Larem trabaja como empleada en una empresa de venta de computadoras y tiene un vehiculo el cual lo conduce su padre como taxi. El crédito lo requiere para comprar un motor nuevo y el cambio de llantas para su taxi, pues es la principal fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Vive en anticretico ubicado en la zona de Alto Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltera y no tiene hijos pero ayuda a su padre. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Larem works in a business that sells computers and has a vehicle that her father drives as a taxi. The loan will be used to buy a new engine and to change the taxi's tires. It is the main source of income to cover household expenses. She lives in a home located in the Alto Miraflores area of the city of La Paz. She is single and has no children, but she helps her father. This is the first time that she has worked with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy an engine and change the tires on the taxi she owns.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 46 years old, married, and has three children.  She does mixed farming to earn a living.  She started farming 18 years ago.  She is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because she has grown her business and improved her living standards.  In the future, she hopes to have a large number of dairy cows in her farm.  She needs 20,000 Kes to buy two calves.

loans.use: To buy two calves.

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Yorn is a widowed mother of three residing in Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City. As a stay-at-home-mother, she carries out a variety of duties including taking care of her children, cooking good meals, managing cash flow, etc.  

Yom is presently dependent upon support from her daughter, a garment factory worker, and her son-in-law, a sewing machine repairer. In order to earn an income, Yorn is requesting a Kiva loan to open a small business selling a variety  of goods in front of her house. She is really optimistic and thanks all  who make her loan possible.

loans.use: to open a small business selling a variety of goods.

loans.name: Angel Eduardo

texts.es:
Angel de 57 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, su esposa le ayuda en el expreso , su actividad es hacer expreso escolar.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás por medio de sus amistades logro sacar un cupo en los colegios para realizar expresos escolares. Tiene un por medio de 30 alumnos y cobra a $ 30 a cada uno. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere renovar su vehículos comprando llantas nueva que cuesta $80 cada para mayor seguridad en el transporte. En un futuro dese comprarse otro expreso ya que puede conseguir otro cupo en otro colegio para servicios de expreso.
texts.en:
Angel, 57, lives in the urban area called Guasmo (named after the plant species Guazuma ulmifolia.  Guasmo is a popular, modest class neighborhood which used to be a ranch) in Guayaquil.  His wife helps with his transporation service which is school transportation.

He started his business, through friends, some time ago and was able to get contracts with schools.  He has an average of 30 students and charges $30 per student.  He plans to use the loan to renew his vehicles by buying new tires at a cost of $80 each, for transportation safety purposes.  In the future he would like to buy another van so he can add another school to his transportation service.

loans.use: To buy new tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Carolina works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fruits and vegetables. Carolina is borrowing 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP)  through NWTF to purchase more stock of charcoal to sell.

Carolina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could rent a space at the public market.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maria Amelia

texts.es:
María Amelia tiene 40 años de edad, ella vive con su esposo y sus 04 hijos menores de edad. Ella cuenta con casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Pueblo Libre en el distrito de Tambogrande, María Amelia vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y aún no cuenta con servicio básicos.

María Amelia se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral, en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y después de haberlos alimentos un determinado tiempo y cuando estos  han alcanzado un tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Para esta actividad María Amelia cuenta con una experiencia de 4 años, además cuenta con  0.75 has de terreno agrícola sembrados de mango y limón que son herencia de sus padres.

María Amelia esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme alternativa de 500 nuevos soles y de esta manera pueda compra alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus ovejas y aves con la finalidad de lograr mejor tamaño y peso en menos tiempo y así rotar más rápido sus animales.

María Amelia tiene un espíritu emprendedor, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, quien con mucho entusiasmo y esfuerzo desea salir adelante y poder  obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Amelia is 40 years old and lives with her husband and four dependent children.  She owns her own home which is located in the small village of Pueblo Libre, in Tambogrande district.  She lives in the rural part of this district and does not have basic services.

María Amelia raises sheep and farmyard birds in pens which are located behind her home.  After having fed them for a certain length of time, and when they have reached an ideal size and weight, she sells them in the local market.  She has 4 years experience in this business.  She also has 0.75 hectares of farmland sown with mangos and lemons which she inherited from her parents.

María Amelia is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed with which to fatten her sheep and birds.  Her goal is to manage to have them reach a better size and weight in a shorter period of time so that she can turn over her animals more quickly.

María Amelia has an entrepreneurial spirit.  She is a very hard-working and responsible person who, with a lot of enthusiasm and effort, would like to get ahead in life and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: El banco D. emprendimiento "NUEVA ESPERANZA" se encuentra en su noveno ciclo , el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco D. Emprendimiento esta representado por las siguientes socias la tesorera es la señora Julia, quien convive con su pareja hace ya bastante tiempo,  con tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar y su actividad económica es la venta D. productos para el hogar en su tienda D. barrio, donD. le va muy bien es una persona muy responsable por este motivo fue seleccionada por sus compañeras para ser la tesorera del grupo, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería para surtir su tienda como ser abarrotes, refrescos galletas, etc. La Sra. julia esta agradecida con al institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) communal bank is in its ninth cycle.  Its members are responsible, hardworking people.  This communal bank is represented the following people.  Its Treasurer is Julia.  She’s been living with her spouse for quite some time and with their three children who are school age.  Her economic activity is selling articles for the home in her neighborhood store.  She does very well there because she’s a very responsible person and this is why her fellow members selected her to be group treasurer.  She will use the loan money to buy merchandise, like groceries, soft-drinks, cookies, etc., to stock the store.  Julia is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her neighborhood store.

loans.name: Mariama B.

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Mariama. She is married to a petty trader, and she has two children, ages 19 and 22 years. She has three additional dependents living with her, because she takes care of them while they attend school in the city. In 2001, Mariama established her gara clothing (locally dyed clothing) business. She began her business, because she wanted to be self-employed in order to have a dependable means of earning income and to help her husband provide livelihood for their children. She made good profits for the upkeep of her family, and that is why she loves this type of business.

Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 540,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Mariama requires a loan in order to buy one bale of brilliant materials to produce different types of gara cloth, including clothing, bedding, and curtains. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 280,000 SLL.

In the future, Mariama plans to open a big shop and to sponsor her children as they go through their education smoothly. Rises in transportation costs and inflation are her major business challenges. Competition is high, but she offers the best and latest fashion, giving her an edge over her competitors. She supplies customers in Freetown and Makeni Town, offering the latest patterns and designs to fit her customers' needs. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy one bale of brilliant materials to produce different types of gara cloth.

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Paterna has a food shop where she makes & sells homemade sausages like chorizzos & longganisas. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients needed to make homemade sausages.

Paterna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy raw ingredients to make sausages

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda works hard to support her family. She is 35 years old and married, having three children. She has a business that sells aqua feed supplies. She has been managing her business for three years and she earns about P20,000 a month. 

Glenda is requesting a loan amounting to P50,000 to be use in buying additional sacks of aqua feed because her feed supplies are sold out at present. She hopes that she can improve her business by increasing the sacks of aqua feed she sells. She hopes that she can get the loan amount she is requesting to be able to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of aqua feed for her aqua-shop business.

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
El señor Blas es carpintero, oriundo de la ciudad de Ybycuí. Desde muy pequeño ya le gustaba trabajar y lo empezó haciendo con su vecino que era carpintero de profesión. Ya con el paso del tiempo sintió la necesidad de independizarse para obtener un poco más de ganancias ya que este pensaba que si trabajaba en forma independiente iba a lograr su objetivo.
Salió del lugar en que estaba trabajando por dicha razón, pero había un problema, estaba sin capital suficiente para la compra de las herramientas necesarias así es que viajo a la Argentina para juntar lo necesario para la compra de lo que le hacía falta. Ya de regreso a su país de origen empezó con su pequeña empresa. Poco después se caso y su esposa tuvo un hijo.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de una cepilladora eléctrica, lo cual le facilitará de gran manera en los trabajos que el realiza.
texts.en:
Blas is a carpenter from the city of Ybycuí. He has enjoyed working ever since he was a child, when he started working with his neighbor, who was a carpenter. Over the years he felt he should begin working on his own so he could earn a little more income, which he thought he could achieve by going independent.
He therefore left the place he'd been working, but there was a problem: he didn't have enough money to buy the necessary tools. So he traveled to Argentina to scrape together enough to buy what he needed. Once he was back in his country, he started his little business. Soon after, he got married, and he and his wife had a son.
He is requesting a loan to buy an electric planer, which will help him a great deal in his work.

loans.use: to buy an electric planer for his workshop.

loans.name: Namukoya Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Namukoya Group in Western Kenya! John is the facilitator of Namukoya group, a group of farmers who are veterans of the One Acre Fund 2011 program, and will re-enroll for 2012.
Many farmers in this area live in very modest conditions, and generally do not have enough money at one time to pay for supplies vital to productive farming before planting season. As a result of poor farming productivity, income poverty and hunger are persistent problems for farming families.  
John takes care of six children at home with his wife. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access high quality inputs on credit, and raise the productivity on his farm. In the recent 2011 season, John had a very good maize yield harvesting fifteen bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, John was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.  
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to John and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, John will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.
In 2012, the members of Namukoya Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a farmer and a teacher in his home area of Kitale, Western Kenya. He has been active in farming for 5 years with his milk, eggs and maize produce going to the local market. He is married with 3 children aged between 6 and 1 year. He gets additional income from his teaching  employment.

Titus has requested for a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional dairy cow will improve his income and enable him repay the loan, educate his children and  expand his business.

He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo services but mentions animal diseases as the common challenge to farmers in the area.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sivun

texts.en:
Sivun (in the photo), 34, lives in a village about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a widow with one son and three daughters. All of her children are in school. 

Sivun is a garment worker. She is applying for a loan of $800 to buy her neighboring land to expand her property. She will also use a part of the loan to build a restroom for family use.

loans.use: To buy her neighboring land to expand her property and also to build a restroom for family use.

loans.name: Save The Children Group

texts.en:
In this photo are the members of the “Save The Children” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. These entrepreneurs have requested for a loan of 1,900,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) in order to further boost their respective businesses.

The leader of this group is Martha. Martha, 22, was born in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. Currently, she is residing in Waterloo, together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary school. Martha has been a businesswoman for many years now, selling clothing. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy jeans, t-shirts, shoes, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, shoes, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 40 year old business woman, who lives in Juba. She is widow and has 4 children between the ages of 16 and 4.  Three of her children go to school.

Jane runs a food store. She has been in this business for 12 years. She has no employees. Jane heard about Finance Sudan through the outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of 3,000 SDG to purchase more items such as maize flour, cassava flour, sorghum and millet. Jane has no other source of income than this business. 

In 5 years time, Jane hopes to be able to sell from her own shop, not a rented one. Her major challenges include high cost of living and that everything in the market is expensive. 

Jane says that she appreciates Finance Sudan’s support. She is a widow, and the father of her children died during the war. Without this support she was not going to be able to pay for the children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like maize flour, cassava flour, sorghum and milllet.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es: La señora María Cecilia se dedica junto con sus cinco hijos en su finca a la producción agropecuaria, específicamente a la compra y venta de ganado y pollos. La señora María Cecilia desea comprar ganado y realizar mejoras locativas tal como arreglo de piso y techo al lugar donde viven sus pollos. Lo anterior, le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y de esta forma poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y el bienestar de su familia. A futuro la señora María Cecilia desea tener su finca más productiva y con más animales.
texts.en:
María Cecilia works along with her five children in agricultural production, specifically buying and selling livestock and chickens.  

María Cecilia wants to buy livestock and make home improvements such as fixing the floor and the roof of the place where her chickens live.  This will allow her to increase her earnings and so be able to improve the living conditions and well-being of her family.

In the future María Cecilia wants to have her farm more productive and with more animals.

loans.use: to buy livestock and to make home improvements.

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es:
Zoila, es comerciante de frutas y verduras, vive con su madre y dos hijos, ella aprendió el negocio por medio de familiares actualmente tiene una experiencia de 18 años en el negocio, con él ha logrado sobrevivir y ofrecer a su obra una vida digna.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar fruta y verdura fresca como: manzanas, peras, uvas, tomates, papas, yuca, la compra de estos productos y ayudará a mejorar la disponibilidad para los clientes, ofreciendo productos frescos y de buena calidad.
La aspiración de Zoila, es mejorar y mantener el negocio, vendiendo otros tipos de verdura y frutas, según la preferencia de los clientes.
texts.en:
Zoila is a retailer of fruits and vegetables, who lives with her mother and two children.  She learned this business through her family, and currently has 18 years of experience in this business through which she has been able to achieve survival and a dignified life.

She is currently requesting a loan to purchase fresh fruits and vegetables, such as apples, pears, grapes, tomatoes, potatoes and yucca.  The purchase of these products will help her have better availability for her customers, and offer them fresh products of good quality.

Zoila's aspirations are to improve her business and keep it going by selling different types of vegetables and fruit, according to her customers' preferences.

loans.use: to purchase apples, pears, grapes, tomatoes, potatoes, and yucca.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana sells gari (made from cassava tubers, and similar to tapioca) at Brasi near Abura. She is married and has 4 children.  Her husband is a farmer. She helps to pay utility bills as a way of assisting her husband. Her loan will be used to buy bags of gari to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bags of gari to sell.

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señor María es socia del banco comunal Maluay, vive por la comunidad Maluay que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, y se caracteriza por la belleza de la naturaleza y su estructura arquitectónica que es una mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente labora en el comercio, cría de animales y en la agricultura, también laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas.

La Señora María tiene 34 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos  de 12, 10 y 2 años de edad y sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo  labora en una sastrería, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa cría pollos y cuyes, también trabaja en la agricultura, siembra hortalizas y su cosecha la vende en su parroquia. En sus tiempos libres se dedica a la elaboración de sombreros de paja toquilla.
 
Es socia de la banca comunal hace 3 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para los mismos.

Su meta es tener un negocio más grande de cría de animales.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Maluay community bank.  She lives in Maluay, in El Valle parish, in Cuenca.  This is a cold-climate area and it is noted for its natural beauty and its architecture which is a mixture of colonial and modern buildings.  The local people work in commerce, livestock raising and farming.  They also work in different business activities in the city.

María is 34 years old, married, and has three children who are 12, 10 and 2 years old.  Her two eldest children attend a local school.  Her husband works in a tailor's workshop.  They own their own home.

María takes care of her home and raises chickens and guinea pigs.  She also farms.  She grows vegetables and sells her harvests in her parish.  In her free time, she makes Panama hats.

María has been a member of her community bank for three years and she will invest her new loan in buying chickens and chicken feed.

María's goal is to have a larger business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, and all of her children go to school. She takes care of one additional family member, her father. She has a food stall selling tomatoes, onions, cabbages, Irish potatoes, and bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, baskets of onions and tomatoes, and Irish potatoes. She generates additional income through selling charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to get a bigger room where she can sell her food stuffs from. She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, baskets of onions and tomatoes, and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Grace Divine Group

texts.fr: GRACE DIVINE est un groupement composé de huit personnes qui sont résident dans un même quartier. Blandine Nonvignon, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 29 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Blandine Nonvignon est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Valère. le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Blandine Nonvignon vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Pour y arriver, Blandine Nonvignon vend des conserves et des pâtes alimentaires depuis une vingtaine d'années ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Assiba Jeanne s’approvisionne à Lomé au TOGO. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Blandine Nonvignon sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GRACE DIVINE un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des conserves et des pâtes alimentaires.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. Julieta  is married and has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Julieta  has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Mrs. Helen E. is a 36 years old woman with two (2) children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She deals on the sale of beauty materials. She solicits for the above amount to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more materials for sale

loans.name: Faalogoifo

texts.en: Faalogoifo V. is forty-eight years old, married to a farmer from the village of Faleapuna. They have 4 children, one of whom is an employee of the National Hospital of Samoa. Before joining the SPBD program two years ago they had problems with her small business. With financial assistance and guidance from the SPBD program, she used her fourth loan of $1250.00 to rebuild and reestablish her small business within her village. This has helped them as they are able to buy small things that they weren't able to buy before they rebuilt her confidence in her business, because overseas remittance was their only income.

loans.use: Buy 10 fine mats

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh is 47 years old. There are 7 people in her family. She sells pineapples and watermelons at the local market. Her husband farms a 4000-square-meter plot on which he grows rice and pineapples. Their income is $10 per person/month. Anh needs a loan of $75 to invest in a vegetable shop. They will repay monthly.

loans.use: Investing in a vegetable shop.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim M. is 49 years old and lives her husband and her 2 children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She and her husband make a living by selling second-hand clothes at the open air market, where they usually earn approximately $8/day in revenue. One of her children is a teacher of English at a private school, while the other is a secondary school student.

Kim M. would like to add new fashionable clothes to her inventory, but she faces a financial constraint, which is why she is requesting a loan to help her satisfy the great demand of her clients.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng K., 58, and her husband, 62, work making and selling traditional medicine to people in their community. From this, they earn around $2 a day. They have 2 children, who both work at the garment factory, earning $4 a day between them. Seng K. intends to invest this $400 in buying more herbs and plants for her business.

loans.use: To purchase herbs and plants to make into natural medicine for their business

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso #4 Group

texts.en:
Chabela lives with her three children and husband in the Seaside town of Samaná. She is the only one who consistently provides an income for her family, so she is always working hard to advance her colmado - local grocery store offering daily provisions such as rice, beans, canned foods, breads, and vegetables - and make a better life for her children and husband.

She hopes to use this loan to diversify the products that she is able to offer her neighbors. With the extra savings she expects to make, she hopes to one day build a home out of concrete blocks, on top of her colmado. She says this would be ideal because she could allow her store to stay open longer, and she would also feel that her products were better protected from burglars. Lastly, it is very important to her to have a home built out of concrete block. Because they live right on the coast, and often face strong tropical storms, concrete homes offer much more security, safety, and endurance.

She says that thankfully she has not had to overcome any significant challenges in her life, but that like every other poor person in the DR, she wants to improve the lives of her family members. Chabela is very thankful for your support in helping to make her dreams come true, and make her life more peaceful, happy, and healthful.

NOTE: This $1200 loan will fund Chabela's business as well as five other businesses in her solidarity group. She and five other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective business and pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses

loans.name: Abdukahor

texts.en: Abdukahor A. lives in Mastchokh, Tajikistan. He is married with children. Abdukahor works in the flour selling business. He applied to Microinvest for a loan for a vehicle purchase to help accelerate the business process.

loans.use: Vehicle purchase to accelerate process in flour selling business.

loans.name: Rohaeni

texts.en: Rohaeni is a 33-year-old woman who sells ice, snacks, etc. at her food stall, earning US$5 a day.  Her husband, J., does not work anymore, so the family depends on her business. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of US$125 to fill her stall. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her food stall

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David is a very responsible person who is dedicated to his family. A few years ago, he suffered the painful loss of his wife, and since then he had to become both father and mother for his 4 young children. This exemplary father sought to provide the best example, love and affection for his offspring, trying to somehow fill the void left by the passing of their mother. David took on many jobs in order to earn sufficient income and be able to offer food and shelter to his children. He currently buys and sells American apparel, which he purchases in bundles in the city of La Paz, Bolivia, then sells in Rinconada. This business helps him pay the rent, food, and his children’s education. He would like to take this opportunity to appeal to your generous heart, requesting the loan in order to purchase greater quantities of merchandise. David appreciates the trust you give him through your help.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

David, es padre muy responsable y dedicado a su familia, hace algunos años sufrió la penosa pérdida de su amada esposa, desde entonces se convirtió en padre y madre de sus cuatro menores hijos. Este ejemplar padre en todo momento buscó ofrecerles el mejor ejemplo, amor y cariño posible a sus pequeños retoños, para cubrir de alguna manera el gran vacío que dejó en sus vidas la partida de su madre. David se desempeñó en diferentes oficios con el fin de obtener suficientes ingresos y poder brindarles alimentación y cuidado a sus hijos.Actualmente está dedicado a la compra y venta de ropas americanas, mercadería que adquiere por fardos en la ciudad de la Paz – Bolivia y los vende en la mina Rinconada; este negocio le permite cubrir el alquiler de vivienda que comparte con sus amorosos hijos, alimentación y educación de sus pequeños.En esta oportunidad recurre a vuestro generoso corazón y hace la solicitud de un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías.David agradece la confianza que le brindas a través de tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of greater quantities of apparel

loans.name: Begajeta

texts.en: Begajeta was born in 1962 and she is widow. She lives in a small village Lukavica near the town Gračanica with her 2 daughters, 15 and 17 years old. This is her fourth loan at MCO WWI. This loan in the amount of 600 KM will go toward buying chicken and feed for stock in order to improve her monthly household income.

loans.use: Buying chicken and feed for stock.

loans.name: Dia

texts.en:
Dia is a married woman with 3 children, ranging in age from 14 to 20 years old. Dia owns a small food vendor store which she started in 1988. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Mirma Eunice

texts.es:
Mirma started her business in anticipation of her children’s future because her two children are in elementary school and her husband’s earnings are not enough. Mirma and her husband want their children to go to college and know that Mirma’s husband’s earnings will not make that possible. To make that possible and to support the family, they decided to devote a small area in their house for the sale of scrap metal. Thanks to their dedication, it has been successful.

Presently, Mirma requests a loan of $250 that she will repay in three months to buy more merchandise. With your support, Mirma will reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mirma inicio su negocio ante la preocupación del futuro de sus hijos, porque sus 2 hijos están en la primaria y con lo que gana su marido no le alcanza, ellos desean que sus hijos en un futuro sean universitarios y sabia que con los ingresos de su esposo esto no podrá ser posible, para apoyarlo decidió adecuar en su casa un pequeño lugar para la venta de chatarra, y así apoyar en los gastos familiares. Gracias a su dedicación le ha ido bien.

Actualmente solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar más mercancía para su venta. Con tu apoyo ella lograra sus metas.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Ly Buth Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly B. is the leader of a group of six women in Krang Kontrorl Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a subsistence farmer and firewood seller. Mrs. Ly B. is 38 and the mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled in school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Yeon Arn, is a subsistence farmer and woodman. Aside from these business activities, Mrs. Ly B. sews palm leaves together serve as roof coverings, which she sells.

In her plantation business, Mrs. Ly B. faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy cows to work in the rice field. Thus, Mrs. Ly B. now is requesting a Kiva loan to buy cows to use as draft animals.

loans.use: To buy cows to use as draft animals.

loans.name: Afioga

texts.en:
Afioga M., 34, is married and has 2 children. She has worked for many years in the cocoa business. She sells to the villagers and public 4 days per week. She expects her weekly profits to be 350 Tala (about 145 USD).

Afioga is requesting her first loan from SPBD. She plans to use the loan to purchase sacks of cocoa beans, plastic cups, and bags for supplies to her generate more business. SPBD loans are Afioga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of cocoa beans, plastic cup, and bags for cocoa business

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Duong Thi T., since joining TYM in 1999, has achieved a lot of success in her business. In the beginning, with little capital, her family decide to invest in breeding pigs. After the first few loans, she realize it was the right decision and started to take out larger amount during the next cycles. Currently, she is also breeding buffalo and cows. The profit from this business has enable her to improve her family's standard of living. All of her children have grown up, have stable jobs and are helping the family in repaying the loan. This cycle, she would like to borrow 10 million VND to invest in to breeding pigs. Her family monthly income is around 5 million VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen , Kiva volunteer

Chị Dương Thị Thái, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương năm 1999 trải qua 9 năm tham gia vay vốn phát triển kinh tế, với số vốn ban đầu còn thấp nên gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn với mô hình nhỏ, qua 1 vòng vốn gia đình chị nhận thấy rằng việc vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi là rất phù hợp với nhà nông. Các vòng vốn sau gia đình chị đã mạnh giạn vay vốn ở mức cao đầu tư vào chăn nuôi với mô hình lớn hơn. Hiện nay gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn kết hợp cùng chăn nuôi trâu, bò sinh sản hàng năm cho thu nhập cao. Từ những thu nhập từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị đã mua sắm được nhiều trang thiết bị có giá trị trong gia đình, các con chị đều có công ăn việc làm ổn định phụ giúp gia đình trong việc hoàn trả vốn. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
Benedicta tiene 54 años, es divorciada, vive con tres de sus cuatro hijos, Denis de 21, Wilson de 17 y Fredy de 11, su hijo Santos de 28 ya está independizado y en planes de formar su propia  familia.
Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de productos andinos, como la papa, el chuño, entre otros, realiza esta actividad para mantener a sus hijos y poder darles una buena educación.Ella vende de forma ambulatoria por los diferentes mercados y calles de su distrito, durante las mañanas, que es cuando hay más venta. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es una labor tranquila, donde se siente cómoda, lo difícil es transportar los tubérculos por diferentes lugares, ya que son pesados.
Benedicta al ver a sus cuatro hijos, desea que sean profesionales y con un buen futuro.
Comprara con el dinero que se le facilite, más tubérculos y así aumentar la venta, en el futuro ella quiere poner otro tipo de negocio como una tienda de abarrotes o una ferretería.
texts.en:
Benedicta is 54 years old, divorced, and lives with three of her four children: Denis is 21 years old, Wilson 17, and Fredy 11. Her oldest son Santos is 28 years old, already lives on his own, and has plans to begin his own family. For the past 20 years Benedicta has worked selling products of the Andes such as potatoes and potato flour, among other items. She works in order to maintain her children and to give them a good education. She sells her products as a walking saleswoman in different markets and streets in her district. Benedicta works in the mornings, since that is when sales are good. She likes that her job offers calm work in locations where she feels comfortable. The difficulty involves transporting the tubers to different places, since the potatoes are heavy. When Benedicta looks at her four children, she hopes that they will become professionals and have a good future. With the money she receives she will purchase more tubers and thus increase her sales. In the future she would like to open a different type of business such as a grocery or hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more tubers to sell in various markets.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Quiindy, en el barrio San Lorenzo a distante a 20km de la Oficina de Carapeguá,unas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa,buscando un poco más de apoyo para fomentar a través del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida,Estas personas crecieron gracias a este programa.

Necesitan esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivas microempresas y lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual
texts.en:
In Quiindy city, in the San Lorenzo neighborhood located 20 km from the Carapeguá Office, some women who have few resources entered a committee program called “Mujeres Emprendedoras” where they decided to join together to receive information about the committee program, looking for a little more support to learn and grow their household income through the loans and improve their quality of life. These people have grown thanks to this program. They need an operating loan to invest in their respective microbusinesses and achieve a sustainable growth that will make them grow as a group and as an individual.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to resell, clothing, general store merchandise, groceries such as sugar, tea, flour, noodles, cookies, snacks, thread for sewing, etc.

loans.name: Sean

texts.en: Mrs. Sean S. lives in Romeat Village in the Takeo Province. She owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. She is a 42-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one is a construction worker. The youngest child is 16 years old and is still in school. Although Mrs. Sean S. and her children work, they still live in poor conditions. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Sean S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. This is the second time of Mrs. Sean S. has requested a loan in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Itohan

texts.en: Itohan N. is a fashion designer. She makes lovely designs for her customers. She needs the loan amount of N102,000 to purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell. Itohan is 23 years old and married with a child. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Mak

texts.en:
Mrs. Mak Y. is 49-years-old and lives in Kradas Khor village in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her field has infertile soil which affects her crop in a negative way. In order to have more success with her business, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to improve her crop yields.

Her husband, Mr. Chen Chim, owns a plow which he rents for income, to the villagers to plow their fields. Mrs. Mak Y. has a child who is a farmer. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and make her rice crop more productive.

loans.name: María Dora

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León, la señora María Dora B. se dedica a su negocio de salón de belleza habiendo aprendido este arte desde muy jovencita y al darse cuenta que tenía esta habilidad logró poner su negocio propio.

Es visitada por muchos clientes que hacen uso de sus servicios como lo son corte de cabello, limpieza fasial, tratos especiales con el cabello, entre otros. Hoy en día ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel por medio de la solicitud de un crédito para la compra de los productos de belleza y de esta forma continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
In León city María Dora B. has a beauty salon, having learned this profession at a young age and upon realizing that she had this ability she strived to open her own business. She is visited by many clients that use her services such as haircuts, facials, special hair treatments and more. Today she seeks the support from CEPRODEL through a loan that will enable her to buy beauty products and in this way continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Maisha Bora Group

texts.en:
Mtumwa has a small store of charcoal and firewood and has also been a fish seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for a year. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $550. Every day she works at her business for 14 hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal, firewood and fish for her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business and save money for future use.

Mtumwa is 47 years old, married, and has six children aged between 8 and 14. She also cares for three additional dependents.

Mtumwa will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Asha, Rukia and Salma. Each woman has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, firewood,and fish for her business.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 40 years old, married, and has 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She has a restaurant where she sells drinks and pepper soup. She is a LAPO client. Doris needs a loan of N60,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says "thanks" to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty es una mujer muy admirada por sus vecinos, a sus 24 años ya tiene un negocio propio, vive con su familia en la casa de sus padres y desea mejorar la vida que actualmente lleva. Ella es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por tener una vida mejor, tiene una pequeña carretilla donde vende sus golosinas, recorre las calles de Juliaca en busca de clientes que tengan ganas de endulzar su paladar y comprarle algo. Betty desea tener una tienda grande donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y vender sus golosinas con mayor tranquilidad, ya que lo que más le disgusta de su trabajo actual es tener que caminar por las calles sin descanso. Lleva 3 años en este negocio y hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien porque le gusta vender y atender bien a sus clientes, ya que sabe que de ellos depende el éxito de su negocio. Ahora ha decidido empezar a vender comida en las afueras de su casa, motivo por el cual solicita este crédito. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Betty con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de socias, ya que es muy alegre.
texts.en:
Betty is a woman who is very admired by her neighbors and at 24 years of age she already has her own business. She lives with her family in her parents' house and she wishes to improve the life that she currently lives. She is woman who has always struggled to have a better life. She has a small cart where she sells her sweets. She travels through the streets of Juliaca in search of customers who want to satisfy their sweet tooth and buy something from her. Betty wishes to have a big store to better serve her customers and sell her sweets with greater tranquility, as walking through the streets without rest is what she most dislikes about her current work. She has been in this business for 3 years and until now it has gone very well for her because she likes to sell and serve her clients well, as she knows that the success of her business depends on them. Now she has decided to sell food outside of her business, which is why she is applying for this loan. This is Betty's fourth loan with MFP and she has always been very punctual in her payments and hope to be so now as well. In the communal bank she is very loved by the rest of the members as she is very happy.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital to start a business selling food

loans.name: Antonino Jury

texts.en:
Antonio Jury A. of Maikay, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, is single and engaged in the meat selling business. 
Fifteen years ago, he worked in his sister-in-law's meat shop as an assistant. He was the one assigned to canvass hogs for cheaper prices.
Years later, he decided to make his own business, bearing all the experiences he had gathered. In God's time, he was able to rent a stall and to start up his own meat shop. Along his way, he encountered a financial dilemma. A friend shared Paglaum MPC's programs and services and the benefits for the members. He decided to become a member and avail the loan credit to have additional capital for the meat shop.

loans.use: To gain additional capital for the meat shop

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil has been selling birds for four years. Khalil is a 43-year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their six children. Khalil has requested a loan of $1000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase birds and bird food. This is the first time that Khalil has requested a loan.

Khalil has the only business of this type in his region. His clients are friends and neighbors. He hasn't faced any difficulties since he first started his business. Khalil decided on this business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase birds and bird food

loans.name: Agaqadir

texts.en:
Agaqadir M. is a 48-year-old man who sells honey in the small village of Agsu. He started his business when he was 20, continuing his family business. It is very hard and dangerous work but Agaqadir adores his bees and his job in general.

As it is the only one source of income for his family, Agaqadir makes the best honey in his village. He is married and has three sons and dreams to provide his all sons with higher education. Agaqadir has a good income from honey sales because this product is very popular among Azerbaijani people.

Agaqadir applied for a $1500 loan in order to improve his bee keeping conditions and purchase new beehives.

loans.use: To purchase new beehives

loans.name: Jilka Mery

texts.es: La sra. Jilka se dedica al negocio desde muy jovencita, lo inició su mamá y ahora ella se hace cargo, vende tucumanas ( empanadas de carne y huevo) en la puerta del mercado, y dentro del mercado en el puesto de su mamá venden, junto a su hermana ropa, regalos, juguetes y cosméticos, son muy conocidas por la zona, su casita queda cerca del puesto y viven ahí la sra. Jilka, con sus hermanas y su mamá, se colaboran y se apoyan, son muy unidas. Es una cliente muy responsable y puntual, el crédito será invertido en la compra de víveres par las tucumanas y en regalos y ropa ya que se acerca el día de la madre.
texts.en:
Jilka has worked in her business since she was very young. Her mother started the business, and now Jilka is in charge of it. She sells tucumanas (fried pastry stuffed with meat and egg) at the entrance to the market. At her mother’s stand inside the market she and her sister sell clothes, presents, toys, and cosmetics. They are very well known in the zone. Her small house is close to their stand. Jilka lives there with her sisters and her mother. They collaborate and support each other; they are very united. She is a very responsible and punctual client. The loan will be used to buy supplies for the tucumanas, presents, and clothes because Mother’s Day is coming.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and merchandise for Mother's Day

loans.name: Sébastien

texts.fr: F. Sébastien  est né vers 1983 à Avrankou dans le Département de l’Ouémé. Sébastien est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants dont un (01) seul est scolarisé. Sébastien réside avec sa famille à Amouloko dans la Commune de Akpro Missérété toujours dans le Département de l’Ouémé.  Sébastien est couturier. Mais les moyens dont dispose Sébastien actuellement ne lui permettent pas de développer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients dont le nombre ne cesse de croitre. C’est pourquoi Sébastien sollicite un crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sébastien F. was born around 1983 in Avrankou, in the Ouémé Department. He's married and the father of 4 children, out of which only one attends school. Sébastien lives with his family in Amouloko, in the city of Apro Missérété, in the Ouémé Department. He's a tailor. The financial means he has currently do not enable him to bolster his business to meet an ever-increasing customer demand. This is why Sébastien is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, Alidé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an overlock machine

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Chhin C. N. is an older woman living in the province of Kompong Cham, Cambodia. She is married with two children, all of whom are married and have already started new homes. Her husband helps be responsible for the family by driving a horse-and-cart taxi.

Chhin C. N. plants various crops to earn a living. Due to this coming farming season, the heavy rains are still falling. She is looking for a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL and will use this money to grow rice and vegetable crops.

loans.use: To grow rice and vegetable crops

loans.name: Ebeyeyie Group

texts.en:
Michael is thirty-six years old and married with four children (all boys), all of whom are currently in school. He is a hard-working young man who provides for his family. Michael started his business six years ago, selling soft drinks of all kinds. Through his work he is well known by many who have purchased from his rented shop. Usually he gets his inventory from companies like Coca-Cola, Pepsi, and the like. He wants a loan to buy a larger assortment of soft drinks to upgrade his inventory.

Because of his commitment and availability Michael was chosen as the group leader of a trust bank group called ‘Ebeyeyie’ which literally means "it shall be well". He is the one in the middle in the group photograph. The other members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and thus experience peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of soft drinks.

loans.name: Futha United Group

texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs is seeking a loan of Le 3,200,000 in order to expand their businesses. They call their group "Furtha United." This is the fourth loan these entrepreneurs have borrowed from SMT/Kiva. With the help of previous loans, these women were able to improve their businesses. They were able to increase the size and quality of their businesses, thereby improving sales and profits. As a result of SMT/Kiva loans, they are now in a much better position to assist their school-going children.

Aminata T. is the leader of this group. She was born in Magburaka thirty-five years ago. She is married and has four children, all of whom attend schools. Aminata sells market food and has been in this business for more than five years. Aminata will use this loan to add more food items to her stall.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Jesus Del Pilar

texts.es:
Jesús del Pilar es una persona emprendedora y que lucha por sus ideales. Tiene 30 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida, prepara platos como arroz con pollo, tallarines, Juanes (arroz envuelta en hoja), guiso de majas y vende a los trabajadores de una empresa maderera.
Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él es maestro afilador y también se dedica a la venta de madera de la especie tornillo. 
Jesús forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Productivas” desde hace una año. Ella empezó con un préstamo de 300 soles, en la actualidad requiere un crédito de 1,500 soles , el cual invertirá en la compra de madera, negocio que tiene junto a su esposo.

La meta de Jesús del Pilar es terminar de construir su casa, así como también contribuir con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Jesus del Pilar is an enterprising person who struggles for her ideals. She is 30 years old and the mother of 3 children. She dedicates her time to selling meals, preparing plates such as chicken and rice, noodles, rice wrapped in a leaf, and stew. She sells the meals to the workers at a lumber company. She can count on help from her husband, who is a master tool sharpener and also sells tornillo wood. Jesus del Pilar has belonged to the “Productive Women” Community Bank for a year. She began with a loan of $105. Now she needs a loan of $525, to buy wood for the business she has with her husband. Jesus del Pilar's goal is to finish building her house and to continue to contribute to paying family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY TORNILLO WOOD TO SELL

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en: Betty K. chairs a loan group located in Mukono. She is a married and has three children, all of whom are in secondary school, and is also raising her late sister’s child. For the last four years, she has made a living selling spare car parts from a garage in Seeta. She buys these parts in Kampala, and works with her husband to resell them to local customers. Betty is happy to chair her lending group and own a business that is doing well, thanks to the help of previous loans. She needs a new loan to expand her business by buying more spare parts to sell.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Mrs. Lim U., 56, and her husband, Tep Heang, 52, were married in 1979. They have seven children; six sons and one daughter. One of them was married and lives in separated house and two children have full-time employment. he family lives approximately thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Lim sells ice and fruits in front of her house. In the past, she sold vegetable. Her husband has been a construction worker for more than ten years. Besides of the business, he is a motor taxi driver as well. Unhappily, his old motorbike breaks down and doesn’t work properly which upset his business.
Hence Lim is requesting a loan of $300 to help her husband to purchase new motorbike for replacing the old one.

loans.use: To help her husband to purchase new motorbike for replacing the old one.

loans.name: Ronquillo

texts.en: Mr. Ronquillo S. is a hard-working farmer. He is 56 years old. According to him, his farming is flowing smoothly but he’s still lacking additional inputs. He joined CEVI a year ago and he likes the monthly amortization. He said there was enough time for him to save up for the next month’s payment. Ronquillo is currently requesting a loan of PHP 7,000. This loan will surely help him grow his farm immensely.

loans.use: To purchase inputs for his farm

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
"Perseverance and patience are the weapons needed to attain success in life," says Jocelyn S.. She is 27 years old and still single. Jocelyn has strong determination in life – that’s why she is doing everything to provide for her family. She is an operator of a tricycle in her village.

Jocelyn is asking for financial assistance from Kiva lenders for the maintenance of her tricycle. She is requesting 5,000 Philippine pesos as additional capital to improve her passengered tricycle. Jocelyn is hoping that she can obtain the amount she is requesting for security in case she gets weak. She hopes and prays that she can improve her way of life through the income she can generate with her passengered tricycle.

loans.use: Additional capital for her tricycle maintenance

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is married to her loving husband Elmer M., and their marriage was blessed with two children, Jun- jun, who is 32 years old and a company driver, and Jason, who is 24 and a factory worker in South Korea. Their house is along the highway, located in Ramona, Angadanan, Isabela.

Editha has been operating a general store for almost thirty years now. Her daily net income is about $2.30 a day. She is also a gasoline retailer. She decided to ask again for a loan amounting to Php 13,000, because she wants to purchase more commodities to sell. She would also like to expand her business for a better income, and to have a bountiful life.

loans.use: To purchase more commodities to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nieves María

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Nieves S. se dedica muy arduamente a su actividad veterinaria donde oferta todo tipo de medicamentos para animales comercializados a diario por ella misma desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.
Ella se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y hoy en día ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para invertirlo en la compra de los medicamentos para animales con el fin de ofertarlos en su veterinaria y de esta manera continuar mejorando las condiciones de su actividad y por ende la de su familia en el departamento de León.
texts.en:
Nieves S. works arduously as a veterinarian in the León department. She offers all types of medication for animals. She sells them herself every day from very early in the morning until the late afternoon. She stands out as being a very hard-working person. She is now asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy the medications for animals to be able to sell them in her veterinary business. This way she will continue to improve her work conditions and, therefore, her family’s condition in the León department.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medication for her veterinary business

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet O. is a widow living with three of her grandchildren in Malanga village, Busia district. She is also the sole owner of a business of selling deep-fried fish. She is also venturing into small-scale tea planting.

Violet is a formal civil service servant, and her future dream is to guarantee education for the young ones with whom she lives. She would like a loan of 20,000 KES, which she says she will invest in the fish business and also start a grocery stall right next to her frying place at the market. This, she says, increases her chance for more profit which will go to pay the school fees for one of her grandchildren.

loans.use: Increase stock and venture into grocery sellilng.

loans.name: Joaquín

texts.es:
El señor Joaquín T. tiene ya más de siete años dedicándose a la venta de artículos de piel. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía y desea vendré juguetes y ropa por la temporada navideña, ya que es muy buena inversión por que sus clientes le están solicitando que tenga estos productos a la venta.  
Con las ganancias de la inversión planea pagar el crédito ya que los gastos familiares los cubrirá su esposa con el ingreso de otro local que tiene ella.
texts.en:
Joaquín T. has had a business selling items made of leather for more than 7 years. His business needs a greater variety of merchandise. He would like to sell toys and clothing for the Christmas season, since this makes a very good investment as his customers are requesting that he have these items for sale. With the earnings from the investment, he plans to pay off the loan as his household expenses will be covered by his wife with income that she earns in another place.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in the business: to buy toys and clothing

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y vive con tres de sus cinco hijos en el sector Santo Domingo de la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace 20 años a la venta de golosinas en un kiosko ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Lambayeque. Ella dedica a esta actividad la mayor parte de su tiempo diario ya que es la principal fuente de sustento con que cuenta su familia. El negocio de Elvira es muy frecuentado debido a la calidad de los productos que ofrece y al trato amable con que atiende a sus clientes.

La continua demanda por los productos que ofrece han hecho que piense en ampliar su negocio con la compra de más golosinas, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, es por ello que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Elvira es una madre de familia trabajadora y responsable. Sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman mucho. Su más grande anhelo es seguir ampliando su negocio hasta llegar a convertirse en distribuidora de golosinas.
texts.en:
Elvira is 54 years old. She is married and lives with three of her five children in the Santo Domingo neighborhood in the city of Lambayeque, located 20 minutes outside of the city of Chiclayo.

For the past 20 years, she has sold sweets and snacks at a kiosk located in central Lambayeque. She spends the majority of her day working at her business. The snack stand is the primary source of income for her family. Elvira's business is very popular due to the high-quality products and the friendly service she provides her clients.

The continual demand for her products has led her to consider expanding her business. Elvira would like to buy more merchandise, but she does not have sufficient capital to make these purchases. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 600 nuevos soles ($225) with Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal. This is her first time borrowing from Edpyme Alternativa.

Elvira is the mother of a hardworking and responsible family. Her neighbors and friends think highly of her. Her dream is to continue expanding her business until she can become a wholesale retailer of snack food items.


Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase snack merchandise to expand her business

loans.name: Zeleh Group

texts.en:
Varbah H. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Zeleh.  She is 46 years old, single, and has three children aged 12, 18, and 29.  One is in 5th grade, another is in 10th grade, and the other is in 12th grade.  In addition to her children, Varbah also supports her parents.

Varbah has a charcoal and dry goods business at the Waterside Market which is the largest market in Monrovia. Varbah provides high quality customer care, which keeps customers returning.

Varbah plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 27,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more charcoal and used goods.  She hopes that this loan will help her grown her business and allow her to import goods from other countries.  She also hopes that she will empower her children to go into business as well.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Varbah is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and dry goods for resale

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas V., age 51, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in the agriculture sector raising pigs, earning an income of approximately US$ 2 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education. She has had this business since 1999. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of US$ 1.5 per day. Their standard of living has improved since V. has started her business, so she wants a loan to expand her business. V. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more pigs and pig food. This is her second loan from Kiva partner CREDIT. (V. is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig food.

loans.name: Mbène

texts.fr: Mbène D. est une femme de 58 ans et mère de 4 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIONGO depuis décembre 2006 et a bénéficié de 6 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine et la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide pour la consommation alimentaire. Elle participe activement à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mbène D. is a 58 year-old woman, and mother of four children she supports. She has been a member of the Diongo credit association since December 2006. She has benefited from six loans that she has always well managed and repaid regularly. Her work consists of fattening sheep and processing and selling peanut oil for food consumption. She is an active participant in improving the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep to fatten and peanuts

loans.name: Rosandra Maria

texts.es: Rosandra María tiene 37 años de edad y  Tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ella. La actividad económica es un taller de costura. Hace más de 22 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella inicio este negocio por la necesidad de salir adelante por lo que siempre se preocupa por proporcionarle a sus clientes lo que ellos le solicitan con sus preñadas. Ella se levanta muy temprano pues al día tiene 2 o 5 pedidos. Es así que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de tijeras, tela, hilo, botones, agujas y encajes. Ella desea seguir adelante con este medio de vida que es lo único que tiene para sobrevivir.
texts.en:
Rosa is 37 years old and has three children that are dependents. She works as a seamstress. For more than 22 years she has been working in this business. She began this business in order to progress. She is always worried about providing for her customers’ needs. She gets up very early as each day she has between two and five requests for her services. This is why she is asking for a loan for working capital, which she will use to buy scissors, thread, fabric, buttons, needles and lace. Rosa hopes to progress in this line of work which is the only way that she has to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: D.c. Primary School, Lunsar Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from the D.C. Primary School in Lunsar, a small town in northern Sierra Leone. This school was opened in 1988. This is the first loan this school is accessing from Kiva through SMT. School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in a business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

59-year-old Edward B. K. (pictured left) is the headmaster at the school and has been a teacher for 40 years. He was born in Lunsar and is married with six children who are now adults and on their own. Edward will use his share of the loan to buy house equipment and pieces of furniture.

(Attached to this photo are some snapshots of borrowers who were not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy house equipment and pieces of furniture

loans.name: Lisseth Del Carmen

texts.es: La solicitante es una artesana de la elaboración y venta de quesillos del municipio de Nagarote, los cuales elabora en su casa todos los días y sale a vender diariamente a Managua, saliendo por las mañana a los colegios y hospitales, regresando por la tarde una ves finalizada su venta. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de productos de su negocio, para aumentar sus ventas y obtener mayores ganancias y utilidades.
texts.en:
La solicitante es una artesana de la elaboración y venta de quesillos del municipio de Nagarote, los cuales elabora en su casa todos los días y sale a vender diariamente a Managua, saliendo por las mañana a los colegios y hospitales, regresando por la tarde una ves finalizada su venta. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de productos de su negocio, para aumentar sus ventas y obtener mayores ganancias y utilidades.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de queso, crema, cebolla, vinagre y bolsas

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter started wheat farming in 2000. He is 34 and married to Christine Nkosira. They have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He applied for a first loan of Kshs 35,000 which he repaid on time. He plans to use the new loan amount to buy fertilizer and pesticide for the wheat in his farm. Peter hopes to buy his own tractor in the future to use on his own farm and also get extra income by hiring it out to other farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for his wheat

loans.name: Lolini

texts.en: Lolini T. is 64 and married with four children. She owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale and has three years of experience in this business. Lolini needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone. She plans to use the earnings from her business, estimated to be 650 talas (approximately USD 260) per week, to improve and expand her business. In 2009, Lolini joined SPBD and this is her 2nd loan. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone

loans.name: Humble Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is currently the group leader of 'Humble Trust' bank group made up of 10 members. Elizabeth is a lovely and hard-working woman.
