She is 48 years old and sells kente cloth to customers in her community. She also engages in farming to supplement her income. She has been selling kente cloth for 21 years and is eager to be taking out this loan. She plans to invest the loan to purchase a variety of kente cloth to meet customers’ demand. 

Kente cloth is a famous richly woven traditional fabric of single or multiple colors usually worn on special occasions like festivals, parties, outdoor events, and other social gatherings. This has created a market for women like Elizabeth.

Elizabeth is married to a tailor and she is the mother of four children from age 5-15 years. She says that she dreams of being able to generate enough profit so that she will be able to support her first and second children through university and nursing training respectively.

loans.use: To purchase kente cloth in bulk

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sitha P. (pictured with her son) is a 45-year-old widow with four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of them are married and live outside the family home. One of her children is a construction worker, another one attends school and another is still young. The family lives about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sitha has been a garment-factory worker for three years. She wants to renovate the house where she lives, but she does not have money. Therefore, she is applying for her first loan in the amount of $800 to use for her project.

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Silvia Morena

texts.es: Silvia Morena S. C. de 30 años de edad, es una joven muy trabajadora, la cual desea poder ampliar su negocio, incrementado la cantidad de variedad de productos. Ella vive junto a su esposo quien es empleado de una empresa privada, así mismo vive junto a sus cuatro hijos de 14, 13, 7 y 4 años de edad. Silvia posee una venta de cosméticos, cremas para el cabello y cuerpo, perfumes, lociones, shampoo, colas para el cabello y ganchos. Su negocio esta ubicado a las afueras del mercado municipal de Izalco, ubicado en el departamento de Sonsonate, en donde cuenta con muy buena ubicación debido a que muchas personas prefieren comprarle a ella sus productos en lugar de entrar al mercado, esta es una zona muy transitada durante todo el día y sobretodo en los fines de semana en donde sus ventas se incrementan. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo de contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería, aumentando la cantidad de maquillajes y de esta forma ofrecer diferentes precios, así mismo comprar cremas para el cuerpo, lo cual es lo que posee mayor cantidad de demanda. Esto llena de mucha ilusión ya que espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Silvia Morena S. C. is 30 years of age and a hardworking young woman. She wants to expand her business and offer a wider variety of products. Silvia lives with her husband, who works for a private company, and their four children (ages 14, 13, 7, and 4). She has a vending post where she sells cosmetics, hair and body crèmes, perfumes, lotions, shampoos, hair extensions, and hair clips. Her business is located outside of the municipal market in Izalco, which is in the Department of Sonsonate. This is a very good location since the area is busy throughout the day and people prefer to buy products from her instead of going into the market. Her sales increase on the weekends.

Silvia is requesting a loan so that she can have the necessary funds to buy more merchandise. She wants to increase her inventory of makeup so that she can offer products at various price points. In addition, she will buy body crèmes that are in high demand. Silvia has great enthusiasm and hopes to improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Evelin Elizabeth

texts.es: Evelin Elizabeth D. C. de 28 años de edad, es una joven muy trabajadora y con grandes ganas de salir adelante, vive en el departamento de Ahuachapán, junto a su madre y sus dos hijos, el mayor de 7 años de edad y el menor de un mes de vida. Evelin posee una venta de frutas a las afueras del mercado regional de Ahuachapán, uno de los más grandes de este departamento, este negocio ha estado ubicado desde hace muchos años atrás en ese mismo sitio, ya que era de su madre, evelin cuenta con 10 años de vender en este lugar, mientras su madre se dedica a cuidar a los niños y a los quehaceres del hogar, de esta manera Evelin ha logrado brindarles todo lo necesario a su familia, trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, en la espera de realizar la mayor cantidad de ventas posibles. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo de comprar mayor cantidad y variedad de frutas,  ya que ella comercializa por mayor y así mismo por unidad, lo que le permite contar con muchas ventas. Evelin desea mejorar sus ganancias, ya que ella es la única que posee trabajo en su hogar, es por ello que debe optimizar su servicio y de esta forma obtener más clientes.
texts.en:
Evelin sells fruit outside of the regional market in Ahuachapán, which is one of the biggest in this department. This business has been located in the same place for many years because it was her mother’s. Evelin has been selling is this place for ten years, and her mother takes care of the children and the household chores. This has made it possible for Evelin to provide her family with the necessities. She works from eight in the morning until six in the evening. She does this hoping to make the most sales possible. She is requesting a loan in the hopes of buying a greater quantity and variety of fruit. She sells wholesale, and she also sells individual pieces of fruit. This allows her to have a lot of sales. Evelin wants to improve her income because she is the only one in her household who has work. She needs to optimize her service in order to get more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of oil, more bags of rice and pepper

loans.name: Héctor Danilo

texts.es: El Sr. Héctor Danilo R. V. es trabajador activo de la  Empresa WACKENHUT tiene  DOS  años de trabajarle a esta institución desempeñándose como supervisor de guarda de seguridad es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para comprar materiales de construcción y mejorar su casa de habitación los créditos le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Héctor Danilo R. V. is an active worker at the Wackenhut Corporation. He has been working at this institution for two years as supervisor of security watch. He is currently married. He has had two loans with CEPRODEL and he has used each one to purchase construction materials and make improvements to the house where he lives. The loans have been of great benefit to him since, as a result, he has improved his living condition and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sand, cement, gravel, and labor.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn L., 47, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples. L. is a housewife while her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 7 per day.  L. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase fertilizer to improver her family farm. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy fertilizer to improve the family farm

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia D. is a 54-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two businesses: a general store and a fish vending business. She lives in  Brgy. Camalobalo, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 13,000. Bonifacia is now borrowing PHP 27,000 so that she  could  purchase more stock to sell.   This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 27,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Bonifacia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins L. began working with cars at a very young age with his father who was a mechanic. In fact, he required Collins to help him with car repairs as a means of discipline when his son got into any sort of trouble.

Collins says, “What started as a punishment turned into a profession.” Collins had repaired cars for over 30 years at several different corporations in New Orleans when, a year ago, he decided to pursue his dream of starting his own business, L. Automotives. His wife, Helen, had already started a daycare facility at the same time Collins started his car shop. They used their savings and investments to make their start-ups successful.

With only one employee, Collins is very busy. He juggles between answering the phones, helping walk-in customers, and repairing cars. The recent oil spill in New Orleans has not helped his situation because many of his customers were laid off so they stopped spending their money even on car tune-ups and repairs. One of Collins main services is changing oil and the oil prices have increased.

Collins plans to stock up on car parts with the loan: brake pads, tires, etc. Collins says, “I can’t spend as much money as I used to because it all goes back into the business. Even though being self-employed has its ups and downs, working for yourself is always worth it.”

loans.use: Car Parts: tires, brake pads, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza De Los Ángeles

texts.es: La señora Esperanza M. es trabajadora de la alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña en el área de barrido de calles es madre y padre de tres niños los cuales estudian y ella lucha por sacarlos adelante tiene años de trabajar en dicha empresa y ha sacado seis financiamientos los que los ha invertido en su casa y para gastos personales como compra de televisor  para que sus niños tengan un medio de distracción ella siente que con estos créditos ella ha superado bastante y que poco a poco ha sacado a su hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Esperanza M. is an employee of the City of Chinandega and works as a street sweeper. She has had to be both mother and father to her three children who are in school. Esperanza struggles to get ahead. She has worked with CEPRODEL over the years and has received six loans that were invested into her home and used for personal expenses, such as the purchase of a television so that her children could have a means of distraction.

She feels the loans have helped her overcome and enabled her to gradually move her children forward.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Nhem N., 56, is married and lives with his wife and three children in the Takeo province. He is a moto-taxi driver, making US$4 of profit a day. His wife raises chickens and grows rice. On average, she makes US$4 per day. This couple also recieves support from three children who work in a garment factory. 

Nhem N. is asking for a loan of US$1200 to purchase a trailer to attach with his motorbike. With a trailer attachment, he will hopefully earn more income to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer.

loans.name: Emmalyn

texts.en:
Emmalyn T. is from the village of Libertad, Gingoog City. She is 23 years old. Emmalyn is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Emmalyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, toothpaste and snack foods in the local community. Emmalyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Emmalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emmalyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emmalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to buy and sell

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a divorced woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over ten years, she has owned rental houses. Her potential customers are neighbours and tenants. In addition, she sells fresh water, which contributes to her income. Rehema faces a major challenge of delayed payments of rent by her tenants. She hopes to open more businesses in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase cement and sand to renovate her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase cement and sand to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y la menor de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde niña ha estado siempre ligada a las actividades agrícolas, proviene de una familia netamente agrícola y ganadera,  todas estas lecciones de vida han hecho de ella ejerza de una manera eficiente en sus campos de cultivo dedicándose a sembrar papa, maíz y verduras. Así mismo ella cría vacas y para ellas cultiva la alfalfa, años tras años gracias a esta actividad puede sostener a su familia y ser una protagonista en su manutención junto a su esposo que ahora también la apoya en estas actividades. A pesar de que en años anteriores a perdido totalmente su cosecha y ganancia cuando cayó sobre sus campos de cultivo la helada, esto no la desanimó y sigue adelante. Para este año Domitila sembrará más verduras así como también espera la cosecha de papa y maíz. En adelante desea mejorar la productividad de sus cosechas. Es el su crédito número 7 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para la siembra de verduras, alfalfa y papa.
texts.en: Domitila is 46 years old. She lives with her husband and the youngest of their three children in their own house. Since she was a child, she has been involved in agricultural activities as she is from a family of farmers and ranchers. All of these life lessons have made her good at working on the land. She now cultivates potatoes, corn and vegetables. She also raises cows and the alfalfa that they eat. For years and years, thanks to this work, she has been able to support her family and also be a companion, with her husband, in the performance of these activities. In spite of the fact that, in previous years, they have lost all of their harvest and earnings because of a freeze that fell over the countryside, this didn’t deter them and they are moving forward. This year Domitila is growing more vegetables and also she is awaiting the corn and potato harvest. For the future she would like to improve the outcome of her harvests. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is very glad to know she has the support of this financial organization. She is also grateful to be part of this community bank as all of the members are people that she knows. They are very responsible and supportive. She is thankful for the people that offer her the loan that she is requesting as it will be very helpful in her economic progress. With this loan that she is requesting, she will buy bags of fertilizer in order to grow vegetables, alfalfa and potatoes

loans.use: She will buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn D. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Jocelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, detergent powder and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $136 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and biscuits. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & biscuits

loans.name: Ya Aminata

texts.en:
This is 49 year-old Ya Aminata K.. She is married and has 4 children, ages 6, 9, 15 and 18. She has two additional dependents who live with her because she helps to educate them. 

In 2007, Ya Aminata established her palm oil business because she wanted to help her husband finance the education of their children. Working six days a week and six hours a day, she earns about SLL 700,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000 in order to add stock, to increase her profits. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 200,000. In the future, Ya Aminata plans to sell in larger quantities to traders in town and in the capital, Freetown. She wants to travel, to sell internationally in order to earn more profit and she would also like to hire workers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is an potato farmer and owns a maize mill.  He would like a loan to buy another maize mill.  He is charged with the responsibility of taking care of his six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He desires to educate his children and expand his business. However, mechanical breakdowns and climate changes are affecting his businesses.

loans.use: To buy a maize mill

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a married woman who lives in Manapla, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a furniture-making business.  Her husband Amado, who is 48 years old, works as a furniture maker to earn his living. They have three children who are 18 to 21 years old. Mila joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mila has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 35,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 45,000 to purchase furniture materials so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her children's educations. Mila is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more materials

loans.name: Noris Teresa

texts.es: Noris A. de 53 años es una habitante del barrio Ciudadela Metropolitana,  proyecto de autoconstrucción  liderado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace mas de 20 años. Ella se dedica a l oficio de la confección, como es tradicional en su historia familiar, aptitud que se hizo mas notoria,  dese que compró su primera máquina y empezó su vida en la costura, como una actividad generadora de ingresos, con la que no solo se distaría y alegraba su vida, sino que  apoyaba la gestión de su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y su hijo actualmente en la edad de 21 años. Esta idea de ser ella misma su “patrona” le gustó a Noris y por eso decidió hacerla crecer, así fue como acudió a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo , organización con la que logró aumentar el volumen de sus compras y tener inventarios de productos de confecciones que ofrecer permanentemente a sus clientes. Este es su segundo financiamiento, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos como hilos, botones, telas en general, correderas, y pellones. Con su credikiva logrará aumentar su capital de trabajo aun mas,  y también resolver sus desafíos asociados a la competencia de ropa extranjera desde el país vecino país de Panamá. Ella prevee que apoyada en sus financiamientos puede comprar en mayor cantidad con mejores precios y obtener telas e insumos mas modernos y de mayor calidad, y sacar una producción  con la que aspira a seguir sosteniendo su margen de utilidad que está en un36%.
texts.en:
Noris A. is 53 years old and lives in Ciudadela Metropolitana neighborhood, a self-build project started by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo more than 20 years ago.  Noris has a dressmaking business.  This skill is traditional in her family and hers became evident when she bought her first sewing machine and started working in the sewing business as a way of making income.  This work was not only enjoyable but also enabled her to support her household which is made up of her husband and her son who is currently 21 years old.  Noris liked the idea of being her own boss and so she decided to grow her business by taking her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With their help, she managed to increase her purchase volume and ensure that she permanently had products in stock to offer her customers.

This is Noris' second loan and she will use it to buy raw materials and supplies such as threads, buttons, general fabrics, zippers and fleece.  With the help of her Kiva loan, she will manage to increase her working capital even more and meet challenges associated with competition from foreign clothes coming from the neighboring country of Panama.  She predicts that with the support of her loans she will be able to buy in larger quantities, obtaining better prices and more modern and better-quality fabrics and supplies.  She will achieve a level of production that she hopes will enable her to continue maintaining her profit margin of 36%.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies such as threads, buttons, general fabrics, zippers and fleece

loans.name: Felicia Mirella

texts.en:
Felicia is 27 years old, single and does not have any children. She lives with her parents in a house that they own. They are located in the district of Olmos, an agricultural area with considerable commercial activity. Olmos is in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour and a half outside the city of Chiclayo.

For the past two years, Felicia has been working for her municipality. She also manages a business in which she sells beauty products such as make-up and perfumes. She sells her products from her home and she also visits some of her customers in nearby villages. Felicia already has an established customer base in the area. She wishes to expand her business with the purchase of additional merchandise and beauty products. For this reason, she has requested a loan of 2000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Felicia is a hard-working, responsible woman. She is a recurring client with Edpyme Alternativa and always repays her loans punctually.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Katussenvule Development Group

texts.en: T. Lilian, 50, with raised hand, is a poultry farmer based in Namiliya-Lugazi. She has been engaged in this business for the past 18 years. Previously this mother of five was in agro sales and farming. Monthly her business makes profits of shillings 200,000 and she says with this loan she is going to purchase more mash for her poultry. She is affiliated with Katussenvule Development Group.

loans.use: To purchase more chicken mash for her poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 4 bales of second hand shoes.

loans.name: Vannesa

texts.es:
Los deseos de Vannesa de progresar han sido el motor que la impulsan a trabajar día a día en su propio negocio, venta de mercancía, la cual se ha convertido de gran ayuda puesto que para poder continuar con sus estudios al mismo tiempo debe generar ingresos debido a que su familia no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para apoyarla en su proceso formativo. 

Con apenas 20 años, Vannesa es una luchadora y aunque sus jornadas son extenuantes porque además de dedicar el tiempo necesario a su estudio para cumplir con los trabajos y demás actividades, al culminar su jornada debe dedicarse a sus ventas, pues es la única manera de materializar su sueño de ser profesional y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Aunque en sus compañeros de estudio y profesores, Vannesa encuentra clientes potenciales, normalmente debe rebuscarse nuevos clientes para generar ingresos mensuales. 

Actualmente Vannesa necesita de un préstamo para empezar a implementar nuevos productos en su negocio, esta vez desea iniciar con la venta de relojes debido a que frecuentemente sus clientes se lo piden, así logrará incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Vannesa’s wish to progress has been the motor that pushes her to work daily in her own business: merchandise sales.  It has turned out to be of great use because it allows her to continue with her schooling while earning income since her family does not have the necessary resources to help her during her formative process.

At the mere age of 20, Vannesa is a fighter and, although her days are exhausting because beside having to dedicate time to her studies to do all her assignments and other activities, at the end of the day she has to dedicate herself to her sales because this is the only way of making her dream of becoming a professional a reality and to improve her quality of life.  Although she finds potential customers among her classmates and teachers, she must still seek out new customers to generate monthly income.

Vannesa needs a loan now to start adding new items to her business.  This time she wants to start selling watches because her customers frequently request them.  She will thus increase her income.

loans.use: to buy watches.

loans.name: Phard

texts.en: Phard, age 46, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. Phard sells vegetables, earning an income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her daughter who is a tailor. She earns an income of $3 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Phard has had this business. She is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for her children to transport and sell recyclable materials. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport recyclable materials

loans.name: Theora

texts.en:
Theora is a 22-year-old woman who lives in the Paynesville area. She stopped her education at the six grade level and has one child who was attending school and had to drop out because she had no tuition.

For eight years she has been running a local food center where she sells delicious Liberian dishes. She has a lot of customers and the food finishes very early. 

Theora is requesting a loan to purchase red oil drums to sell in the local market. She plans to buy land and build a house on it in the near future for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase red oil drums to sell in the local market

loans.name: Olivia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Olivia cuenta con su propio negocio una pulperia  que administra hace doce años, el cual ha venido invirtiendo con ganancias y prestamos a plazos que Afodenic ha otorgado en cuatro ciclos.
Tiene el apoyo de sus esposo quien labora como carpintero, a si mismo el apoyo de sus dos hijos que ayudan en la venta.
Con este nuevo prestamo Olivia desea comprar una variedad de productos para obtener mejores ventas como: productos, lacteos, carne, pollo, productos de leche de pote, productos enlatados, productos de limpieza para casa, gaseosa, refrescos, golosinas, siendo lo de mas demanda. como planes es seguir creciendo para el bienestar comun de la familia y que junto Afodenic espera lograrlo para un porvenir mejor.
texts.en:
Olivia has her own business, a general store, that she has run for 12 years. She has been investing her earnings and loans from Afodenic in this store through 4 loan cycles. Olivia has the help of her husband who works as a carpenter, plus the help of her 2 sons who help in sales.

With this new loan Olivia wishes to buy a variety of products to obtain better sales, such as milk products, meat, chicken, bottled or canned milk, canned goods, house cleaning products, soft drinks, and sweets, which are most in demand. Olivia's plan is to continue growing for the common good of her family, and together with Afodenic, she hopes to achieve this for a better future.

loans.use: buy products such as meat, chicken, canned milk, snacks, and soft drinks, among others, to maintain her high-margin sales.

loans.name: Jannette

texts.en: Jannette is 23 years old and has three children who are ages 1 to 6 years old. Her husband is a farmer. Jeannette has been selling food stuffs for the past six years and her business is going well. This business has enabled Jannette to educate her eldest child. Jannette needs a loan to buy more food stuffs such as beans in order to make more profits. She plans to continue paying her child’s school fees and make some savings.

loans.use: to buy beans and other food stuffs for sale.

loans.name: Pacifica

texts.es:
La señora Pacifica es socia del banco comunal Las orquídeas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos, todos mayores de edad e independientes.
Para iniciar su negocio ha tenido que acudir a los préstamos que Manuela Ramos otorga a mujeres como ella desean emprender un negocio.
Es una de las fundadoras de este banco comunal, se dedica a la venta de comida y lo hace por las noches.
Ha tenido que acondicionar el patio de su casa para poder vender allí sin ningún problema.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 sacos de carbón, 3 fuentes nuevas, 4 embases para ají, 1 docena de vasos de vidrio, 6 jarras de medio litro.
Todas las noches saca sus productos a la venta, ella atiende sola.  Su esposo es comerciante y como todas las familias es el que mantiene el hogar, pero ella aporta también para otros gastos.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos todo este tiempo viene trabajando incansablemente para poder ayudar a que sus hijos terminen de estudiar, que es la única herencia que les pueden dejar.
texts.en:
Pacifica is a member of the communal bank named "Las Orquideas", meaning "The Orchids". It is located in Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 62 years old, married, and she has 5 children. They are all grown and independent.

To start up her business she needed to access a loan from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner). Loans are granted to women like her, who want to start up a business.

She is one of the founding members of the communal bank and she sell fast foods in the evenings.

She has had to remodel the patio of her house to be able to sell from there without any difficulty. With her new loan, amounting to S/. 1500, she will purchase: 2 sacks of charcoal, 2 new fountains, 4 bottles of chili, 1 dozen drinking glasses, 6 one-half liter pitchers.

Every evening she set outs to sell her products alone. Her husband is a merchant and like any other family, he supports the household. But she is also able to earn an income for other expenses. It is thanks to Manuela Ramos that she has been able to work tirelessly. She is able to support her children while they complete their schooling. It is the only inheritance she is able to leave them.

loans.use: 2 sacks of charcoal, 2 new fountains, and 4 bottles of chili.

loans.name: Gavino Marcelino

texts.es:
Gavino soltero, trabajador. El cliente tiene planificado en hacerle mejoras a la vivienda sobre todo en el piso.  Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos e utensilios de cocina desde hace un tiempo. El alza de los precio ha sido una dificulta en las venta de sus productos ya que los clientes no pagan su valor. Inicio su negocio con fondo propio. Con el esfuerzo y voluntad para alcanzar el objetivo de mejorar su economía. 
Con el préstamo comprara mercadería como: perfumes, cremas, sombras, lápiz labiales, de cejas, pestañas entre otros productos de uso femenino. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Gavino is single.  He is planning to do some home improvements, especially the floors throughout.  He’s been selling cosmetics and kitchen utensils for quite some time.  Rising prices have affected the sales of these products because customers do not pay what they are worth.  He started the business with funds of his own with effort and will to reach the goal of improving his economy.

He will use the loan to buy merchandise like: perfume, cream, eye shadow, lipstick, eyebrow pencils, and mascara, among other products for women.  He is grateful to the financial institution for the support given to his business’ development.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Book Juboo Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "BOOK JUBOO" se compose de cinq femmes qui habitent la même rue.Chaque femme gère sa propre activité qui lui permet de se prendre en charge et d'améliorer la nourriture des enfants.Le chef du groupe a six enfants dont deux seulement vont à l'école.Elle transforme les graines d'arachide en patte qu'elle revend aux familles environnantes.Elle vend aussi du mil. Son activité lui rapporte des revenus modestes qui lui sont toutefois très utiles pour satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants.Afin d'augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, le groupe sollicite auprès de l'UIMCEC un prêt de  250 000f pour l'achat de 5 sacs d'arachide, 5 sacs de mil et des produits divers.Son ambition est d'acheter une cantine au marché central pour élargir sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The "BOOK JUBOO" group is made up of five women who live in the same street. Each woman manages her own business which allows her to support  herself and improve her children's food. The leader of the group has six children, of whom only two attend school. She sells ice, especially during periods of very hot weather. She also processes peanuts into peanut butter which she sells to surrounding families. These activities bring her a modest income which is very useful in satisfying some of her needs and as well as those of her children. Her ambition is to buy a little shop at the central market so she can expand her clientele. 

The members of the group, looking to grow their working capital, are asking UIMCEC for a loan of 250,000 francs to buy five sacks of peanuts, five sacks of millet, cloth and various other products.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of peanuts, 5 sacks of millet and other food products

loans.name: Felolita Group

texts.en:
Felolita is married with 3 children. Felolita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Felolita is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers.
 
Felolita has been a member of PMPC for 9 months. Felolita is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers.

loans.name: Premangelito

texts.en:
Premangelito has been running his business, cooking daily meals to sell in his food stall, for a year. He earns about P3,000 (Philippine Pesos) a month in this field of work. He operates a business in front of his house near the school. This encourages him to cook more meals and sell more food items to attract more customers in his store and generate more income. 

Premangelito is 38 years old and and has two children to educate. He is now requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy ingredients and vegetables for the daily meals he cooks, as well as soft drinks, biscuits and breads to sell in his food stall.

In the future, he wants to enhance his business to ensure that he can meet all his customers demands for delicious meals and in that way, increase his earnings too. He also aspires for a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and vegetables for daily meals he cooks, as well as soft drinks, biscuits and bread to sell in his food stall.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana Patricia.
doña paty como es conocido por sus clientes, ella nos comenta que se levanta desde muy temprano para cocer su maíz ya que todos los días tiene que entregar tortillas a un colegio donde los alumnos reciben desayunos, y en hora del  almuerzo tiene que viajar a la capital a vender lo mismo, y cuando regresa se pone a hacer fajas de mostacilla con el fin de que su negocio este en pie firme, hoy nos comenta que necesita el crédito para la compra de maiz por mayor para la elavoracion de maiz  y necesita capital para invertir y atender a sus clientes, su anhelo es que sus tres hijos logren graduarse y tener una mejor oportunidad en el futuro.
texts.en: Ana Patricia, or “Doña Paty” as she is known to her customers, tells us that she gets up very early to cook corn. Every day she has to deliver tortillas to the school where the students get breakfast. At lunchtime she has to travel to the capital to sell more. When she comes home she makes beaded belts so that her business will be viable. Today she tells us that she needs a loan to buy bulk corn to make corn products and working capital to invest and serve her clients. Her wish is that her three children will graduate school and have better opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy bulk corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia nació en el departamento Apurímac y vive en la selva del Perú en la ciudad D. Salvación D. la provincia D. Manu del departamento D. Madre D. Dios.  

La señora Cecilia tiene 66 años y es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Cecilia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo bolsas D. arroz, bolsas D. azúcar y otras cosas más. 

Las reuniones D. las socias del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación” son cada treinta días en la ciudad D. Salvación. 

La selva D. Madre D. Dios guarda en su fondo muchas riquezas naturales. Los bosques D. Madre D. Dios son pródigos en entregar singular belleza. En los bosques grandes y misteriosos D. Madre D. Dios la caza es abundante. La selva D. Madre D. Dios es cortada por majestuosos ríos sobre los que se pueD. navegar en canoas o lanchas.
texts.en:
Cecilia was born in Apurímac department and currently lives in the Peruvian rainforest, in the town of Salvación, in Manu province, in Madre D. Dios department.

Cecilia is 66 years old, married, and has two children.  She is a hard-working mother who supports her family and has a small grocery store where she sells basic household products.  She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well.  On this occasion, Cecilia needs a loan to buy merchandise such as bags of rice, sugar, etc.

The 'Nueva Generación' community bank meets once a month in the town of Salvación.

The depths of the rainforest in Madre D. Dios hold many natural riches.  The forests offer an abundance of remarkable beauty.  In the large and mysterious forests of Madre D. Dios, animals abound.  The rainforest is crossed by majestic rivers on which it is possible to sail in canoes or boats.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as bags of rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 36 лет. Замужем. Имеет двоих детей. У нее среднее образование. Она более восьми лет занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Nazira lives in the town of Tursun-zoda.  She is 36 years old, married and has two children.  She has a secondary education.  Nazira has been involved in agriculture for over eight years.  She has a plot of land by her house, where she grows vegetables.  Nazira is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Konthy

texts.en:
Konthy (pictured with her loom) is a weaver, while her husband, San, is a commune leader. In addition, they are also rice farmers. They have been married since 1991 and have four children - three sons and one daughter. One is a garment worker, two attend school and the other one is still young. The family is living across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Konthy is asking for a loan of $200 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora, de 52 años, es una mujer buena y amable. Vive con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos, de los cuales dos ya son mayores e independientes, mientras que uno de ellos vive a lado de ellos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia junto a un hijo mayor que tiene a su familia a lado. EL trabajo de Dora consiste en la venta de comida, por las noches sale a la vereda da su casa, ahí alista todo para esperar a sus fieles comensales que van en busca de un buen servicio y excelente sazón como el que tienen ella. Lleva trabajando por tres años y le agrada mucho ya que la cocina siempre fue su pasión, al principio le fue difícil de poder iniciar ya que las personas no sabían que tal sazón tenía y no iban mucho, pero a punto de esfuerzo y sobre todo buen trato se supo ganar a sus clientes quienes ahora van en busca de sus deliciosos platos que prepara. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es le da tiempo de hacer otras actividades durante el día, le esta yendo bien ya que todos los días genera buenas ventas y esto le da buenos ingresos. Tiene en mente ampliar su negocio, para ello necesita comprar mesas y sillas. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de una pequeña ayuda para que pueda cumplir son sus objetivos, además se compromete en ser puntual y sobre todo muy responsable ya que no desea quedar mal con su grupo al que se esta incorporando y ve que son muy buenos y amables. Con el monto solicitado, comprará ingredientes e insumos para seguir con la preparación de sus deliciosos platos de comida y así poder ofrecer mayor variedad a sus comensales.
texts.en: Dora is 52 years old. She is a good and friendly woman. She lives with her spouse with whom she has three children. Two of them are grown and independent, while one of them still ives with them. Together they live in their own home with their oldest son, who has his family with him. Dora's job is selling food. She goes out evenings to the sidewalk in front of her house and gets everything ready for her faithful diners who seek out her good service and excellent flavoring. She has been working for three years and she really likes it since cooking has always been her passion. At first, it was difficult since people didn't know how good her food was and they didn't go very often. But with hard work and more than anything, good service, she was able to gain customers who now seek out the delicious food she prepares. What she likes about her job is that it gives her time to do other activities during the day. It is going well for her and she has good sales every day and this is giving her good income. She is planning on expanding her business, and for that she needs to buy tables and chairs. This will be her first loan with MFP and she hopes for a little help to achieve her goals. She is also committed to being very punctual and  above all responsible since she doesn't want to look bad with the group she is a part of, since they are good and friendly people. With the amount she has asked for, she will buy ingredients and materials to keep preparing her delicious dishes and offer more variety to her diners.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Robinah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.   
Robinah runs a pub. She has been in this business for ten years, and works seven days per week. Robinah sells her products from home, by means of retail. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and soda. Robinah also generates additional income through selling charcoal. The main business challenges for Robinah include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked pub and to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soda.

loans.name: Mary Adela

texts.en: Mary Adela is 33 years old and married with three children aged 1 to 3. Her husband is a soldier. She sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for three years. Mary would like a loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She would like to use any profits to pay school fees for her children. She dreams to own a big plot of land someday in the future.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de amable y jovial, es conviviente con Esteban, quien es operador de maquinaria pesada, fruto de esa unión tiene dos hijos de 12 y 4 años de edad, instalados cómodamente en su propia casa. El negocio que tiene Rosario es la venta de abarrotes en general para eso cuenta con una bodega instalada en su propia casa, en donde vende a todos sus vecinos de manera muy amable y amena todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, además de gelatinas y gaseosas. Tiene más de 4 años en esa actividad, contando con la ayuda de su hijo mayor en la atención a los clientes. Lo que gusta de su actividad es que le genera un ingreso económico, como también le permite estar en casa y manejar su tiempo y emplearlo en el  cuidado de sus hijos, y con las ganancias a podido darse algunos gustos y comprarse algunos artefactos electrodomésticos. Por lo contario comenta que no le gusta ver su negocio muy pequeño, por ello desea ampliarlo y abastecerlos con otros productos adicionales, por eso comenta incursionará en la venta de comida rápida por las noches, es por ello que se compró un carrito sanguchero. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero, por tanto cumplirá con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para ésta campaña navideña como panteones, juguetes y ropas de niños trayendo de la ciudad de Lima.
texts.en:
Rosario is 40 years old and is a very hardworking and earnest woman, as well as being happy and friendly.  She lives with Esteban, who is a heavy machinery operator, and they have two children, ages 12 and 4.  They all live comfortably in a home of their own.  Rosario’s business is the sale of general groceries and she has a small store that she runs from her home.  There she sells primary needs products to her neighbors.  She also sells gelatin treats and soft drinks.  She’s been doing this for more than four years and her son helps her attend to customers.  What she enjoys is that it generates income, while allowing her to be at home and manage her time to care for her children.  The income has allowed her to buy some toys for her children and also buy herself some appliances.  On the other hand, she says that she doesn’t like having such a small business.  She would like to expand it and stock it with additional products.  She wants to add fast food in the evenings, so she bought a sandwich cart.

This will be her fifth loan through MFP and she’s happy about the financial support.  She will repay the loan as she has in the past.  She will use the 3,000 PEN ($1,125)to buy merchandise for the Christmas season, to include pants, and children’s clothing from Lima.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rosas De Chijipina Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE CHIJINI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Jenny. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas, comercio, producción y servicios.

La señora Jenny  indica que es la primera ves que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio tejido y venta de mantas que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendiendo este oficio de su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de lanas) que adquirirá de la Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The lending group "Rosas de Chijini" will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Achacachi. The group has 8 members and is led by a board of directors headed by Jenny. The group members' businesses are varied and include: weaving cloths, commerce, production and services. 

Jenny says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer. For many years, she has been waving and selling blankets. She learned the trade from her mother.

The loan that she will take out is to increase her merchandise by buying wool in La Paz; later she will sell her products in the markets. This work has allowed her to earn income to support her family as much as possible. She lives with her husband and has one son. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she enjoys the training.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Sayfuddin

texts.ru: Сайфуддин житель района Хуросон. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он вместе с женой занимается торговлей. У него имеется торговая точка, где он продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Sayfuddin is a resident of the region Khuroson. He is 40 years old and married. He has three children. Together with his wife, he works with trade. He owns a sales outlet, where he sells food. 

Sayfuddin takes a loan to increase product turnover.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and food for sale

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a married woman who has five children. Merlyn is 48 years old and resides in Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines. 

Merlyn own and operate a nipa-making (weaving nipa palm to make roofing materials) business venture to earn a living and she's been in this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 2,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 15,000 to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. 

In 2011, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Merlyn wants to make improvements of her house and expand/improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married businesswoman who lives in Malindi. For the past 2 years, she has been running a business selling ballast and other building materials commonly referred to as ‘kokoto’. Lilian is the mother of two children, both in school. 

Lilian was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase nails, gravel, timber, etc. Her main challenge is the effect of low seasons since most of the building in town moves with the seasons. Lilian will save the additional income from this loan and use it to provide for her family.

loans.use: To to purchase nails, gravel, timber, etc.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, se encuentra ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, desde hace 10 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto el espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café.

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Mrs. Vero Own is married with two (2) children. She is 48 years old, a LAPO client for the past 5 years. She is delighted in engaging in sales of provision and drinks. She is optimistic that her business will improve if given the sum of $500

loans.use: To buy more provision and drinks for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Nhim

texts.en: Nhim C. is a mother of three children and lives with her husband in Kampung Cham, Cambodia. She and her husband run a small farm that raises domestic animals and sells them to retail outlets. They make about $5/day. Two of their children are students and another one is too young to go to school yet. C. hopes the loan will help her in growing her business. She wants to use the loan to purchase more ducks and chickens and to use remaining money to repair her house.   In the future, this couple hopes to own another piece of land to expand their animal farm and to continue supporting their children's education.

loans.use: To purchase ducks and chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Meroni would like to buy 2 steers for fattening

loans.name: Antonio Jose

texts.pt:
António José S. is 24 years old. He was born in Catembe in September 24th in 1982. He lived with her mother and 8 brothers. He studied until the 5th grade. António moved to South Africa from 1999 to 2005 in search of a job. He returned to Moçambique in 2005. Since it was difficult to find jobs in the city, he rented a small stand to sell groceries. He was introduced to Hluvuku by her sister. Her first loan was of 15.000 MT which he repaid.

With the loan of 20.000mt António plans on diversifying and increasing his inventory. His business has a positive impact in the community because it brings the product conveniently closed to the community. In the future António plans on opening his own store.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Chamissava - Catembe Cliente: António José S. Actividade:Comércio Valor de empréstimo: 20.000,00 MT (800.00US$) Aplicacao: Compra de produtos de 1ª necessidade Início: 27/08/07 Fim: 14/12/08 António José S., de 24 anos de idade, nasceu na catembe aos 24 de Setembro de 1982, sempre viveu com a mae e seus 8 irmaos, estudava e concluiu a 5ª classe e posteriormente de 1999 á 2005 foi a África do Sul a procura de emprego como forma de ajudar a família e trabalhava como operário numa fábrica de sofás. Teve contacto com crédito na África do Sul quando um banco Sul africano o contacta para aceder a esses serviços financeiros para compra de Bens de Consumo. Retorna em Mocambique em 2005 e como era difícil arranjar emprego na Cidade, aluga um pequeno estabelecimento comercial para venda de diversos produtos alimentícios. Teve conhecimento da Hluvuku através da irmã e o 1º crédito de 15.000 MT pagou-o sem problemas. Com o crédito de 20.000 MT pretende apetrechar e diversificar produtos de mercearia como forma de atrair e oferecer alternativa aos clientes. Ele e o irmão mais novo é que trabalham na barraca. O empreendimento tem impacto na comunidade como alternativa para compra de vários produtos, também aos fins de semana é local preferido para lazer devido ao tipo de serviços fornecidos e a reduzida distancia da comunidade utente. Futuramente pretende ter sua merecearia construída com material convencional e se possível ter viatura para transporte de mercadoria por forma a vender produtos a grosso.

loans.use: To increase stocks in his shop

loans.name: Nora Ricardina

texts.es:
For 8 years Nora has been a member of the Communal Bank "La Amistad," her home is located in AA. HH. Victor Manuel Maldonado Begazo Mz. D Lte.5i, Callería District, Ucayali state.

She is 53 years old and is the mother of 6 children, her spouse helps her in the making and selling of cheese. Today she sells approximately 300 cheeses per day that are distributed in the market and she is supplier to a supermarket.

With the current loan from Manuela Ramos of 2300 soles (aprox. US $767.00), which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy more supplies for her business (500 liters of milk). Nora is very happy and fulfilled as a woman, mother, and businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nora pertenece desde hace 8 años al Banco Comunal “La Amistad”, su vivienda está ubicada en el AA. HH. Victor Manuel Maldonado Begazo Mz. D Lte.5i, del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali.

Tiene 53 años y es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo le ayuda en la elaboración y venta de sus quesos . En la actualidad vende un aproximado de 300 quesos al día que son distribuidos en el mercado y es proveedor de un autoservicio.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,300 (US$ 767.00 aprox.), el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará más insumos para su negocio( 500 litros de leche). Nora se siente muy feliz y realizada como mujer, madre y empresaria.

loans.use: Purchase milk to make cheese and cheese making supplies

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
In the busy town of Kibaha Kwa Matias, Fatuma M. runs a busy little eatery popular amongst locals, who pop in for a lunch of rice, beans, ugali (maize porridge), cassava, vegetables, meat and soda. Fatuma established the business in 2003 and has since successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA. She now requires a loan of $525 to purchase new utensils and inventory for the café.

Fatuma is a single mother of two, Chande, 16, and Happy, 14, and her business enables her to support her family. She thanks you for your help as she works toward expanding her business turnover.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback arrangement as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are therefore termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase utensils and inventory for her café

loans.name: Astini

texts.en: Astini is a 33-year-old woman who has a kiosk selling motorcycle spareparts, earning US$5 a day. Her husband, R., has been unemployed for a long time. She is a member of MBK and requesting a loan of US$150 to expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia has been a member of the community bank “8th of September” for two years.  She is a native of the district of Acosvinchos, which is one hour away from the city of Ayacucho.
Lidia is 28 years old, and by profession a nurse.  Lidia has a store where she sells food staples such as rice, flour, and sugar.  In addition she sells a variety of medications.  Lidia rents a building in the main plaza of the district.  When she started Lidia sold very few products, but little by little, thanks to the loans from the community bank, her business has continued to grow.
As a member of the community bank she has learned how to keep her children healthy, avoid domestic violence, and how to manage her business efficiently.
Lidia needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, eggs, firewood, and different medicines.
One of the key aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate receives.  Lidia plans to use her savings to study a specialization.  Her dream is to build a house, raise more capital, and start a new business with a motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: Lidia requests a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, eggs, firewood, and different medicines.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr:
Mr. N. will strengthen his working capital by buying products from wholesalers to stock his neighborhood shop. He started off with his own money and demand is becoming stronger stronger, which is why he needs this loan. He is a serious and hard-working young man.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur N. va renforcer son fonds de roulement en achetant des produits chez les grossistes pour alimenter sa boutique de quartier. il a demarré avec ses fonds propres et la demande devient de plus en plus forte et cela explique son besoin. c'est un jeune serieux et travailleur.

loans.use: Strengthening shop working capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Señora Maria Eulalia, widow of the late Señor Paez, is an enterprising woman who has had a store in her home for two years. She has many clients and is well known throughout the neighborhood for her good treatment of clients and neighbors.

In her business she sells all types of basic foodstuffs like herbs, flour, oil, sugar, vermicelli, etc. In addition to this, she sells milk and cheese of her own production, as she owns several cows. After a while she decided to take out a loan because she wanted to get started selling pork, but because she didn’t have existing relationships it cost her a lot to acquire her first pigs. Because of this she started to work with the Fundación Paraguaya because it was the only entity that would give her the credit to invest in her business.

Today she is asking for a new loan in order to increase her pig raising business, as the demand for the meat and pork products has increased a lot and as in her area, there isn't anyone else working on this type of business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria Eulalia vda. de Paez es una persona emprendedora, que posee una despensa en su domicilio particular desde hace 2 años, tiene mucha clientela y es muy reconocida en el barrio por el buen trato con sus clientes y vecinos.

En su negocio vende todo tipo de comestibles de primera necesidad como yerba, harina, aceite, azúcar, fideos, etc. Además de ello ella vende leche y queso de su propia producción ya que posee unas vacas. Hace un tiempo ella decidió tomar un crédito pues quería iniciarse en la venta de carne porcina, pero como no poseía referencias anteriores le costo mucho conseguir uno, así fue como empezó a trabajar con Fundación Paraguaya porque fue la única entidad que le otorgo el crédito para invertir en su negocio.

Hoy ella solicita un nuevo crédito para ampliar su cría de cerdos, pues la demanda de la carne y derivados porcinos ha aumentado bastante y en la zona no existe nadie aparte de ella que se dedique a esto.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Hafiz Allah

texts.en: Hafiz Allah lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and the father of three children. He is a carpet weaver. He was in Pakistan for about 8 years where he was involved in carpentry. When he came back, he started his business in Kabul. Now he wants to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to complete his stock and make a good income to help his family in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Ansor

texts.en:
I. Ansor is 19 years old, single, and lives with his parents, financially supporting them.
Ansor has a minivan which he uses to provide transportation services for passengers in the city of Pendjikent. He has been in this business for the past 2 years. Initially, Ansor rented a car, but, with time, after saving some money, he bought his own minivan. The business is stable and generates the majority of income for Ansor’s family.
Currently, Ansor needs to purchase spare parts and to pay for the repair of the minivan, in order to be able to provide higher-quality transportation services. Therefore, he is asking for a loan of US$600 for a term of 12 months. This will be Ansor's first loan, and he promises everyone to do his best to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts in order to repair a minivan

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a small business selling jewelry, shoes and beauty products.

loans.name: Tausi

texts.en:
Tausi is 54 years old, married, and has 6 children, all between 16 and 30 years old. Tausi own a small shop where she sells coconuts, bananas and charcoal. She started her business in 1988 and now works every day from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about US$60.

Tausi now hopes to receive a loan to buy more items like banana, coconuts and charcoal for her sales business.

loans.use: Increase in charcoal inventory

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina C. is married and has one child. Her husband is a carpenter. Even so, Georgina is the one who is responsible for feeding their family. Georgina proudly states that she completed her studies through senior high.

Georgina makes a local fabric known as batik and tye dye, which she sells at Asebu in the Cape Coast region. Notably, Georgina has been in this line of business since 2001. With the loan proceeds, she plans to buy more materials to make her tye dye products. In turn, she hopes to use the expected increase in profits to expand her business to reach a bigger market of customers.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional input materials in order to make her tye dye products

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
Adrian inició el negocio para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa. Trabajaba hace 3 años en una planta de obrero y como lo despidieron se vio en la disyuntiva de irse a USA a trabajar o quedarse en México como ayudante de albañil, decidiéndose por lo segundo y viendo que esto le daba resultado continuo, poniendo su propio negocio y ha logrado salir adelante.

El necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materiales de trabajo a mas bajo precio.
texts.en:
Adrian started his business to help his parents with the household expenses. Up to 3 years ago he used to work in a factory as a laborer but he was layed off. He found himself at a cross roads, to go the the US to work or to stay in Mexico as a laborer. He made his decision taking his chances in Mexico because he felt it was working for him. He set up his own business and he has been able to make ends meet.

He requires a loan in the amount of $475, which will be repaid in a term of 6 months. The funds will be used to purchase construction materials when they are at a lower price.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction material.

loans.name: Martine Danlome

texts.fr: Dame AMOUZOUVI Martine est agée de 35 ans. Elle s'est mariée à WABI Waliou. De ce mariage est sorti 02 enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge . Elle vend de la friperie qu'elle achète au marché MISSEBO de COTONOU. Pour toucher plus sa clientèle, elle a construit une boutique sur fond propre. Elle manque de ressources financières pour se ravitailler et proposer à ses clients de nouveaux produits. Elle demande ce crédit pour s'approvisionner et donner satisfaction à sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Ms. Martine AMOUZOUVI is 35 years old. She is married to Waliou WABI, and togther they have two children, both in school and in her care. She sells second-hand clothing that she buys at the MISSEBO market of COTONOU. To bring in more customers, she built a shop with her own funds. She lacks the financial resources to restock her inventory and to offer her customers new products. She is asking for this loan to get supplies and to provide satisfaction to her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en:
Mrs. Felicita Bullanday A., commonly known as “Manding Feling”, is seventy years old. She lives at Sibula, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Though she is now in her old age, she is still physically fit and healthy. She is a long time Sari-Sari Store owner; her store is located within their community and is accessible to the neighborhood.  Felicita and her husband are members of the Senior Citizens group wherein they have the chance to receive discounts on medicine, transportation, and many other expenses.  They are blessed with 7 siblings who are now married. Felicita’s husband works on their own farm, cultivating and planting different kinds of vegetables as well as bananas and other fruit trees. He also receives an honorarium of P3,500 per month for serving as a pastor in their church.

Based on her previous loan history, Felicita is a member in good standing (MIGS) with no history of defaults for the past 9 loan cycles.  She is presently working on a loan application for twenty thousand pesos (P20,000.00) for the purchase of additional grocery stock such as rice, canned goods, toiletries and many other related items.  Her daily income from her Sari-Sari store is estimated to be five hundred pesos (P500.00).

Felicita wishes to increase and expand her business so that she can save enough money to concrete her small Sari-Sari Store and protect the groceries from being eaten by mice.  According to Felicita, her business is already her life and her heart is in it. 

Felicita is an active member of Golden Hope Center, a PDP-LP, microfinance unit of Paglaum MPC. She is so grateful for Paglaum because it provides holistic development support through its trainings, teachings, savings programs, and insurance.

loans.use: Purchase of additional grocery items

loans.name: Tutinisso

texts.en:
B. Tutinisso first applied to MicroInvest in 2003 and she is glad of its co-operation. Thanks to the previous loans, she improved the existing business and to open the new one. She traded before in eggs but now she has opened a new business selling different New Year toys, ornaments and such. She works with the suppliers so she trades at low prices and has repeat customers. She has a big assortment.

Mrs. B. is an active client of MicroInvest; she has not any delays in previous loans repayment. She increased the loan sum, which shows her business income increase. Now Mrs. B. Tutinisso applies the KIVA with the request for a loan of 2300 STJ for 6 months to increase her assortment.

loans.use: Increase her assortment of ornaments

loans.name: Nazareno Group

texts.en:
The Nazareno Village Bank is currently beginning its fourth loan cycle with 21 members. The group members are involved in a variety of different business. They sell natural remedies, cosmetics, school and office supplies, clothing, food, general dry goods (rice, sugar, etc.), fruits, small animals, and textiles. Diana is 20-year-old single woman who lives with her parents. Diana studies computer science and occasionally works at a local institution. Diana has a stand in the F. Vivanco Market, where she sells fruit with the help of her sister. Diana needs a loan of 300 soles to buy more fruit for her stand. Ana is 28 years old and lives with her partner and their son. Ana travels to different regional markets, where she sells dry goods (like rice and sugar) and buys cheese and alpaca wool. Ana needs a loan of 600 soles to buy rice and sugar. Celia is 26 years old, single, and lives alone. She studies accounting and also works at a local institution. Celia sells clothing and shoes on credit by special order. Celia needs a loan of 600 soles to buy suits and shoes. Members of the Nazareno Group are requesting different loan amounts, like 300, 600, 900 or 1,000 Peruvian soles. The group is requesting a total of 12,150 soles, which they will use to buy rice, sugar, shoes, t-shirts, suits, fruit, cheese, animals, lotions, perfumes, and wool. The group members' dreams are to improve their businesses, own their own homes, proviD. their children with the best, and have their own investment capital.  
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
El Banco Nazareno inicia su cuarto ciclo con  21 socias. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. medicina natural, cosméticos, artículos D. librería, comida, ropa, abarrotes en general, frutas, animales menores y elaboración D. textiles. 
Como es el caso D. Diana que es soltera, tiene 20 años y vive con sus padres, Diana estudia computación y trabaja eventualmente en una institución. Diana tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donD. venD. frutas con la ayuda D. su hermana. Diana necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. frutas. 
Por otro lado Ana es conviviente, tiene 28 años y tiene 1 hijo, Ana viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. venD. abarrotes y D. las ferias compra quesos y fibra D. alpaca. Ana necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar y arroz. 
Mientras que Celia es soltera, tiene 26 años y vive sola, estudia contabilidad y también trabaja en una institución, Celia venD. ropa, zapatos a pedidos sus ventas son al crédito. Celia necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ternos y zapatos. 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles haciendo un total D. 12,150 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 
Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, zapatos, polos, ternos, frutas, quesos, animales, cremas, colonias y lana. 
Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, tener casa propia, brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos, tener capital propio.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, shoes, t-shirts, suits, fruits, cheeses, animals, lotions, perfumes, and wool.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Mr. Vorn S. is a villager in Pong Toek village in Kampong Cham province. He uses rice to make wine. Aside from this career, he is a pig breeder. Since his breeding pigs business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing ten more piglets and expand their piggery. He hopes to increase his earnings and improve his family’s quality of life. His wife, Mrs. Tan Seng Hin, is a Khmer cake seller who can make a little income to support the family. Mr. Vorn S. is a 56-year-old father of a child who is attending the local school. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy piglets and build a piggery for those pigs.

loans.name: Las Mujeres Unidas De Fernando Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Unidas D.
