Fernando” lleva trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya  mas D. un año, sus integrantes ya realizan una actividad productiva, reciben un crédito promedio D. 600.000 y lo utilizaran para ampliar y diversificar lo que ya estan realizando como ser: la compra D. hojas D. palma en el caso D. las artesanas , compra D. insumos para la fabricacion D. comestibles, compra D. leche azucar,yerba,harina,sal panificados y verduras para su posterior venta,compra venta D. bebidas como refrescos , gaseosas ,cervezas, vinos etc. 

Nombre y Apellido	Actividad
Roque León	Vta D. mercaderías  varias
Francisca D. A. 	Modista
Maria Irene M.	Vta D. carbón
Aurelia B.	Vta D. cosméticos
Sonia V.	Vta D. artesanias
Olga D. S.	Vta D. artesania
Mercedes V.  	Vta D. ropas
Daniela U. 	Vta D. artesania
Salvadora V.	Vta D. comestibles
Merarda D. S.	Vta D. merceria
Mirna V.	Vta D. Chipas
Limpia D. R.	Vta D. comestibles
Gissela S.	Vta D. ropas
Sofia N.	Vta D. chipas
Regina A.	Fca y venta D. productos D. limpieza
Teresa P.	Vta D. comestibles
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas D. Fernando” committee has been working with the Fundación Paraguaya for more than a year. Its members are productively working, each receives a loan averaging 600.000 and it will be used to expand and diversify what they are doing, such as: artisans buying palm leaves, buying materials to make food, buying milk, sugar, tea, flour, salt, baked goods and vegetables to resell, buying beverages such as soda pop, beer, wine, etc. Name, Activity Roque León, Sell general merchandise Francisca D. Acostal, Seamstress Maria Irene M., Sell fuel Aurelia B., Sell cosmetics Sonia V., Sell artisan products Olga D. S., Sell artisan products Mercedes V., Sell clothing Daniela U., Sell artisan products Salvadora V., Sell food Merarda D. S., Sell merchandise Mirna V., Sell “chipas” (a traditional bread) Limpia D. R., Sell food Gissela S., Sell clothing Sofia N., Sell “chipas” (a traditional bread) Regina A., Sell cleaning supplies Teresa P., Sell food

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients, supplies and merchandise for their respective businesses

loans.name: Eddy Antonio

texts.es: El señor Eddy Antonio Gutiérrez tiene la edad de 32 años habita en la Borgoña, junto a sus esposa la cual es domestica para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos los cuales tienen entre 12 y 10 años actualmente estudian su primaria; los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia ya que donde ellos habitan es un solo cuarto y en futuro quiere ampliar para que cada uno de ellos tenga su cuarto privacidad Don Eddy desde hace once años trabaja como agricultor y comerciante y sus limitantes ha sido la falta de financiamiento, inicio en la agricultora con el apoyo de sus padres que todo su vida se dedicaron a trabajar sus tierras. El financiamiento es para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Señor Eddy Antonio Gutiérrez is 32 years old and lives with his wife in Borgoña. They have two children, who are 10 and 12 years old, and who are in primary school. To help support the family, Eddy's wife works as a maid. Their plans for the future are to improve their family's quality of life. Currently, they live in one large room together and in the future, they would like to expand their home so that everyone can enjoy the privacy of their own room. For 11 years, Eddy has worked as a farmer and trader. He learnt how to farm from his parents, who dedicated their wholes lives to working in the fields. Unfortunately, Eddy has always been limited by the unavailability of working capital. This loan will be used to buy fertilizer and everything else needed for a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Mrs. Lucila C., a 53-year-old married mother of three, one still studying, resides in Dipolog City and has been an active member of Paglaum MPC for two years.  A very diligent worker, she is a part-time teacher who used to teach an evening class at the college, and she earns income as a dressmaker. 
	
To be able to purchase cloth and other materials for dressmaking, she is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP. Lucila is looking forward to continuing her relationship with the Coop to help her achieve her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase textiles and cloth.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith es una joven muy alegre, emprendedora y con muchas ganas de sacar a delante su negocio, tiene 21 años y vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea dar una buena vejez. La pequeña tienda de Edith es una de las más visitadas, ya que su carisma y buena trato han hecho que la prefieran antes que a las otras, ella es muy perseverante en su trabajo, se levanta muy temprano, para atender a mucho más personas en el día. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que al mismo tiempo puede ocuparse de las labores de su hogar, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle. Para más adelante quiere tener una tienda más grande y completa, con la cual pueda incrementar sus ingresos y así tener una vida mejor. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de la oportunidad brindada, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados incrementará la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en su tienda.
texts.en:
Edith is a cheerful young woman, who is enterprising and really wants her business to succeed. She is 21 years old and she lives in the same house with her parents, to whom she would like to provide a good old age. Edith's small store is one of the most visited since her charisma and good treatment have made it preferred above all others. She is very persistent in her work. She gets up very early in order to fit more customers into the day. What she likes best about her work is that she can also keep up with her household chores at the same time. She's been doing this for the last four years, though she regrets having to remain in the store all day long and not being able to go out and about. In the future she would like to have a larger, more complete store with which she would be able to increase her earnings and so have a better life. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and she is very pleased with the opportunity which it presents. She knows that she has to make all of her payments on time so as not to be detrimental to the other members of her communal bank, where she is very well liked. With the 1,000 New Sols requested, she would like to increase the amount of merchandise she has in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa es una mujer que sufrió el abandono de su pareja; pero su hija, con quien vive, la motiva a seguir adelante cada día. Desde muy joven aprendió algunas técnicas de cosmetología, pero con el tiempo se dio cuenta que tenía que prepararse para ejercer esta labor de forma profesional, por ello, es que desde hace 20 años está involucrada en el arreglo personal de las damas, y gracias al tiempo de experiencia y ahorro logró abrir su propio salón de belleza, el cual atiende todos los días desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. El tiempo que le dedica a su negocio lo disfruta mucho, ya que trata de que sus clientas salgan muy lindas y satisfechas del resultado obtenido en la sesión de belleza. Sus ambiciones son de lograr tener un spa en lugares residenciales de la ciudad donde vive, ya que la mayoría de sus clientas vienen de estos lugares solo para ser atendidas por sus manos, pues su trabajo es muy reconocido. Felipa está solicitando un crédito por primera vez y espera que su permanencia sea muy favorable para ganarse la confiabilidad de su grupo y de la institución. Los 1000 soles estarán destinados en la compra de productos de belleza y herramientas necesarias para su labor.
texts.en:
Felipa is a woman who has suffered the abandonment of her husband. However, her daughter, with whom she lives, motivates her to keep going every day. Felipa had acquired the techniques of cosmetology since she was very young, but over time she realized that she needed to prepare herself to do the job like a professional. So, for the past 20 years she has been providing personal beauty services to women. Thanks to time, experience, and savings, she has succeeded in opening her own beauty solon, in which she works every day from 9 in the morning until 8 at night. She really enjoys the time she spends in her business because her clients always walk away beautiful and happy with the results of their visit. Felipa's ambitions include having a spa in her city's residential area, since most of her clients come from there just to have her attend to them with her very own hands; her work is quite well-known. She is seeking a loan for the first time and hopes that her presence will help her win the confidence of her group and the organization. She plans to use the loan of 1000 soles to buy beauty products and the necessary tools of her trade.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy implements and products for her solon

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine R. is from the village of San Nicolas in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 50 years old. Josephine is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a manicure and pedicure salon. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from her business.

In April 2009, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase supplies for her business. This will be Josephine's first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her salon

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr: amadou N. est parent beneficiaire a camberene'il est aviculteuret meme temps eleveur de moutons.il sollicite ce pret de 150 000frs pour l'elargissement de son poullailler et le stockage d'aliments de betails.son objectif st d'accroitre ses revenus pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amadou Aiang is a client parent in Camberene. He raises poultry and at the same time raises sheep. He’s requesting this loan of 150,000 francs to enlarge his chicken coop and his inventory of feed. His goal is to increase his revenues to provide for his family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en: Milicent is a 26-year-old entrepreneur. She is a married mother of two children who go to school. The family lives in Likoni, Mombasa. Milicent runs a beauty shop which she initiated in 2007. She supplements this with the sale of clothing materials and ladies' handbags. She gets her products locally and, at times, travels to Kampala, Uganda, for more varieties. Milicent is requesting her loan to help her get more supplies.

loans.use: Get more supplies

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina is 45 years old. She is a widowed mother with three children. All her children attend school and she is so proud of that. She owns and operates a grocery store and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc., to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing and selling peanuts

loans.name: Basiledesa

texts.es: Basilidesa tiene 54 años, es casada y vive con su esposo e hijos en la casa que por años obtuvieron gracias al trabajo  D. su pareja.  Hace 20 años inició su negocio como comerciante, vendiendo variedad D. productos para el hogar, sin embargo la exigencia del mercado la obligaron a cambiar D. rubro, es por ello que ahora la encontramos vendiendo prendas D. vestir. Esta actividad lo realiza en las calles D. su ciudad, donD. sale a ofrecer su mercadería considerando siempre  en brindar un mejor servicio con el fin D. ganarse a las personas y aumentar el número D. clientes. Su gran sentido del humor  la beneficia al momento D.  ofrecer sus productos, dando siempre la mejor atención y la mejor calidad cumpliendo siempre con los requerimientos D. sus clientes, quienes la visitan en su domicilio para realizar sus pedidos con anticipación. Sus planes a futuro son D. instalar en su domicilio un bazar donD.  pueda ofrecer  variedad D. productos D. belleza  para su exigente clientela quienes la motivaron a progresar. Este es su sexto crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, espera seguir contando con el apoyo y la confianza para darle el crédito que necesita. Los 1000 soles que solicita le permitirán aprovechar algunas liquidaciones en los supermercados donD. obtiene las prendas D. calidad.
texts.en:
Basilidesa is 54 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in a house they were able to get many years ago, thanks to their hard work. 20 years ago Basilidesa started a store, selling a variety of home products. However, market demand maD. her change her work, so she now sells clothing. She sells clothing in the street markets in the city, offering her merchandise with good customer service in order to win more customers. Basilidesa's good sense of humor helps her sell her products; she provides the best customer service and the high product quality demanded by her customers, who visit her home to place orders. In the future she plans to set up a bazaar in her home where she can offer a variety of beauty products that her customers have been requesting. Her customers' needs motivate her to make progress. This is her 6th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA; she hopes to keep relying on their support and trust in giving her the loans she needs. The 1,000 PEN that she is requesting will allow her to take advantage of the supermarket sales where she purchases high quality articles of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking merchandise.

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is a 31-year-old woman who is married to Alphonse Odero. They have five school-age children. 

Priscah has been supplying motor vehicle paints for auto garages in the busy Naivasha town for five years. She was introduced to KADET by her friend, and with the loan for which she has applied, she plans to add inventory in her shop by buying more auto paints. In the future, Priscah is planning to expand her business, and instead of just retail,  she will also supply paints in wholesale around Naivasha town.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more paints for sale

loans.name: God Children Group

texts.en:
D. J. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called 'God Children'. He is 27 years old, married with children aged 1 and 2 years old, and also cares for a sibling. D. is a senior high school student hoping to excel to the highest level of education.

D.'s business is his call center. He makes phone calls, sells and rents movie discs, and does money exchange for the residents of Saye Town, 3rd St., south of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia where he lives.

D. started this business with Ld$15,000 that was given to him by his mother, and he has been running this business for 3 years, hoping to see his business grow and expand to a higher level. D. gives his customers a better exchange rate and sells and rents quality movie disc and also gives them the best time making pay calls.

D. needs this loan to improve his business. He dreams of giving his children a better education and always giving them good medical care.

loans.use: this loan to improve his business.

loans.name: Bernadeta

texts.en: Bernadeta P. is from the village of P-6A, Valencia City. She is 56 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Bernadeta owns and operates a business selling a variety of vegetables in the local market. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Bernadeta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar P. Jr. is now 29 years old, after his college education. He is married to Jemarie P., and they are gifted with a child named Jem Anne Nychole, who is 5 years old. They want her to become successful in the future so that she can take care of them when they get old. They help each other to earn an income to satisfy their basic needs and save for the future of their daughter.

Oscar Jr. is engaged in hog raising, and he also cultivates rice and some vegetables, while his wife is engaged in selling snacks and vegetables in their village, located at Brgy. Lactawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. The fruit of his patience and sacrifices, he earns an income of not less than 30,000 PHP per harvest, which they utilize to acquire their daily needs while saving some for the future of their children. Because of their interest in improving their standard of living, Oscar applied for a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP to be used in purchasing seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for the maintenance of their crop production. He wishes that his loan will be approved, to be able to have a good harvest.

loans.use: Additional capital for the maintenance of his crop production

loans.name: Mrs. Pao Pech Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fifteen people who all live in Khmot village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Pao P. is the village bank president as selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this farming, she is pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she is asking for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food. Her husband, Mr. Maen Phal, is working in a commune. This couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy more piglets.

loans.name: Ankhbayar

texts.en:
Ankhbayar is 28 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His son, 8, attends a local secondary school and his daughter, 3, attends kindergarten. Ankhbayar operates both a taxi service and a fitness club in his town. He began his taxi service in 2008 after managing a clothing retail business for two years. He then opened his fitness club in order to supplement the family’s earnings. He hopes to expand both of his businesses in the future. He says, “I am working hard to improve my businesses and educate my children.” Ankhbayar is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase equipment for his fitness club. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for his fitness club

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela C. is from the town of Quezon, San Isidro. She is 19 years old, married, and has one infant child.

Carmela owns and operates a business venture into raising ducks for sale. She earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Carmela joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for business improvement. This loan will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for business improvement

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a 55 year old woman. She is widowed and has seven children. Two of her children are still in school and the rest are now adults. Naomi is an achiever and a resourceful mother to the home. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living. She trades in food items, like plantains and cassava, in the community market square where she lives. She treks to surrounding villages in the community to purchase bulk stock of cassava and plantains from the farmers and retails these products to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to pick up enough stock to make enough profit to support her family.  With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk supply of cassava and plantains to enable her to scale up her business growth. She has been in business for the last twenty three (23) years. With her business experience, she hopes to pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase bulk supply of cassava and plantains.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 55 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el caserío Las Juntas, distrito de Pacora, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace cinco años, el nos comenta que tuvo que empezar a trabajar en esta actividad porque los ingresos que percibía de su trabajo como obrero agrícola no eran suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares. Su actividad consiste en criar animales menores (de preferencia chivos) para luego comercializarlos con los negociantes que fecuentan la zona en donde vive.

Merdeces desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales para seguir comercializándolos, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

El es una persona muy conocida y respetada en la zona donde vive, sus vecinos lo consideran un hombre honrado y trabajador, su mayor anhelo es seguir teniendo la energia para sacar adelante a los suyos.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 55 years old, married and lives with his wife and two children in the Las Juntas settlement, in the Pacora district, one hour away from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked raising and selling animals for the last 5 years. He tells us that he had to begin this type of work because the income he was earning as a farm worker was not sufficient to cover his family's expenses. His work consists of raising small animals (preferably goats) to then market them to the businesspeople who frequent the area where he lives. Mercedes would like to expand his business by buying more animals and continuing to sell them. That is why he find himself, for the first time, requesting a loan of 1500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which he wants to use to achieve his goal. He is a very well-known and respected man in the area where he lives. His neighbors consider him an honest and hard-working man and his greatest desire is to continue having the energy to move his family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
La señora Ángela D. R., vive en el barrio laureles norte, ella es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, tras la falta de trabajo que existía en su ciudad de natal tuvo que emigrar a la capital, ahora ella reside en el barrio Laureles Norte, es madre soltera de 49 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad completamente independientes y que le apoyan económicamente.

Ella trabaja como conserje desde hace 6 años y dentro de sus mayores logros están el terminar de construir su vivienda y morar en un espacio óptimo, seguro y cómodo.  Es por esta razón que ella solicita de este crédito para terminar la construcción de un cuarto que inicio gracias a los préstamos de Kiva, así mismo ella desea continuar con las nuevas remodelaciones y para esto comenzará con la reconstrucción de la cocina de su hogar, estas comodidades le traerán mejores condiciones de vida para ella y sus hijos.

Agradecería se le tomara en cuenta para este préstamo debido a que es una mujer viuda, que tiene un trabajo humilde y que es gracias a  sus hijos que ha podido salir adelante, pero ahora necesita de una mayor inversión para llevar a cabo lo planteado.
texts.en:
Ángela D. R., 49, lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She is from Estelí but, due to the lack of employment opportunities in her town, had to emigrate to the capital city; now, she lives in Laureles Norte neighborhood. She is a single mother of three, completely independent, adult children who help her out economically. She has worked as a caretaker for 6 years and, among her greatest accomplishments, was finishing building her home and to live in a safe, secure and comfortable space. For this reason, she is asking for funding to complete construction of a room that she was able to start thanks to Kiva loans. She also would like to continue with some new remodeling which will consist in rebuilding the kitchen. These comforts will mean better living conditions for herself and her children. She would appreciate being taken into consideration for this loan because she's a widow with a very humble job. It is thanks to her children that she has been able to make some progress. She now needs a larger investment in order to accomplish all she has planned.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room and remodel the kitchen.

loans.name: Munhdalai

texts.en:
Munhdalai is 36 years old and lives with his wife and son in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Their quality of life is good. 

Munhdalai and his wife have been running a mobile food-trading business since 2003. Besides this business, he operates a coal-trading business with his truck during the winter and sometimes he operates a taxi service in the center of his own province. Munhdalai  is a very hardworking person and says, “I would like to operate a permanent food-selling business in the center of the province with my business profit.”   He plans to begin building this business next summer.  He is requesting a 2,200,000 tugrug (~ 1548 USD)  loan to increase the working capital of his business.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Mr. Moeurn Meas Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fifteen people make up a village bank loan. Mr. Moeurn M. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members. The group members are villagers in Kandaol village in Takeo province. They will use the loan to purchase something that supports each member for different purposes. Mr. Moeurn M. is a tailor in the local village and his wife, Mrs. SaV. Chear, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice for supporting her family’s living. This couple tries to work hard, but they earn little income. Thus, in order to improve the family’s living conditions, Mr. Moeurn M. decided to apply for a loan to buy more cloth for his tailor-made clothes to sell. He is a father of five children, two of whom are attending a local public school, while the others are too young to go to school or work. In the day of the loan disbursement Mr. Moeurn M. was busy at his work. His wife, Mrs. SaV. Chear, came to take the loan instead of him. The photo above is of Mr. Moeurn M.'s wife.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for tailor-made clothes to sell.

loans.name: Urania

texts.es:
Urania J. L. es una joven trabajadora dueña de una pequeña pulpería. Este negocio lo inicio cuando trabajando en el mercado vio la necesidad que había en su comunidad para adquirir ciertos productos como granos básicos, verduras, jabones etc. y  empezó a traer dichos productos para comercializarlos. Luego de ello decidió poner una pulpería la cual con el tiempo ha mejorado considerablemente.

Esta joven madre de un niño de cinco años y quien espera con amor, anhelo e ilusión a su nuevo bebe  tiene la meta de tener una pulpería completa. Ella que invertirá el crédito en adquirir mayor cantidad de productos y variedad.
texts.en:
Urania J. L. is a hardworking young woman who owns a small grocery store. She came up with the idea for this business when she was working at the market. Urania saw the need in her community to provide certain products such as basic grains, vegetables, soaps, and other items. She began bringing these products in order to sell. Later she decided to open a shop which has improve considerably over time.

This young mother has a five year old son. With love and hope, she is waiting to have her next child and also has the goal of having a full grocery store. She will use this loan to acquire a larger quantity and greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria, tiene 33 años, es natural de la ciudad Paucartambo,  es madre y padre para sus siete hijos. Su principal actividad económica es vender comida en el mercado modelo de Urubamba y le va muy bien. Su actividad complementaria es vender pollipapas y salchipapas de forma ambulatoria.
 
Maria pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son dos años que participa en el banco comunal. Actualmente, ella requiere el crédito para comprar insumos como pollos y papas.
 
Maria es una mujer trabajadora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario dar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. El anhelo de la socia es comprar un carro para después alquilarlo. 

Maria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria is 33 years old, a native of the city of Paucartambo, and is mother and father to her 7 children. Her principal economic activity is selling meals in the Model Market of Urubamba, and it has gone very well. Her complementary activity is to sell Peruvian foods such as “pollipapas” and “salchipapas” in the streets. Maria belongs to the “SAYHUA Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association. She has participated in her communal bank for 2 years now. At present, she needs a loan to buy supplies, such as chickens and potatoes. Maria is a hard-working woman who looks for opportunities at each moment to get ahead and, by her daily efforts, to provide a better future for her children. Her dream is to buy a car to rent out. Maria is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and she promises to comply with the corresponding schedule of payments.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING INGREDIENTES, INCLUDING CHICKENS AND POTATOES, FOR THE MEALS SHE SELLS

loans.name: Elias

texts.es: Elías tiene 66 años, está casado con Floriza de 55 años, en este matrimonio se concibió a 6 hijos, quienes son mayores de edad y trabajan de manera independiente, él vive sólo junto a su amada en su vivienda propia. Dedicándose a la agricultura, pudo solventar la educación de sus hijos, comprar su domicilio y todos los muebles necesarios para su comodidad, así como sus necesidades primarias. Es por eso que lleva 10 años sembrando papa, arveja, maíz y habas, en terrenos arrendados. Asimismo cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, quien la ayuda en la temporada de cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su oficio, es comercializar y recuperar la inversión que hizo. Por ahora su mayor anhelo es buscar un local en la ciudad, para instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles que le permitan obtener beneficios económicos sin tantos sacrificios. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y es uno de las personas más responsables del grupo, esto lo hace muy respetado y querido, por el cual se siente motivado para continuar laborando en su grupo comunal de manera activa. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará sacos de abono y costales de semilla de papa.
texts.en:
Elias, age 66, is married to Floriza, age 55. This couple has 6 children who are all independent and have jobs. He and his beloved live in a house of their own. His job in agriculture has allowed him to pay for his children's education, purchase a home, furnish it, and cover their basic needs. For this reason, he has been growing potatoes, peas, corn, and broad beans on rented fields. He has the support of his wife, who helps him during harvest. What he likes most about his job is selling his produce and recouping the investment he made. For now, his greatest wish is to look for a business space in the city so that he can set up a general store, allowing him to obtain financial benefits without so much sacrifice. This is his sixth loan with MFP. He is one of the most responsible members of the group, which makes him a respected and beloved person. He is motivated to continue working actively with the group. With the 1,500.00 PEN that he is requesting, he will purchase bags of fertilizer and sacks of potato seed.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potato seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Belencita

texts.en:
Belencita L. is from the village of North Poblacion, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Belencita is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Belencita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Belencita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Belencita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belencita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Belencita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Belencita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Roberth

texts.es: Roberth tiene 24 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y piensa en progresar y tener un buen futuro, vive en casa de su hermana con sus sobrinos. Gracias a su gran iniciativa y creatividad con el trabajo se las ingenió para lograr ingresos extras, es así que teniendo un negocio con su hermana, que es dar servicio de Internet, por lo que cuenta con cabinas personales. Paralelamente a esto, colocó un play station, actividad que el está generando más ingresos económicos. Además de ello, durante las mañanas tiene otro oficio, en una empresa de teléfonos, donde le mantiene ocupado durante todo el día. En un futuro desea seguir mejorando su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de computadoras y play stations y así mejorar sus ingresos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará CD con contenido de los últimos juegos de play station, así como otro play station para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Roberth is 24 years old. He is a hardworking gentleman who thinks about making progress and having a good future. Roberth lives at home with his sister and his nephews. Thanks to his great initiative and creativity, he is able to generate extra income. Roberth and his sister have a business providing Internet service by renting out individual computer stations. At the same time, they installed a PlayStation console to create more revenue. Roberth also has a job working for the telephone company, which keeps him busy all day. In the future, he wants to continue improving his business by purchasing more computers and PlayStation consoles to generate more income.

This is his second loan with MFP. Roberth has always been known for being prompt with all of his payments. The loan he requested will be used to buy a video game CD containing the latest PlayStation games, as well as another PlayStation console in order to earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a video game CD and a PlayStation console

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his family and, like the majority of Lebanese guys, he helps his family with his job income.

He has owned a barber shop in his town since 2005 and has ten years of experience in this occupation; he learned this occupation when he was very young. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve the decor of his barbershop and to make some renovations to offer a comfortable place to his clients.

loans.use: To improve the decor of his barbershop and make some renovations

loans.name: Enkhtsetseg

texts.en: Enkhtsetseg T. is 27 years old and lives with her two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Two years ago she became divorced from her husband. Now she lives with her two daughters, in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent, on relatives' land. Her 2 daughters are 2 and 4 years old and attend a kindergarten. Enkhtsetseg's family moved to the town from the countryside, where she was a herder. Eight years ago, she made the move in search of a better life for her family. Currently, Enkhtsetseg operates a clothing sales business at Narantuul market, the largest and most crowded market in the city. She started this business in 2003 by purchasing products in Ereen, a Chinese border city. In winter and spring time she sews children’s overcoats and coveralls. She is an open and very hardworking person. She is requesting a loan to purchase current assets.

loans.use: to increase current assets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Paying family expenses

loans.name: Sirina

texts.en: Madame Sirina M. sells plastics, dishes, and other cooking utensils at her stall in the Adidogome Market in Lome. She also sells them by carrying them on her head while walking through the streets of her neighborhood. Madame M. has been engaged in this activity since 2000. She normally purchases her merchandise here in Lome, and this time she has asked for a loan of 400,000 CFA in order to help her make her purchases. She is 44 years old and married to a chauffeur. They have one child together.

loans.use: To purchase plastic dishes and other items

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Felicia; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es viuda; La socia tiene 5 hijos y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella vende comidas en el mercado, La socia elabora las viandas todos los días muy temprano y los lleva a vender en el mercado de forma ambulatoria, ella desea poner su restaurante en el futuro, La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ingredientes y continuar con la elaboración de comidas caseras. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Felicia, 49, is a widow. She has five children and is a member of the “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She combines her household activities with retail. She sells prepared meals in the market. She prepares her dishes daily very early and takes them to the market to sell in an ambulatory manner. She’d like to set up a restaurant in the future. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients she needs to continue to make her home-made dishes. She is grateful to those who are part of this dream by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her home-made dishes.

loans.name: Duy

texts.en: Duy T. H. is 29 years old with 2 children who are attending secondary school. She has a small shop that serves breakfasts with a variety of meals such as bread, noodles, and soup. Her shop is crowded with local eaters. She can earn 100,000 VND per day. Now, she needs a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy more sets of tables and chairs to attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy more sets of tables and chairs to attract more customers.

loans.name: Portia

texts.en:
Portia P. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao. She is 55 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Portia runs a grocery store. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $88 a month for these activities.

In 2003, Portia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,500 PHP from PMPC. 

Portia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock to sell. This will be her 15th loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the store

loans.name: Chel

texts.en: Chel N., 45, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for fertile farmland for growing vegetables. N. sells sugar cane, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of about USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family has to spend USD 45 on food, USD 10 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 15 on other necessary expenses every month.  N. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more sugar cane to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits she can earn to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy more sugar cane to resell

loans.name: Kdan Channary's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of four members located in Preaek Ruessei village in Kandal province. Mrs. Kdan C. has been selected as the leader of the group loan. With the loans, each group member hopes to increase their income to improve their family's standard of living.
Mrs. C., 61, earns her living by renting her house. She also works as a farmer on her own plot of land where she cultivates vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Moek Hum, is 63 years old and works as a Buddhist priest in the pagoda. Since this month is rainy season, their house is flooded so they are requesting a loan to buy soil to fill in the front yard. The couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy soil to fill in the front yard

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a thirty-one-year-old hardworking man, married with three children, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a grand dream of educating his children up to tertiary levels and increasing his household income on a daily basis. He deals in brick making and has been in the business for eleven years. From this he has been able to start up a bar and a shop and his dream is to have his own plot of land in the trading center so as to construct a rental house. Emmanuel intends to use the loan to pay labor to make more bricks for sale.

loans.use: Paying labor to make more bricks for sale

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
Miraflor B. is from the village of Bonbon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 30 years old. Miraflor is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Miraflor owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing hairdressing services. Her husband is the barber to local community members. Miraflor has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Miraflor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miraflor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Miraflor is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Miraflor from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

location.town: Bonbon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with six children, three of whom attend school while three graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity, clothing and school fees.

She has operated a food stall business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mwanaisha faces a major challenge of competition in her business. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of Irish potatoes, bundles of wheat flour, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of Irish potatoes, bundles of wheat flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence L. is from the village of Marannao. She is 53 years old. Florence is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Florence owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Florence has been engaged in her business for over 19 years and earns approximately 30000 PHP per harvest or every four months.

In 2007, Florence joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florence has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Florence is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Florence from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Algen

texts.en:
Algen B. is from the village of Comon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Algen is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such beverages, snack foods and biscuits in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Algen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Algen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and candies. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and candies

loans.name: Juan Eustacio

texts.es:
Juan, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, tiene 39 años y vive solo, está soltero,  se dedica a la siembra y comercialización de granos básicos, este oficio lo aprendió de niño ayudando a su padre a sembrar, por el momento Juan tiene toda la producción de su siembra y debe pagar mozos para la recolección y almacenamiento, por lo que solicita un préstamo para el pago de los trabajadores que le ayudaran a realizar el proceso.
Con este préstamo podrá dar empleo a varias personas para que ayuden a recoger y guardar toda la producción que obtuvo de su siembra de maíz, además de que estos alimentos estarán listos para prepararse.
El quiere seguir con la ayuda de préstamos para continuar en el trabajo de campo y proveer alimentación.
texts.en:
Juan lives in Corinto, in the Department of Morazán, El Salvador. He is 39, single, and lives alone. Juan works planting and selling staple food grains, a job that he learned as a child by helping his father with planting. Right now Juan's crops are ready to harvest and he needs to hire workers to help harvest and store them. He is asking for a loan to pay these workers to help him finish the job. 

The money from this loan will allow Juan to employ various people to help him harvest his entire corn crop and put it into safe storage. Once harvested, these crops will be ready to be used as food. Juan would like to continue to get loans in order to keep working in agriculture and provide food to others.

loans.use: To pay for workers to help in the harvest of crops.

loans.name: Rupare

texts.en:
Rupare D. is 34 years old. He is married, and he is the father of five school-going children. Rupare is a farmer. He farms his own piece of land, and he has been doing this for the last ten years with good returns.

He learned about KADET LTD from a friend who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his second loan. He plans to buy maize, seeds, chemicals, and fertilizer for his maize plantation. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent more land for farming in order to increase his maize output.

Rupare's dream is to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can plant maize on a larger scale. Rupare struggles, but by having the right resources at his disposal, he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To buy maize, seeds, chemicals, and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tools and other equipment to expand her furniture making business

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es: Isidora tiene 45 años. Es una mujer emprendedora siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan.  Su actividad económica es la venta de bolsitas, gaseosas, bolis, bolsitas de leche entre otros. Isidora se dedica a este negocio desde hace más de 2 años la ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, la mayoría de sus clientes siempre se encuentran satisfechos, por los buenos productos que ofrece. A pesar de ser una mujer que vive en condiciones humildes sabe ganarse el pan de cada día todos los días con su negocio, es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de bolsas, azúcar, frutas, gaseosas y jugos.
texts.en: Isidora, 45, is an enterprising woman who is always devoted to the needs of her customers. Her business is selling handbags, soft drinks, pens, milk, etc. Isidora has been in business for over two years and her business is located in her home. The majority of her customers are always satisfied by the high-quality products she offers. Despite being a woman from humble means, she knows how to earn money each day with her business. That is why is asking for a loan to buy handbags, sugar, fruits, soft drinks, and juices.

loans.use: to buy handbags, sugar, fruits, soft drinks, and juices

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a young woman from Qalqilia city. Ghada is a mother of two daughters and four sons. Ghada works in a tailoring workshop. She has been working in this field for a long time which gave her the experience to start her own project.

Ghada took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a sewing machine and start tailoring in her house to increase their income and help her husband in taking care of their family.

Ghada is a conservative woman who is not comfortable having her picture posted online, therefore her husband was photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es: La señora Julieta tiene un puesto de venta de ropa en la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto, su esposo es chofer  y es socio propietario en el sindicato de movilidades  Eduardo Avaroa; el crédito lo necesita para el aumento de mercadería como ser ropa para toda edad. Estas actividades son  la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. Es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Ernesto Torres de la ciudad de La Paz. Su relación con IMPRO data desde el año  2007.
texts.en:
Julieta has a clothes stall in the 16 de Julio neighborhood, in the city of El Alto.  Her husband is a driver.  He owns his own vehicle and is a member of the Eduardo Avaroa drivers' union.

Julieta needs this loan to increase her merchandise.  She will buy clothes for all ages.  This work is Julieta's source of income which she uses to support her family.  She is married, has two children, and lives in her own home which is located in Ernesto Torres neighborhood, in the city of La Paz.  She has been working with IMPRO since 2007.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell from her stall in the city of El Alto

loans.name: Maria Soraya

texts.es:
Soraya de 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora que empezó su actividad por medio de una señora donde trabajaba como empelada  y le enseño en la preparación de bolones y desde allí invirtió en su propio negocio.

Ella labora desde las 6:00 am hasta las 12:30 pm junto con su esposo. Del fruto de esa relación tienen una hija de dos años. Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos para su negocio como chancho, colas, y adecuar su local. En un futuro quiere mantener su negocio y abrir otro por su casa.
texts.en:
Soraya, 28, is a hard working woman who started her business through a woman that used to employ her and taught her how to make bolones (typical Ecuadoran fast food).  From there she invested in her own business.

She works from 6am until 12:30pm alongside her husband.  They have a two-year-old daughter.

She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her business like pigs and soft drinks; she will also fix up her locale.  In the future, she’d like keep her business and open another one near her house.

loans.use: to buy pigs and soft drinks and to fix up her locale.

loans.name: Warmin Antawipa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WARMIN ANTAWIPA” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Maria Luz. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos comercio, producción y servicio 

La señora María Luz,  indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio que consiste en una tienda de abarrotes, el que viene trabajando hace dos años y medio, aprendiendo este negocio de su mamá. Ella cuenta que el monto con el que inicio fue de 500bs. Dinero que poco a poco fue haciéndolo crecer.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumento de su mercadería (compra de fideo, azúcar, verduras, etc.) que adquirirá de las mayoristas de la Garcilazo  de la Vega (calle comercial de la ciudad de La Paz) y los venderá todos los días en su tienda de 6:00am hasta las 12:00pm. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

En la foto no aparese la señora Martha,se no tovo una buena pose.
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta sus beneficios, los ahorros y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The credit association "WARMIN ANTAWIPA" began its second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltacion Center. It is made up of 8 members and is directed by a board headed by Maria Luz. The association members' businesses are varied and include commerce, production and service.

Maria Luz joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of a friend. Currently she has a grocery store where she has been working for 2 1/2 years. She learned the business from her mother. She tells us that she started with 500 bolivianos, money which little-by-little she has made grow.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her merchandise by purchasing noodles, sugar, vegetables, etc from the wholesalers in the Garcilazo de la Vega (a commercial street in the city of La Paz). She will sell her products every day in her store from 6:00am until 12:00pm. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, since she is single and has 2 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she enjoys the benefits, the savings and the trainings. 

Martha does not appear in the photograph, she didn't have a good pose.

loans.use: to increase merchandise (noodles, rice, sugar)

loans.name: May

texts.en:
Mrs. May, 44, is a married woman who is blessed with five children.  Four of her children are students in the local public school. Her husband's name is Douk.  He is 46 years old and works in the farming business.  

Mrs. May has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living.  As the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for her and her family, Mrs. May has requested a loan of US$ 900 in order to buy feed and more piglets to raise.  She will the rest of the funds to pay for plowing costs and to buy corn seeds for planting.

loans.use: buy more pig feed and piglets

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes wholesale to sell

loans.name: Hilaria Ursula

texts.es: Hilaria nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 51 años de edad. Actualmente, Hilaria vive en la misma ciudad donde nació junto con sus tres hijos. Hilaria se dedica a la venta de artesanía de tipo bisutería. Ya son cinco años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Hilaria requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como alambre y dijes. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Hatun  Rumiyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Hilaria was born in Cusco (Peru).  Hilaria is 51 years old, and she currently lives with her three children in the same city where she was born.

Hilara sells handicrafts, and the kind of handicrafts she sells is costume jewelry.  She has had this business for five years.  It is going very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

At this time Hilaria needs a loan to buy materials like wire and pendants.

She is a responsible and hard-working person.  It is for these qualities that her colleagues invited her to participate in the Hatun Rumiyoc Communal Bank with the Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy materials like wire and pendants.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is 35 years old, married and blessed with two children in school. He has been operating a retail shop for four years to earn a living. Besides, he offers cleaning services for a fee so as to supplement his family’s income. Kennedy has benefited from Faulu Kenya and has boosted his business with his previous loan. He hopes to grow his business into a wholesale operation in five years. He has requested 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy rice, cooking fat and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking fat and maize flour.

loans.name: Enelita

texts.en:
Enelita is married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Enelita is 43 years old and has one child who is in school.

Enelita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Enelita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing materials.

Enelita has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Enelita would like to save enough money to purchase an additional fishing boat and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Vusal

texts.ru:
Vusal rodilsya v 1987 qodu. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoim bratom. Vusal ne jenat i ne imeyet detey.
Uje 2 qoda kak Vusal otkril etot magazin dlya prodaji pishevix produktov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN dlya uvelicheniya pomesheniya chtobi razmeshat bolshe tovarov.
texts.en:
Vusal  was born in 1987. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his brother.    Vusal is single and has no children.

Two years ago, Vusal opened this shop to sell groceries.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to expand his shop so he will have room for more goods.

loans.use: to expand his shop

loans.name: Galilaya Group

texts.en:
Agness, who is in her late 30s, is married and has four children. Three of her children go to school. She has had a food selling business for two years now. She works from 5:00 AM to 4:00 PM daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock, and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase her food stock and to buy one sack of charcoal. Her dream is to one day be able to buy big quantities of food and to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Galilaya," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase her food stock and to buy one sack of charcoal.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Merlita has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell.
Merlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.ru:
Виталий женат, у него есть один 7-ми летний сын. Виталий владеет малым бизнесом – продает различные электротовары: лампочки, светильники, кабель, розетки и многое другое. Свой бизнес он начал 5 лет назад. За это время Виталий наработал большую базу постоянных покупателей, в том числе магазинов, которые заказывают у него партии товара.

Виталий – целеустремленный, предприимчивый и трудолюбивый. У него сочетаются такие черты характера как доброта, отзывчивость с одной стороны и расчетливость с другой. Возможно, именно такое сочетание помогает Виталию устанавливать хорошие связи с покупателями и делает его бизнес успешным. 

Виталий намерен развивать свой бизнес дальше и просит предоставить ему кредит в размере 17,000 гривен на покупку большого объема электрокабеля по оптовой цене.  Полученный доход Виталий планирует направить на улучшение своих жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Vitaliy is married, has a seven-year-old son and is a small business owner. He deals in various electrical supplies, such as: light bulbs, lamps, cables, sockets, etc. Over the five years since starting his business, he has accumulated a number of constant buyers, including stores which order supplies from him in bulk. 

Vitaliy is motivated, driven and diligent. His personality allows him to establish good customer relations; his traits include kindness and charity which border with prudence.

Vitaliy is dedicated to developing his business further and is asking for a loan in order to purchase a large amount of electric cable in bulk. He plans to use the profits to improve his housing conditions.

loans.use: to purchase large amount of electric cable in bulk

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 40 años, esta casada con Paulino de 42 años y fruto de esa relación tienen 05 hijos que se encuentran en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en su propia casa donde reina la comprensión y el apoyo mutuo entre si. Ella proviene de una familia que por tradición se han dedicado a la agricultura, pero hace 15 años cuenta con su propia parcela de 03 hectáreas, ahí cultiva café y cacao, siendo éste último, que mayor demanda tiene en el mercado. La clave de su éxito radica en la creatividad y las ganas de trabajar, pues sus plantas están cultivadas bajo las técnicas agrícolas que aplicó Bertha y esto es gracias a las enseñanzas que le dieron los Ingenieros Agrónomos. Su esposo es quien más lo apoya en este trabajo, sin embargo cuando es temporada de  cosecha necesariamente debe contratar jornaleros, de esa manera pueda terminar a tiempo la extracción y selección de su producto. Su plan a futuro es seguir ampliando su producción, así logrará cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y espera contar una vez más con el apoyo de todos ustedes para concretar sus planes, por lo cual él esta apto en cumplir puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 soles que solicita, contratará jornaleros para que lo apoyen en la cosecha y sacar la maleza de entre sus plantas.
texts.en:
Bertha, 40, is married to Paulino, 42, and they have five children in school.  They all live in their own house, a home filled with mutual understanding and support.  She comes from a family that has traditionally worked in agriculture and 15 years ago she received her own land of 3 hectares.

There she grows coffee and cacao, the latter with the higher market value.  The key to her success lies in her creativity and desire to work.  Her plants grow with the agricultural techniques that Bertha was taught by agricultural engineers.
Her husband helps her in this work but they still need to hire farm workers seasonally so that they can harvest all and select their products.
Her future plan is to continue expanding her production so that she can fill her customers requests.
This is her fourth loan with MFP and she hopes to receive one more loan with the help of all of you to finish her plans.  Because of this she is punctual in her payments.  She will use the 1000 sols to hire farmworkers for help during the harvest and to pull the weeds among the crops.

loans.use: to hire farm workers

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
L. señora margarita cuenta con 78 años D. edad, está casada con el señor armando quien es campesino, tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales solo L. menor estudia, Ana erendira está cursando el 4 año D. L. carrera en derecho, ya que los demás todos están casados, se dedica a L. elaboración y venta D. pan desD. hace mas D. 30 años.
Dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, por que su madre se dedicaba a esto y le enseño muy bien, para así apoyar un poco a su esposo con los gastos D. L. casa y a sus hijos con sus estudios, también así hacerse D. una mejor solvencia económica y  calidad D. vida, el crédito que recibió lo invirtió en L. compra D. mas insumos para L. elaboración del pan como son: harina, huevos, azúcar, piloncillo, manteca, carbonato, colorante, caneL., levadura leña, etc.
ElL. dice que una D. las metas que tiene para su negocio, es L. D. hacerlo crecer muchísimo, ya que quiere construir un local, para poner su panadería, así mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias, y poder seguir apoyando a su hija con sus estudios, para que pueda terminar su carrera.
Esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los donadores D. kiva por todo el apoyo que les están brindando, ya que gracias a eso ahora cuenta con un mejor negocio y nivel D. vida.
texts.en:
Margarita is 78 years old and married to Armando who is an agricultural worker.  They have five children but only their youngest is still studying.  Ana Erendira is in the fourth year of a law degree.  The other children are all married.  Margarita has been making and selling bread for more than 30 years.

Margarita tells us that she decided to start working in this business because her mother was in the same business and she taught her very well so that she could support her husband a little with the household expenses and help pay for their children's education.  She has also managed to improve her financial situation and her quality of life.

Margarita invested the loan that she received in buying more supplies for making bread such as flour, eggs, sugar, 'piloncillo' (unrefined whole cane sugar), butter, bicarbonate, dyes, cinnamon, yeast, firewood, etc.  She says that one of the goals she has for her business is to grow it a lot as she would like to build premises for her bakery so that she can improve and increase her profits and continue supporting her daughter in her studies so that she can finish her degree.

Margarita is very grateful to Fundación Realidad and Kiva lenders for all the support that they give her because it has meant that she now has a better business and a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more supplies such as flour, eggs, sugar, 'piloncillo' (unrefined cane sugar), butter, bicarbonate, dyes, cinnamon, yeast, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 38 years old, married and has four children in school.  To earn a living, he sells bananas.  He has been in the business for over ten years.  He sells the bananas both retail and wholesale.  He also does dairy farming to earn extra income.  

Titus hopes to expand his business and become financially stable in the future.  He has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to add stock of bananas.

loans.use: To add stock of bananas.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 37 years old. She makes a living by selling cassava flour and vegetables and fruits and this is her third successful year in this business. Her business is open from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day except on Saturday and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Epiphanie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more cassava flour and vegetables and fruits as well as rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc., to sell. 

With this loan, Epiphanie hopes to earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting and saving for better financial stability.

loans.use: To expand her business with more types of goods to sell.

loans.name: Juana Virginia

texts.es: Juana, tiene la necesidad de un nuevo préstamo, porque quiere continuar invirtiendo en él para mejorar económicamente, este lo invertirá en mercadería como frijoles, arroz, salsa, boquitas, aceite, huevos, pan, harinas, aumentando así la variedad en los productos. Esta inversión le servirá para abastecer el negocio y que igual al anterior sea todo un provecho para crecer y recibir más ingresos.
texts.en: Juana now needs a new loan as she wishes to continue investing in her business and earn more money. She wants to buy more merchandise such as beans, rice, sauces, snacks, oil, eggs, bread, and flour so that she has a greater variety of products. This investment will provide her with more stock, and as before she will benefit by increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sauces, snacks, oil, eggs, bread, and flour

loans.name: Jembe Shg Bidii Group

texts.en:
David is the facilitator of the Jembe SHG Bidii group. David and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

David takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, David had a good maize yield, harvesting 7 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  David was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to David and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, David will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Jembe SHG Bidii group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, David is pictured with his group members and the field officer on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Protogene

texts.en: Protegene is 41 years old and has 3 children ages 6 to 15. All of his children are currently in school. He sells clothes in a store that he has run for 8 years. Protegene would like a loan to buy more clothes to stock his shop. He will use any profits to pay school fees for his children. He dreams to one day become a distributor for used clothing.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Diana, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 6 y 1  años, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido trabaja en una fábrica de la localidad.
