Ella al ver que su esposo no gana lo suficiente para mantener el hogar se ha visto en la necesidad de ganar sus propios recursos para ayudarlo a salir adelante, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y ropa interior, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y sale a recorrer tres días de la semana en las mañanas o en las noches ya que a esa hora sus hijos quedan al cuidado de su marido o de su mamá.  Ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada 8 días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene recién 6 meses que se dedica a este negocio y le está yendo muy  bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, ropa de niños y ropa interior. Está en el Banco Comunal  dos años y le gusta porque el grupo es bastante unido.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Camino al Progreso' community bank meet in the city of Montecristi which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture.  It is also known, both nationally and internationally, for its handicrafts.  It is home to the famous Panama hat.  

Here we find 22-year-old Diana, who lives with her common-law husband and has two children aged 6 and 1.  Her eldest child attends elementary school.  Diana's husband works in a local factory.

Seeing that her husband didn't earn enough money to support their household, Diana needed to earn her own money so that she could help him provide for their family.  Diana's business is selling all kinds of clothing and underwear.  She makes her sales door to door and goes out three days a week to sell her goods.  She makes her sales in the mornings or in the evenings as this is when her children are in the care of her husband or her mom.  She leaves her goods with her customers on credit and collects payment every week.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs to.

Diana has been in this business for barely 6 months and it is going very well.  She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, children's clothes and underwear.  She has been a member of her community bank for two years and she likes it because her group is quite united.  Diana's dream is to make progress in her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, children's clothes and underwear

loans.name: Drusilla

texts.en:
Drusilla is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. She has one child and operates a bureau stall which has been in operation for the past six years. Besides this, Drusilla also sells bed sheets, shirts and shoes. 

Drusilla is applying for a loan of KES 80,000 to purchase printing papers, a photocopier and soft drinks. She looks forward to investing the extra income into purchasing property for the family.

loans.use: to purchase printing papers, a photocopier and soft drinks.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 53 years old, and married with five children. With one child in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for her family. Evelyn runs a rice retail business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 20 years.  In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.en:
Raymundo is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Raymundo has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Raymundo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Raymundo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: El señor Miguel tiene estudios a nivel primaria procedente de la provincia Ayopaya, trabajó desde muy joven para apoyar a sus hermanos, después de colaborar con sus hermanos, a los pocos años formo su propia familia, en la que tiene 4 dependientes, don miguel trabaja como agricultor para poder mantener a su familia también realiza actividades como jornalero. Con su esposa, se dedican al comercio de ropa. El préstamo que solicitan es para capital de operaciones para aumentar la mercadería en ropa (ropa nueva) para que continúen con las actividades de venta de ropa y mejoren los ingresos de la familia.
texts.en: Miguel completed primary school and is from the province of Ayopaya. He worked since he was very young to support his siblings. After collaborating with his siblings for a few years, he formed his own family. He has four dependents. Miguel works as a farmer to be able to support his family. He also works as a day laborer. With his wife, they have a clothing sales business. The loan that they are requesting is to have working capital to increase the clothing stock (new clothes) to continue with the business of selling clothes, and improve the family income.

loans.use: to have working capital for his wife's business (buying clothes).

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Mariatu from Waterloo2 in the western rural area of Freetown. She is married with two children.  In 2010, Mariatu established her slippers business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income to support her child. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to purchase a variety of plastic slippers for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Mariatu plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of plastic slippers for resale.

loans.name: Disamet

texts.en: Dysamet, a villager from Kampong Cham province, is 32 years old and married. She is blessed with three dependent kids; one is too young for schooling and two are in school. She overcomes her family’s hardship via rice farming and paid working job. The business that she has had for ages has returned her about 30, 600 KHR. This is the first loan for Dysamet with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to buy more farmland to expand her rice cropping scale. She hopes to gain good yield than before.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.use: To buy more farmland to expand her rice cropping scale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 55 years old from Mahayag. She has a small piece of land for her agricultural activities. Virginia has sought several loans from Paglaum for her farmland and she wants to avail another loan to purchase fertilizer. She is now preparing for the next cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Mrs. Eunice O. is a 32 years old woman with two (2) children. She lives at Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells birds to the public for consumption. She needs the above amount for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more birds for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to buy 25 sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Maa

texts.en:
Maa's family had a small store but it got destroyed.  In early 2006, with a small amount of her own money she started a small business selling eggs, onions, and salt in the open market. Later she joined SMT and has successfully expanded her business with the on-time repaid loans she has received. This new loan will help her diversify her stock to include rice, palm oil, and peanuts.

Maa S. is 35 years old with 4 children. Her small business helps supplement the income of her husband who works as a day laborer.

loans.use: Diversify the types of products she sells in the open market.

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.es:
Cornelio is 40 years old, has been married for 4 years and has three children, all of which are minors and still in school. His wife, Justina, is a housewife and helps him earn money working in their store.

Cornelio and his wife used to live with his parents in Carapeguá and hoped to one day have a home of their own. They thus went on a trip to Argentina to work and earn enough money to build a house.

About four years ago they returned and built their house. They also set up their store, which Justina managed while Cornelio started another business in order to double their income. He started to work as a traveling salesman selling typical local products like blankets, hammocks, hand-embroidered table cloths, etc.

Since they are both very enterprising and hard-working, their businesses soon grew. Cornelio used the earnings generated by the businesses to buy a motorcycle that he uses in his work as a traveling salesman.

Cornelio hopes to continue this expansion by increasing the stock of merchandise for his traveling sales. For this purpose he is asking for a loan of $600, which he will invest in his business to buy more blankets, embroidered tablecloths, bedspreads, hammocks and typical local shirts. This will enable him to increase his income to continue to give his family a good life and will allow his children to continue to study so that they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Cornelio tiene 40 años, está casado hace 4 años, tiene tres hijos, todos ellos menores y están en edad escolar. Su señora Justina es ama de casa y lo ayuda con los ingresos de la casa, atendiendo un almacén que tienen ambos.

Cornelio y su señora vivían anteriormente con sus padres en unas de las compañías de la ciudad de Carapeguá, con el sueño de tener una vivienda propia decidieron emprender un viaje a la República Argentina con su señora para trabajar y así juntar la plata para construir la casa.

Hace cuatro años atrás volvieron y construyeron su casa, donde también montaron su despensa, que es administrado por Justina, mientras que Cornelio emprendió a la par otra actividad para poder doblar sus ingresos, el se dedica a la venta ambulante productos típicos de la zona, como ser frazadas, hamacas, manteles bordados a mano, etc. Como ambos son personas muy emprendedoras y trabajadoras, en poco tiempo ellos fueron progresando; con las ganancias generadas, Cornelio compró uno motocicleta que lo utiliza para sus ventas ambulantes.

Cornelio está deseoso de seguir progresando, desea aumentar su stock de mercaderías para la venta ambulante por lo que solicita un crédito de $ 600 que los invertirá en la compra de más frazadas, manteles bordados, cobertores, hamacas, y camisas típicas, esto permitirá aumentar sus ingresos para seguir dando a su familia una vida digna y lograr que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que el día de mañana sean profesionales de bien.

loans.use: To purchase blankets, embroidered table cloths, bedspreads, hammocks and typical local shirts

loans.name: Susiati

texts.id:
In this time of high unemployment, Susiati feels tremendous economic pressure in her poor family. Susiati started a small convenience store that sells daily household goods, like rice, vegetables, spices. Each day she needs $20 capital to buy goods to be sold. She usually earns $5 daily profit. She uses earnings from her store to pay for daily expenses totaling $2, including school fees for her children who is in 3rd grade and to feed her 1 year 8 months infant child. Susiati and her family lives in their own home. Susiati hopes that her business will grow to be able to sustain her family's economy, and support her children to higher education levels.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Tekanan ekonomi bagi keluarga kurang mampu sangat terasa akibatnya sekarang ini, pekerjaan yang sulit, apalagi bagi kehidupan Susiati, meskipun begitu Susiati membuka usaha warung di rumahnya dengan menjual berbagai macam jenis barang dagangan mulai dari Sembako sampai keperluan sehari –hari. Modal usaha yang dibutuhkan per hari Rp 200.000,- dan dari modal tersebut bisa mendatangkan keuntungan Rp 50.000 Dari hasil berjualan itu ia gunakan untuk biaya hidupnya Rp. 20.000,- perhari termasuk biaya sekolah anaknya yang baru kelas 3 sekolah dasar dan yang seorang lagi baru berumur 1 th 8 bln. Susiati dan keluarganya tinggal di sebuah rumah milik mereka sendiri. Susiati berharap usahanya kelak akan berkembang untuk menunjang perekonomian keluarganya serta menunjang akan cita-cita anaknya dapat sekolah sampai ke tingkat yang lebih tinggi.

loans.use: Purchase Household Goods to be Sold

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham Q. is a 48-year-old butcher who sells meat in the local bazaar of the Imishli region. He lives in Imishli with his family and has  owned his business since 1996. First he was raising and selling meat to the local bazaar traders, and later he opened his own store where he cut and sold meat. He has many regular clients. The money IIham earns from selling is enough tonly to cover family needs and his working place is not very good. His place of working is very small, damp and dark. He would like to improve his working conditions and for this purpose he applied for 800 USD. This loan will help him to repair his small shop. He believes good conditions in his working place will help him to attract more clients and generally improve his business.

loans.use: Going to repair his butcher shop

loans.name: Libana

texts.en:
Libana belongs to the La Familia (The Family) Communal Bank. She lives on the 3,800 kilometer of Centenario Avenue in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 59-years-old and is the mother of 3 children who are now adults. They help her with her business when they can. She used to sell candy, but the income she maD. doesn't cover all of the family expenses. This is why Libana used the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 nuevos soles ($100) to invest in selling soft drinks, both wholesale and retail.

Presently she has a store where she sells soft drinks, which is located in her home. She also prepares sandwiches. She gets up very early to prepare breakfast and then dedicates herself to her business all day. She also has the support of her husband and kids. In her free time, she likes to read and knit.

With the current loan received from Manuela Ramos of 2,000 nuevos soles ($669), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 20 boxes and packages of large and small soft drinks, a dozen sausages, and 6 packages of candy (at wholesale prices).

Libana is very peaceful thanks to Manuela Ramos because they knew how to advise her so she could start her business and have economic stability, which lets her be happy at the siD. of her loved ones.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Libana pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, vive en la Av. Centenario Km. 3.800, del distrito Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 59 años D. edad y es madre D. 3 hijos que ya son mayores D. edad, pero cuando pueden la apoyan en su negocio, su esposo se dedica a la venta D. golosinas, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos familiares, es así que Libana, con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) deciD. invertirlo en la venta D. gaseosas al por mayor y menor.

En la actualidad cuenta con una tienda D. venta D. bebidas gaseosas, ubicada en su misma casa; paralelamente prepara samwich (alimentos), se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno para después dedicarse a su negocio todo el día. Cuenta con la ayuda D. su esposo y sus hijos. En sus ratos libres le gusta mucho leer y tejer.

Con el actual préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 2,000 (US$ 669.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 20 cajas y paquetes D. gaseosas grandes y chicas, pan, una docena D. salchichas y 6 paquetes D. golosinas (al por mayor).

Libana, está muy tranquila gracias a Manuela Ramos, porque supieron orientarla para que ella pueda poner su negocio y así tener una estabilidad económica, la cual le permite estar feliz a lado D. sus seres más queridos.

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks at wholesale prices, purchase of candy.

loans.name: Margret's Group

texts.en: Margret is 46 years old and married with seven children. She owns a retail shop. She supplements her income with selling firewood and farming. She plans to start a poultry farm with the extra profits.

loans.use: To increase stock in her retail shop

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en: Mahir B. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the city of Fuzuli in Azerbaijan. Now he lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Mahir is 30 years old, married and has two children. He owns a bakery, and has seven years of experience preparing and selling bread. He has two employees who help him at his business. He wants the Kiva loan so that he can buy products for the preparation of bread.  He needs a loan in amount of $1200. His wish is to be able to improve his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
At her 56 years of age, Juana works as if she was half her age. Since almost thirty years ago, she has sold “seconds” (plates, glasses, plastic bags, etc.) At the beginning, she did not have a permanent shop. As a result, she sold itinerantly and would travel to the provinces on a seasonal basis. Nevertheless, she decided that it would be better to acquire a market stall and sell there since it was less tiring than always moving with all her merchandise. She decided to sell seconds because she thought it would be more profitable. Four years ago, her friend abandoned the only stall selling fish and shellfish in the market. So, she thought it would be a good idea to open one herself. Now she runs both businesses, which allows her to take care of her home and her two youngest children. Her husband also sells seconds but in another area and itinerantly. What she would most like is to be able to purchase both stalls -- because she pays rent daily – and to hire people to work for her.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

A sus cincuenta y seis años Juana trabaja como si tuviera la mitad de su edad. Desde hace casi treinta años vende productos descartables (platos, vasos, bolsas de plástico, etc.). Al inicio ella no tenia un puesto estable, motivo por el cual vendía como ambulante y por temporadas se iba de viaje a provincias. Sin embargo, consideró que seria mejor adquirir un puesto en un mercado y vender ahí ya que era menos trabajoso que estar movilizándose siempre con toda su mercadería. Decidió vender productos descartables porque pensó que era más rentable. Hace cuatro años una compañera abandono el único puesto de venta de pescados y mariscos en el mercado. De este modo, pensó que seria buena idea abrir uno ella misma. Ahora maneja ambos negocios, lo cual le permite mantener su hogar y a sus dos últimos hijos. Su esposo también trabaja vendiendo productos descartables pero en otra zona y como ambulante. Lo que más le gustaría a ella es poder comprar los dos puestos que tiene, porque paga diariamente una cuota de alquiler y contratar a personas que trabajen para ella.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of more products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Supply her business by purchasing school supplies

loans.name: Rustambek

texts.ru:
Rustambek B. lives in the region of Jomi. He has secondary education and is in the business of buying and selling cattle. After feeding them for about two months he sells the calves for meat. He has been in this business for the past four years. He wants to increase sales by getting a loan. He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months. Rustambek is married and has two children and this business is the only source of income for his family.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Бердыев Рустамбек житель района Джоми.Образование среднее. Занимается купле-продажей крупно-рогатого скота. После откормки , которая длится около 2 месяцев он продает уже готовых бычков на мясо. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 4 года. Хочет увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев. Рустамбек женат и имеет 2 детей и его бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Mariama Cissé, aged 42, is married with 10 children in her care, and has been a member of the Manguiline Santhiaba Village Bank in Bignona for five and a half years. She is seeking a loan to run a business selling seasonal fruit (madd fruit and mangoes) that she buys in Bignona and then sells at retail at the bus station. Her income enables her to provide for her family. Mariama is requesting a loan that will be repaid after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariama Cissé, 42 ans, Mariée 10 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Santhiaba à Bignona depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle veut un prêt pour faire le commerce de fruits saisonniers (madd et mangues) qu’elle achète à Bignona et revend au détail à la gare routière. Ses revenus lui permettent d’entretenir sa famille. Mariama sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Business selling seasonal fruit

loans.name: Moevao

texts.en: Moevao F., 42, is married with six children. She has many year of experience in the plantation business growing taro, yams, and bananas. She sells to the village and general public 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$208 USD).  SPBD loans are Moevao’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be used to improve her business and help out with family expenses.

loans.use: Moevao would like to buy fertilizer, barred wire, bush knives and also labour for her plantation farm.

loans.name: Razina's Wastara Group

texts.en:
Razina is 30 years old, divorced, and has 4children. She became a fish seller in 1999. Every day, she works from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about US$140.

Razina now hopes to receive a loan to buy more fish for sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses dealing with basket making and food sales.

loans.use: Purchase of fish for sale

loans.name: Frieda

texts.es:
Frieda tiene 29 años, es madre de dos preciosas hijas, que son su mayor satisfacción en la vida. Vive junto a su esposo Willer.
Se dedica a la venta de cerveza al por mayor (170 cajas semanales), las lleva a vender por diferentes caseríos de Contamana que está a un día de viaje, por río, desde su localidad. Trabaja junto con su esposo, con quien lleva en esta actividad hace 2 años, demoran casi todo el día en  acabar de vender todo su producto. A Frieda le gusta mucho su trabajo, porque así conoce muchos lugares y comparte ideas con muchas personas. En estos meses no puede acompañar a su esposo a la venta porque se encuentra esperando otro hijo. 
Esta pareja trabaja junta para solventar los gastos diarios y la educación de sus hijos.
Lo indispensable para Frieda ahora, y por lo que solicita este préstamo, es mandar a construir un bote a motor para el transporte de sus productos esto le evitará seguir estar pagando peajes, además de comprar mayor cantidad de cerveza.
texts.en:
Frieda is 29 years old, and the mother of two precious daughters who are the greatest satisfaction in her life. She lives with her husband Willer.

She dedicates herself to vending beer at wholesale (170 cases per week) which she sells throughout the various towns of Contamana -- a day’s travel away, by river, from her location. She works together with her husbad, with whom she has carried out this activity for two years. It takes them nearly a full day to complete selling their product. Frieda likes her work very much, because it allows her to get to know different areas and share ideas with many people. In most recent months she hasn’t been able to accompany her husband because she is expecting another child.

This couple works together to help meet their daily household expenses and provide an education for their children.

What Frieda finds to be indispensable now, and the reason she is seeking this loan, is to order a motor boat built so they can transport their products and avoid paying others for passage. Also, she would like to purchase additional beer to sell.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Order a motor boat built to help transport the cases of beverages that she sells.

loans.name: Mrs. Chhorn Chhoeurn's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhorn C.'s Village Bank consists of seventeen members living in Peareach Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Each member will use their loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Chhorn C. is the president of the bank and leader of this loan group. She is 24 years old and the mother of two children who both attend the local school. Mrs. Chhorn C. owns a small plot land where she can cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. CH. Vy, has a small kiln in which he can produce coal to sell. In this business, he now faces a small obstacle because he cannot transport wood in order to make coal. Thus, his wife, Mrs. Chhorn C., decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow cart to help with transport. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Nine members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cow cart to transport wood

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa K. is a 55-year-old widow and mother of five children, who have completed school. Hawa has been selling clothing door-to-door for the past twelve years. She is constrained by funds to run the business, so she wants a loan to purchase assorted clothing to serve her loyal customers. By upgrading her inventory, she will be able to scale up the progess of her business.  She belongs to the community group called “Ahobrasee” (meaning Humility) Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her clothing business

loans.name: Mawusi

texts.en: Mawusi K. is 46 years old.  She is married with four children who are currently in school. She sells food such as cassava, plantain, and maize in the local market of Tema where she lives. Since she has been selling for the past year, she has lots of selling experience to win customers. Mawusi is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide her children with quality educations for their future careers. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stock of cassava to prepare cassava dough, and bags of maize, to serve her customers. She is a member of the community group called Saints Trust Group. In this group members assist one another and provide support in handling repayment. She would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of cassava and and maize.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James N. K. started his health clinic in Elburgon, Kenya (near Nakuru) in 1997. For over ten years, he has been providing medical services to the local community, including curative services, out-patient care, family planning, minor surgeries, wound stitching, and circumcisions. Thanks to training from the Kisumu Medical and Education Trust, he is now also able to begin to provide post-abortion care for women. Abortion is illegal in Kenya, but many women receive the procedure illicitly, which can result in severe medical harm and death. James received the K-MET training in order to reduce the number of maternal mortalities by providing care to women who have suffered from botched abortions and counseling them on family planning.

James formerly worked as a nurse for the government, but the pay was not sustainable. He opened a private clinic and has been able to achieve in private practice what he was unable to working for the government. The clinic, open from 8am – 8pm Monday through Saturday, is made up of 3 rooms and James currently employs one other attendant. The patients are from the rural community, often from farming families of low economic status.

James is requesting a loan of 90,000 Kenya Schillings in order to expand the services of his clinic. At present, he is unable to provide immunizations, so he would like to use the loan money to purchase a refrigerator, which will allow him to store the materials needed to give immunizations. The fridge will cost about 15,000 Kenyan Schillings. He also needs equipment for his laboratory, such as a microscope that costs about 25,000 schillings. An expanded laboratory will allow him to conduct more tests and provide a wider range of service. This, alongside providing immunizations, will attract more patients and increase the workload of the clinic. He may need to hire another employee. James is 47 years old, married with 3 children - one girl who is 15 years old and two boys, who are 10 and 2 years old. His goal for the future of the clinic is to include maternity services and perhaps inpatient services as well.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator, microscope, and other medical supplies.

loans.name: Marisol Genoveva

texts.es:
La Joven Empresaria Marisol Genoveva C. Z. tiene la edad de 37 años, su estado civil es soltera, Marisol tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguientes su hija de 18 años cursa el 1 año de estudios generales en una universidad publica y su hijo de 12 años cursa recientemente el 1 año de secundaria, los propósitos son de aumentar su mercadería  por que tiene que solventar las deudas y gastos adquiridos  por lo que tiene que sacar adelante a su familia y darles el pan de cada día ya que también tiene a cargo a sus padres y como son de una edad muy avanzada no tienen trabajo sus sueños son de establecer una tienda con amplia mercadería y lograr que sus hijos coronen una carrera ya que considera que es la mejor herencia que les puede dejar sus deseos son que Fundación León 2000 siga apoyándola para poder concretizar todos su sueños a cumplir pues ella es una joven que ha luchado por obtener un trabajo digno.


Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general en la que ofrece: zapatos, camisas, pantalones, faldas, cosméticos entre otros, la ubicación de  su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 7 años, su negocio da comienzo por la necesidad de darle a sus hijos el alimento diario debido a la situación que ocurrió con su esposo quien la abandono y así ella decide buscar un trabajo extra de impulsadora en la empresa DISEGSA ya que cuenta con los ingresos fijos de este empleo por lo que decide establecer el negocio de venta en general  y es así que obtiene a sus clientes y el negocio en el que esta actualmente, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que comprar los diferentes productos para sus clientes y viaja hasta Managua por que es donde le resulta mas favorable.
texts.en:
The young entrepreneur Marisol Genoveva C. Z. is 37 years old, single, with two children ages 18 and 12. Her 18-year-old daughter is in her 1st year of general studies at a public college, and her 12-year-old son is in his first year of secondary school. She also takes care of her elderly parents who do not work due to their advanced age. Her main goal is to help her family get ahead, and to put food on the table. She currently has an itinerant business selling clothing and other items of personal use. She has been doing this for seven years, ever since her husband abandoned her, when she also went to work for the company DISEGSA. This has provided her with a steady income as well as the means to find customers for her side business. She would like to increase her stock of merchandise and be able to travel to Managua where conditions are more favorable. She hopes Fundacion Leon continues to support her efforts so that she can fulfill her dream of setting up a well-stocked store where she can make a good living and enable her children to find good careers, because she feels that is the best inheritance that she can leave for them.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Mohammad Nahim

texts.en:
M. Nahim is the son of M. A.. He lives in district 8th, Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has 4 children. He is a tailor and works hard to earn money to meet his family’s requirements. He needs to buy a new sewing machine for his shop because he is having lots of problems with his old machine. He would like to hire a student to help support and increase his business.

He wants to make an individual loan of 40000 Afghani for a term of 8 months and he is very glad to have the chance to expand his business.

loans.use: Buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La señora Betty Y. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de Tacagua, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo y sus dos hijas.
La señora Betty es cocinera, siendo empleada de un snack hasta el año pasado, buscando mejores ingresos,  esta instalando una pensión en su zona, la misma que requiere de arreglos para su funcionamiento.
El crédito es para la refacción de muros y ventilación de la pensión. Esta es la primera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Betty Y. lives in her parent's house with her husband and two daughters, in the Tacagua area, on the west side of the city of La Paza. Betty is a cook, being employed in a small restaurant until last year. Looking for better income, she is setting up her own small restaurant in her area, that requires repairs to be able to use. The loan is for the repair of walls and ventilation in the restaurant. This is the first loan that she has requested and the socioecomonic analysis performed favorably qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of walls and ventilation in order to set up a restaurant

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Vann S., 32, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She sells vegetables to earn a living, and she is able to make around US$2.5 every day. Her husband is a garment factory worker. On average, he makes US$5 per day. This couple has three children; two are in school and one is too young to attend. Vann S. would like to take out a loan so that she can purchase a motorbike to transport vegetables to sell at the market. This will reduce her daily transportation costs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa S., 23, is married with three children. She does not yet have any years of experience in the food production business. She sells to the general public six days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (approximately 170 USD).

She has no previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Lisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a barrel of oil, a bunch of bananas, a frying pan and sacks of taro

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina es una mujer que siempre quiso salir adelante, tiene 61 años y vive en su propia casa junto a su querida hija Norma D. 19 años, quien es el motivo D. todos sus sacrificios. El campo le ha dado a Sabina los recursos necesarios para mantener a su familia, se dedica a la crianza D. ganado desD. que tenía 10 años, actividad que aprendió D. sus padres. Actualmente sus reses están muy bien cuidadas y alimentadas, es por eso que en la feria D. Huancane y Juliaca, que es donD. lleva a vender su ganado, sus reses son las más solicitadas por los compradores. Para Sabina lo más difícil D. su trabajo es tener que llevar su ganado hasta las ferias dominicales, puesto que le es muy agotador, lleva 20 años en este negocio y lo que más le gusta es pastar a sus animales. Para el futuro espera incrementar el número D. reses que tiene, para mejorar sus ingresos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que quiere acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una D. las socias más responsables. Con los 1000 soles solicitados planea comprar un toro, el cual le costará alrededor D. 3000 soles, para ello está dispuesta a poner dinero D. sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Sabina is a woman who always wanted to get ahead. She is 61 and lives in her own house next to her beloved daughter Norma, 19, who is the motivation for all her sacrifices. The countrysiD. has given Sabina the resources necessary to support her family, she has raised livestock since she was 10 years old, which she learned from her parents. Currently her cattle are very well cared for and fed, so that in the markets of Huancane and Juliaca, which is where she takes them to sell, her cattle are the most sought-after by the purchasers. The most difficult part of her work is having to take her livestock to the Sunday markets, since it is very exhausting. She has been doing this business for 20 years, and what she enjoys the most is grazing her animals. For the future, she hopes to increase the number of cattle that she has, in order to increase her income. This is her first loan through MFP, and she is ready to make her payments on time, since she wants access to more loans later. She is one of the most responsible members of her communal bank. With the $325 she is requesting, she plans to buy a bull that will cost around $975, for which she will also use money from her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una próspera comerciante y además, una ejemplar madre y esposa, pues vive muy feliz junto a su pareja en la casa que construyeron juntos hace varios años, lugar donde compartieron bellos momentos junto a sus hijos, quienes ya formaron sus propios hogares lejos de sus padres, dejando en ellos un gran vacío. A pesar de la tristeza que tenía por la partida de sus hijos, María no dejó de trabajar y dedicarse a su negocio, pues los 6 años de funcionamiento que tiene su tienda la ayudaron a ganarse gran cantidad de clientes, a quienes atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, aprovechando que es la única tienda que abre sus puertas a tempranas horas del día, pensando en la necesidad de las madres de familia. Ahora tiene pensado ampliar su negocio, pues acaban de abrir un colegio cerca de su casa y quiere aprovechar la oportunidad para ofrecer artículos de librería y todo tipo de materiales educativos, y así convertir su bodega en un bazar, donde venda diversidad de productos para satisfacer las múltiples necesidades de sus clientes y vecinos. Ella es fundadora de su grupo y desde sus inicios en MFP ha trabajo junto a sus compañeras con mucha responsabilidad y de manera organizada, pues las líderes del grupo han incentivado un trabajo ordenado y organizado. Los 2500 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de mercadería y útiles escolares para instalar su espacio de librería.
texts.en:
María is a prosperous merchant, as well as an exemplary mother and wife. She lives very happily with her partner in the house they built together several years ago. It is a home where they shared many beautiful moments with their children, who have now formed their own homes far away from their parents leaving a large emptiness in them. Despite her sadness at her children moving away, María did not stop working or dedicating herself to her business. Over the 6 years she’s been running her enterprise, she has grown a large customer base that she tends to from 6 in the morning until 8 at night. She takes advantage of the fact that she is the only store open during the early hours of the day, thinking about the needs of the local homemakers. She is now thinking about expanding her business, as they have recently opened a new school near her house and she wants to take advantage of the opportunity to offer books and other types of school supplies. In this way, she would convert her store into a bazaar where a variety of products are sold in order to satisfy the multiple needs of her customers and neighbors. She is a founder of her group and, since starting with MFP, has worked with her colleagues in a very responsible and organized manner. The leaders of the group have given an incentive to work in an orderly and organized manner. The 2500 soles she requests would be invested into the purchase of school supplies to put in the bookstore section of her store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Maryjean

texts.en:
Maryjean M. believes that being patient and hard working will someday allow her to become a successful entrepreneur. Maryjean patiently manages a hog-raising business to fulfill her responsibility as a mother to provide for her four children. She is the loving wife of Alex M.. She and her family live in Barangay Abinganan Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. Maryjean and her husband help each other to earn a living and to support the studies of their children who are in secondary and elementary school.

Maryjean is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 for the maintenance of her hog-raising business, which has been running for many years. Her husband served as a BHW (Barangay Health Worker) in their village and is waiting for a very small Barangay Honorarium for his service. Maryjean has had to double her efforts to develop her hog-raising business so that she can give her children a better education. Maryjean is hoping that her loan will be funded because she believes it will be a great help to her business and her family.

loans.use: For her hog farm

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary O. is a 54-year-old mother of four. All of her children are working. She has sold plantains and other grocery products for the past 14 years in order to support her family. She gets her plantains directly from farmers in nearby communities, which allows her to avoid dealing with middlemen.

In addition to selling plantains, Mary also operates a grocery shop that serves the community she lives in.  In it, she sells items like sugar, biscuits, and evaporated milk. Unfortunately, business has slowed somewhat due to current food prices and the economic crunch in the world market. Mary wants to use the loan to buy more bunches of plantains and grocery products, increasing her efficiency by buying in bulk and maintaining her supply to her customers.

Mary believes this will help expand her business so she can raise more income to support her family. She belongs to a village bank called "Nyame Mmoa," which means "God’s Help."

loans.use: To buy more plantains and grocery products to restock her inventory.

loans.name: Janet Nelima

texts.en:
Janet Nelima is a fifty-one-year-old dairy farmer in Muzenywe center in Kakamega town. She is married with six children. Janet owns one dairy cow and  will use this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase one more dairy cow.

Her existing cow's milk production has greatly declined and she believes that with another cow, her milk production will increase, thus boosting her monthly income.  With her dairy business, she has managed to look after her family successfully.


About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es:
El señor Ceferino G. ya ha tenido tres créditos con FVP los cuales a pagado puntual mente y con los cuales le ha hecho mejoras ha su vivienda y al negocio.
Ahora está solicitando un préstamo para poder surtir el negocio con más variedad de productos y acondicionarlo mejor. 
En el negocio trabajan el y su esposa la señora Adriana Uresti ya que el señor Ceferino tiene ya mas de diez y nueve años dedicándose a vender tacos, refrescos y dulces afuera de una escuela, también  trabaja de velador en una compañía. 
Estos son los ingresos que tiene para ellos ya que viven solos y con el cual pagaran el préstamo.
texts.en:
Mr. Ceferino G. has already had three loans from FVP, which he repaid punctually and with which he has made improvements in his house and business. Now he is requesting a loan so that he can supply his business with a larger variety of products and so that he can set it up better. He and his wife, Mrs. Adriana Uresti, work in the business. Mr. Cerefino has spent more than nineteen years selling tacos, drinks and sweets outside a school. He also works as a guard at a company. These are the ways that the couple earns an income, since they live alone. This is also the income with which they will repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock and set up his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bulk ingredients

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina de 44 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida. En su pequeño cuarto, Alejandrina teje las artesanías más coloridas del mercado, las lleva a vender a la explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), donde sus clientes se dan cita todos los domingos y la buscan para comprar sus novedosos diseños. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y mientras más lo hace mejor se siente, lleva 14 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es trasladar sus artesanías hasta su puesto de venta, ya que le resulta muy cansado y agotador. Para el futuro espera abrir una tienda de tejidos artesanales, en la cual pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es el quinto préstamo de Alejandrina con MFP y es muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta y sabe que le ayudara a progresar. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para producir más tejidos y aumentar la variedad de su mercadería.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, 44, is a happy and hard working woman. She lives in her own house, and what she wants most is to get ahead in life. In her small room Alejandrina weaves the most colorful handicrafts in the market. She takes them to sell in the Laguna Temporal plaza (place where there are fairs in the city of Juliaca). This is where her customers meet every Sunday looking to buy her new designs. What she likes most about her work is weaving. The more she does, the better she feels. She has been doing this for 14 years. The hardest part about her work is transporting her handicrafts to her sales location. It makes her very tired and exhausted. In the future she hopes to open a store of woven handicrafts where she can offer better service to her customers. This is Alejandrina’s fifth loan with MFP. She is very punctual with her payments given that she does not want to cause problems for her community bank. She feels very happy with her community bank, and she knows they will help her to progress. She will use the 1,500 PEN that she is asking for to buy more wool to produce more weaving and increase the variety of her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es: El grupo “virgen D. Fátima” esta representado por la señora Maria y conformado por 16 miembros donD. los varones trabajan en el ingenio azucarero Guabira y aparte tienen pequeños negocios D. venta D. abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio los cuales serán atendidos durante el día por sus esposas, los otros varones son albañiles y taxistas los cuales requisen D. herramientas D. trabajo para realizar un trabajo mas eficiente, entre  las mujeres se dedican a la venta D. diferentes productos como comida, abarrotes, frutas, cosméticos, la presidenta se dedica a la venta D. cerveza y sodas en su domicilio. La competencia dentro D. sus rubros es alta, pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios con la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo dentro D. la institución pero están contentos D. que se les brinD. un apoyo económico que ayudada a generar mejores ingresos y a mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia
texts.en:
María represents the Virgen D. Fátima Group, which is comprised of 16 members. The men in the group work in Guabira Sugar Production, and have small businesses selling groceries in neighborhood stores. Their wives take care of the stores during the day. Other men are bricklayers and taxi drivers, and they need work tools to do their work more efficiently. The women in the group sell different products like food, groceries, fruit, and cosmetics. The president sells beer and soda in her home. The competition in their fields is high. Because of this they know how to get ahead in their work. The loan is for the growth of their businesses by purchasing merchandise, supplies, and tools to increase their income. This will allow them to give their families a better quality of life. In respect to their loan experience, this is their first loan cycle with the Institution. They are happy to be offered an economic support that helps to generate better income and improves their families’ quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: One Family Group

texts.en:
Joseph F. is the leader of a group of 4 borrowers called 'One Family'. He is a 36-year-old junior student of the University of Liberia. He is single with a 4-year-old child; the child's educational level is kindergarten. Joseph and his daughter live in WestPoint which is a crowded and poor community close to downtown Monrovia, Liberia.

Joseph's business is buying used shoes wholesale and selling them to the residents of Monrovia, Liberia. He has been running this business for 5 years and started with Ld$6,000 that was given to him by his oldest sister. His business has improved. Joseph always purchases quality goods to be sold to his customers so that they will continue buying from him.

Joseph hopes to establish a store in the future and dreams of giving his children a quality education and a balanced diet that will keep them healthy. Joseph needs this loan in order to purchase durable goods to be sold to customers.

loans.use: to purchase durable goods for resale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine D. T. is from the village of Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 43 years old. Josephine is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products such as earrings, necklaces and shell decorations in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 8,600 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

location.town: Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ireda Agali 1 Judith Ocen Group

texts.en: Judith O. is a business lady of twenty-five years of age. She is married with two children in schooling and she takes care of three additional dependents who are in schooling as well. She is dealing with a tailoring business, which she has been doing for four years so far. She is using the loan to purchase fabric for making clothes in different designs. She is requesting the loan to purchase clothing material especially for the Christmas season. She wants to improve upon her business so that she will experience some change. She is active and hardworking. Her dream is to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase clothing material, especially for Christmas season.

loans.name: Meiramhan's Group

texts.en:
Meiramhan T. is the leader of this group. She is fifty five years old. There are three children in her family.  Only their little twelve year old son lives with his parents. The eldest daughter, 35, is married and lives apart from her parents. Meiramhan’s middle daughter, 24, is married as well. She has moved to Kazakhstan. To support the family, Meiramhan’s husband works at the construction site in Bishkek, whereas Meiramhan raises cattle. Nobody really helped her start doing this. It was just her skill and curiosity.  Moreover, raising cattle has been bringing them enough income for Meiramhan to recently started repairing her house. Generally speaking, Meiramhan started animal husbandry quite late, as she was already in her mid – forties. Nevertheless, she has now ten years  experience in breeding cattle and a stable monthly income of $115. She has broken all the stereotypes of age and prejudices and thus has been an excellent example of an entrepreneur for  others. Meiramhan hopes to get a loan and buy a milk cow so that she is able to sell more milk. She has  plans to increase the number of cattle and to expand her business. 

Meiramhan’s partners are: Munara, Tatiana and Kulsumbubu.

Munara, 50, has raised three children. Her husband is a truck driver. Munara sells milk and raises cattle. She learned this occupation from her parents. Munara wants to open a shop with the profits she earns from selling milk. Munara needs a loan to buy a cow to sell more milk.

Tatiana, 30, is a mother of two daughters. Her children are very little, four and two years old respectively. Tatiana’s husband is a taxi driver. Tatiana is engaged in coal delivery. She needs a loan to buy a car for her work.

Kulsumbubu, 53, has two children. Her husband has left for Kazakhstan to work in construction. 
Kulsumbubu trades in cattle at the cattle market. Kulsumbubu needs a loan to invest  in purchasing sheep. 
 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow to sell more milk

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
La señora Janet, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Solidarias II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella.

Siendo la madera un insumo importante para la confección de muebles no vio mejor oportunidad que dedicarse a la compra venta de maderas al por mayor y menor, negocio que lo desarrolla en su mismo hogar con el apoyo de su esposo, atendiendo pedidos de las carpinterías y ebanisterías mas importante de la ciudad y la región, entre sus clientes es muy reconocida por la calidad de las maderas que vende y por el buen trato que los brinda.   

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará   cuartones de madera como tornillo, cedro, caoba, ishpingo entre variedades que son muy apreciadas para la confección de muebles de sala, comedor, cocina, oficinas.    

Janet, es una mujer muy emprendedora y perseverante, cualidades que sirven de ejemplo para otras mujeres que como ella quiere salir adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por contribuir con sus sueños y metas que tiene.
texts.en:
Ms. Janet, belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Solidarias II”, in the Tarapoto District, San Martín Province, in the San Martín State. She lives with her partner, is 30 years old, and a mother of one son, who is still dependent on her. Recognizing that wood is an important part of furniture manufacturing, she saw a great opportunity in selling wood furniture wholesale and retail. She handles the business in her own home with the support of her husband, handling requests from the most important carpenters and cabinet-makers in the region who are among her clients. She is highly recognized for the quality of the woods she sells and for the good work that has resulted from her efforts. With the loan of 1,500.00 soles, she will buy planks of wood such as cedar and mahogony, as well as purchase screws and other woods that are among the most precious woods for making living room, dining room, kitchen and office furniture. Janet, is a very hard- working business woman, qualities that make her an example to other women like her who want to move forward in their lives. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement, for contributing to the dreams and goals she has set for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase planks of wood

loans.name: Javan Nangombe

texts.en:
For the last six years, Javan has run the “Javan Household Goods” store and has sold household goods such as cooking pans, basins, jugs, cups,machetes and rope to regular and walk-in customers. His business challenges are high transportation and storage costs.

Javan is using the proceeds of KES 60,000 to buy more stock like pans and basins. His goal in life is to run a wholesale shop.

Javan is married and has seven children ranging in age from one-and-a-half to twelve years. He describes himself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To restock goods sold

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela, tiene un puesto donde vende refrescos, dulces y sándwich de pollo, carnes frías, y carne.
Vive en la zona de Achumani de la urbanización concepción en la casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado la compra de mercadería ( carne, aceite, verduras y refrescos).
Es primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro.
texts.en:
Graciela has a location where she sells soft drinks, sweets, chicken sandwiches, cold meats, and meat. She lives in her parents house in the Achumani zone of the Concepción urban area.

The loan will be used for the purchase of supplies (meat, oil, vegetables, and soft drinks). This is the first time that Graciela has applied for a loan from IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 35 años y vive con su esposo en su casa propia.
Desde hace 6 años tiene una tienda que implementó en su misma vivienda. Ella atiende todos los días, incluidos los fines de semana, y son su madre y su hermana sus principales apoyos en este negocio, ya que no solo comercializa comestibles, sino también medicinas, adornos, golosinas  y útiles de escritorio. 
Durante este tiempo de permanencia con su negocio, ha notado las ventajas de ser independiente, y por ello desea incrementar sus productos y ampliar el espacio de su tienda.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella fue invitada a formar parte de su banco comunal porque la conocen como una persona responsable. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará en la compra de abarrotes y golosinas.
texts.en:
Carmen, 35, lives with her husband in their own home. For the last six years she has run a grocery store that she set up at home. She tend to it daily, including weekends, with help from her mother and sister. She doesn't just stock food items but also medicine, decorations, sweets, and stationery items. During the time that she has had her business she has learned the advantages of being independent so she wants to increase her stock and expand her selling area. This is her first loan with MFP; she was invited to be part of a communal bank because she is known to be a responsible person. The funds will be used to buy grocery stock items and sweets.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo Q. es un hombre trabajador de una maquiladora y esta preocupado por el bienestar de su familia. Desde que el construyo su casa hizo el baño pero fue el ultimo y no ha podido terminarlo; Adolfo comenta que el baño solo lo separa unas cobijas para dividirlo y la ventana solo la tapa una madera es por ello que necesita un préstamo para terminar esta construcción. Por la condiciones en la que esta el cuarto de baño pueden tomar alguna enfermedad contagiosa sobre todo por los cambios tan bruscos de temperatura. Adolfo quiere prevenir esto antes que todo sea demasiado tarde.
texts.en:
Adolfo Quezado works in an assembly plant and is preoccupied for the well being of his family. At the time he constructed his house he put in a bathroom but it was the last room to be built and he has not been able to complete it. Adolfo commented that the bath only needs tiles to finish the walls and a wooden frame for the window. He needs a loan to complete the construction. With the bathroom in its present condition, one could catch a contagious disease, especially with sudden changes in temperature. Adolfo wishes to prevent this, above all, before it's too late.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: FINISHING CONSTRUCTION OF THEIR BATHROOM

loans.name: Aliana's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Aliana C. is from the village of Dioyo, Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 70 years old. She is married and blessed with 5 adult children. She owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting banana and cassava in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than 18 years earning 2,000.00 monthly.

In 2001, Aliana joined PMPC to access the programs and services of the PMPC COOP. Recently, she's availing her 11th cycle loan in the amount of 21,000.00 PHP which will be used for fertilizer for her banana and cassava production.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for her cassava plantation.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny C. is the group leader of four people who all live in Pea Ream village in Kandal province. The group members will all use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Ny C. lives with her three family members. She is a thread seller in the local village. As this business is going well she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more thread to resell. She is a widow without any children.

loans.use: To buy more thread for resale

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok C. sells pigs, earning $3 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. She is married and lives with her children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has six children. The family is also supported by her husband who is a farmer earning $3 US per day. Their standard of living has improved since they started these businesses. 

C. is requesting a loan of $1200 US to purchase more pigs to raise for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva. Her husband is in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Kyabugimbi Group Of Bushenyi

texts.en:
A determined and very ambitious T. Madina, aged 33 years, is married with four children and two helpless dependents.

Madina has operated a retail shop business for five years in Kyabugimbi town, Bushenyi District. At the end of every month she is able to fetch profits to the tune of 40,000 Ugandan shillings (approximately 20 USD).

Madina’s main drawback has been having small stock in her business that cannot match the consumption rate of her customers. She is therefore seeking a loan that she figures will help her to stock more goods that will satisfy her customers’ high demand and also transform her enterprise into a wholesale business.

Being very committed to her business with good customer care, Madina hopes to increase her sales revenue. This will bring about a fundamental change in her business and enable her to achieve a self-sustaining life and to cater for her family requirements.

loans.use: To purchase new stock for her retail shop

loans.name: Kathiuska Alexandra

texts.es:
Kathiuska I. de 39 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín (lugar originado por invasiones de terrenos particulares, lugar muy humilde con casas de caña y calles de tierra) de Guayaquil. Su casa es mixta de cemento y tablas solo tiene luz como servicio básico. Su esposo vende galones de agua, ellos tienen dos hijos de 14 y 6 años. 

Kathiuska para tener otro ingreso económico en su casa decidió comprar algunos víveres para vender. Adecuo una parte de su casa para hacer un local y su suegra le regalo algunos productos para que venda fue entonces que inicio con una tienda más surtida. 

Ella ahora trabaja todos los días, vendiendo azúcar, arroz, aceites etc. Pero ella quiere tener más productos en su tienda ya que la demanda es mucha. Por eso con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, azúcar, arroz para surtir más su negocio.   

En el futuro quiere vender productos y víveres al por mayor en almacenes conocidos, y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Kathiuska I. is 39 years old and lives in the periurban district of Fortín in Guayaquil. This area was originally private land, but it is now a modest place full of dirt roads and houses constructed out of reeds. Kathiuska’s house is a mixture of cement and wooden planks and it receives electricity as its only basic service. Her husband sells water by the gallon. They have two children, ages 14 and 6.

Kathiuska wanted to generate additional household income, so she decided to buy a few provisions to sell. She set aside part of her house to establish a store and her mother-in-law gave her some products to sell so that her business could start out well-stocked. She now works every day selling sugar, rice, oil, and other items. Kathiuska wants to have more products in her store because there is much demand. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy beverages, sugar, and rice to increase the inventory of her business.

In the future, she wants to sell products and provisions in bulk out of recognized warehouses. She also wants to see her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal Abejitas Trabajadoras.
Marcelina es separada, tiene 68 años y 3 hijos, Marcelina tiene una fabrica de yeso llamado Yesera Machi, su deposito esta en un local alquilado, sus ventas los realiza en el mismo lugar y también reparte por mayor a las tiendas.
Marcelina necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de piedra.
Marcelina sueña con construir su casa de material noble.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the Abejitas Trabajadoras (Little Worker Bees) Communal Bank. She is a 68-year-old woman who is separated and has 3 children. Marcelina owns a plaster factory called Yesera Machi, which she runs from a rented business space. She sells her products at this location, but she distributes them throughout several stores as well.

Marcelina needs a 1,050 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing rocks. She dreams of getting her own house built out of sturdy materials.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rocks

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en: Diosa D. is from Barangay San Nicolas, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 43 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Diosa owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Diosa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Diosa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Materials for construction of a perimeter wall

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a single man, and has been operating a video cafe for the last four years, serving his neighbors and passersby. With the 20,000 KES loan he wants to renovate his video cafe, and buy compact cassettes, blank CDs, and the latest movies to sell. He has no other source of income.

John experiences seasonality as a major challenge in the business. He hopes that someday he will open a theater and get more profit with that business.

He decided to work with Yehu in order to get a loan and uplift his standard of living. He rents a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are house rent and food.

loans.use: To renovate his video cafe, buy compact casettes, the latest movies and blank CDs to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith R. is from the village of  Gingoog City. She is 47 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Judith owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells processed food like longganisa (pork sausage flavored with indigenous spices). She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Judith joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Judith from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cabañitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. Cabañitas tiene como presidenta a la señora Elena, la mencionada asociación comunal pertenece al Centro Focal de Senkata. 

La señora Elena, cuenta con cuarenta y seis años de edad, esposa, madre, presidenta de su asociación comunal, tambien, lleva adelante su propio negocio.  

Desde hace diez años ella abrio una tienda de barrio y tambien vender en la Feria.  Su primer crédito fue de Bs. 500.- hace diez años, ahora su solicitud de crédito es por Bs2000.- Los días de feria Lunes, Martes, Miércoles, es colaborada por su hijo de catorce años.

Con respecto a Pro Mujer ella indica que los que más le gusta es el Consultorio de Salud, por que le atienden bien.

Las integrantes de la asociación comunal, son ocho mujeres y un varón. Tienen negocios diferentes, como: venta de fruta, tienda de barrio, venta de zapatos, panadería, cisterna, tejidos, venta de ropa, venta de DVD y VCD, venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Cabañitas” (Little Huts) is led by their president, Sra. Elena. The group is part of the Senkata Community Center. Sra. Elena is 46 years old. She is a wife, mother, and president of her Communal Association. Elena also runs her own business. Ten years ago, she opened a neighborhood store and also began selling at the fair. She received her first loan, which was in the amount of 500 BOB, ten years ago. Now she is requesting a loan for 2000 BOB. The days on which she attends the fairs are Mondays, Tuesdays, and Wednesdays. Her 14 year old son works as her assistant. Regarding Pro Mujer, Elena says what she likes most is the health clinic because she receives good care. The members of this Communal Association consist of eight women and one man. They have different businesses consisting of the following: fruit sales, a neighborhood store, shoe sales, a bakery, digging wells, weaving, clothing sales, DVD and VCD sales, and grocery sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, noodles, and sugar

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: El Sr. Eduardo de 27 años de edad, es  soltero,  Vive en casa familiar con su madre y  hermana,   en el B/21 de Septiembre zona radial, la profesión del sr. Eduardo es de   preparador físico,  pero hace Siete años   que se dedica al trabajo de  mecánico electricista, Actividad que aprendio de su Padre, ahora le va bien a el tiene muchos clientes El  Sr. Eduardo se le otorgo el crédito para cancelar el saldo de su vehículo. EL señor esta muy agradecido y sorprendido por la rapidez del crédito y la facilidad del pago, es una persona responsable y muy trabajador, uno de sus deseos es el de poder tener un taller mecanico bien equipado y con mucha clientela.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 27, is single and lives in the family home, located at 21 de Septiembre Boulevard, Radial Zone, with his mother and sister. Eduardo trained to be a physical trainer but has worked as an electrical mechanic for the last 7 years, a skill he learned from his father. He has many customers now. Eduardo was granted a loan to pay off his vehicle. He is very grateful and surprised by the speed with which the loan to pay off his vehicle was granted. He is a responsible, hard working person. One of his wishes is to have a well-equipped machine shop with lots of customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay off his vehicle.

loans.name: El Buen Samaritano Group

texts.es: L. señora Hilda tiene 35 años D. edad y vive en Huaycán, tiene en su cargo a 3 hijos y es conviviente. ElL. trabaja en L. venta D. ropas D. forma informal desD. hace 2 años y lleva 5 meses trabajando con Edaprospo, el ultimo préstamo le sirvió para comprar más prendas que vender, Hilda también trabaja en el Quiosco del colegio D. su hijo y espera poner su propia bodega en casa, ya que no hay alguna cerca, se encuentra feliz por L. ampliación y mejoramiento D. su casa y por su grupo “El Buen Samaritano” el cual es conformado por sus vecinos y el nombre fue elegido rememorando L. posta médica que se encuentra cerca y les ha ayudado con sus urgencias ocasionales D. salud.
texts.en:
Hilda, age 35, lives in Huaycán; she is in a common-law marriage and has three children in her care. She has been selling clothing for two years and has been working with Edaprospo for five months; she used her last loan to increase her inventory of clothing. Hilda also works in a kiosk at her son's school, and she hopes to open her own grocery store in her home, given that currently there isn't one nearby. Hilda is very happy about the improvements and the build-out of her home, and she is grateful for her group "Good Samaritan" which is maD. up of her neighbors; the name of the group was chosen in honor of the nearby first-aid clinic which has helped them with health emergencies.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandize and raw materials

loans.name: Nai

texts.en: Nai K., 45, is married and resides with his wife and six children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples. K. is a traditional musician, earning an income of USD 10 per day. K. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike to take his family members to play music at the night market in the town. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport his family members to play traditional music.

loans.name: Jean
