texts.en: Jean L. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Nabuswang, Barangay Canmoros, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: fishing and fish vending. Her husband Rudy L., who is 30 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 2 children who are 1 and 7 years old. Jean joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jean has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 which she intends to use to for the maintenance of her fishing equipment so that she could continue to save up for the future education of her children and for home repairs. Jean L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela O. is a married woman who lives in Zone 5, Brgy. Tagda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She operates 2 business ventures: fishing and fish vending. Her husband Roquelo O., who is 52 years old, works as a fisherman and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children aged between 19 and 29. 

Carmela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Carmela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her to earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, lifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 8th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000. She intends to use this as addtional capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her daily needs. Carmela O. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan C. is from the village of Catadman, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years of age and married to Edgar C. a motorcab driver. They are blessed with two children. Susan is presently engaged in buying and selling cartons. She has been engaged in this business for ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In April 2010, Susan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used for additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, and as savings for future use, especially for future business expansion.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: John

texts.en: John K. M. is married and he is a father of three children.  He has been in business since 2006 selling VCDs, DVDs and CDs. The business is strategically located on a highway and he employs one person. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase a duplicator and accessories.  He hopes to acquire a piece of land in the future with a five-year plan of relocating to the town center and distributing DVDs, VCDs, and CDs wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase a duplicator and accessories

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat lives in a city called Multan, which is the fourth largest city of Pakistan. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family, in the area called Muhallah Rahimabad. She has two children. Both of them are very young and have not started to attend school yet. Farhat is a businesswoman who operates a clothes-selling business. She started this business few years ago to financially support her husband. She buys clothes from the wholesale markets of Multan and sells them to her local area clients for good profit.  

Farhat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothing business. She will utilize the loan to purchase clothes of different varieties in bulk quantity. That will make her able to increase her household income by increasing her sales. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes it will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: To buy clothes for clothing business

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es: El señor Lucas O. Castellón tiene 47 años soltero, vive con su hermana Bertha O. Castellón también es soltera con 2 hijos, viven en sector de Candelaria Chimpa Rancho que está ubicado a 62 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, El señor Lucas es agricultor produce papa, papa liza, oca es una persona humilde pero trabajador, él necesita dinero para reintegrar de un lote de terreno que está comprando de ocasión. Para él es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos de la ciudad además les piden muchos requisitos, se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a la zona y otorgar crédito, El señor Lucas está muy contento de haber conseguido un crédito, ahora va poder comprar el lote de terreno agricola y ampliar la producción agrícola así va tener más ingresos económicos para hacer estudiar a sus 2 sobrinos menores, El señor Lucas tiene el sueño de sacar profesionales a sus sobrinos como técnicos en la agricultura para que ellos puedan mejorar la producción para la seguridad alimentaria.
texts.en:
Señor Lucas O. Castellón is 47 years old and single. He lives with his sister, Bertha O. Castellón, who is also single with 2 children. They live in the sector of Candelaria Chimpa Rancho which is located 62 kms. from the city of Cochabamba. Señor Lucas is a farmer. He produces potatos, papa liza (a tuber grown in the Andean region), and Oca (an edible root). He is a humble but hardworking person.

He needs money in order to pay back a debt for an agricultural parcel that he is buying at a bargain price. For him, it is very difficult to get to banks in the city. In addition, these banks have a lot of requirements. Cidre took the initiative to go to his area and grant credit.

Señor Lucas is very happy to be getting a loan. Now, he is going to be able to purchase the agricultural land, enlarge his crop production, and, thus, have more income to put into the education of his two young nephews. Señor Lucas’ dream is that his nephews become professional agricultural technical experts so that they can improve production for food security.

loans.use: To pay off a loan for agricultural land

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita I. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Camburong, Oslob, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures:  furniture sales, transportation (multicab) and pig fattening. Her husband, Roger I. who is 40 years old, earns his living as a welder/mechanic. They have 3 children who are 5 to 20 years old. 

Florita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Florita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing 19,500 PHP, which she intends to use to fund her business operations so that she can continue to save up for her family's future and to support the expenses of the family. Florita I. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.es:
Isidoro es  un padre de familia muy dedicado a trabajar para dar el apoyo económico  a sus hijos. 
Trabaja como cadete de taxi, siendo el propietario, el cual mediante de venta de herramientas de mecánica logro el vehículo. En donde recorre todos los días. Teniendo careras buenas y regular.
Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien vende comida. Por medio de Afodenic ha venido logrando las mejoras a su vivienda con  financiamientos otorgados a plazos. Con esta nueva solicitud comprara materiales de construcción para hacer división a cuartos y cocina.
texts.en:
Isidoro is a father who is very dedicated to working in order to provide his children with economic support.
He works as a taxi driver, and was able to buy his vehicle through selling mechanical tools. He works every day and has good and regular fares. He counts on the support of his wife, who sells food. Through Afodenic, he has been able to make improvements to his home with loans authorized in installments. He will use this new loan to buy construction materials to put up divisions in the rooms and the kitchen.

loans.use: He will put up a division in his kitchen and rooms, and use the loan to purchase construction materials to do the work

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es: Carmen tiene 25 años de edad cuenta con domicilio propio de material noble ubicado en Santiago vive con su esposo por el momento no tiene hijos ella se inicio en el rubro del comercio hace varios años con la venta de embutidos actualmente cuenta con dos puesto propios ubicado en el mercado Toledo,un auto y una mototaxi las cuales da en alquiler, el financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para la compra de un auto, se le otorga el crédito por contar con buenas referencias,voluntad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en: Carmen, 25, has her own home made of solid materials located in Santiago.  She lives with her husband and does not currently have children.  She started with a retail trade business a number of years ago selling sausages.  Now she has two of her own stands located in the Toledo market where she has an automobile and a mototaxi to rent.  She will use this loan to buy an auto.  She was approved for this loan based on good references, and her willingness and ability to make the payments.

loans.use: to buy an automobile

loans.name: Joseph Oloisiriri

texts.en:
Joseph O. K. is a 34-year-old man from the agricultural town of Kilgoris, south of the Rift Valley in Kenya. He is married to Lilian K., who farms in the same town. They have four children who depend on them for their basic needs.

Joseph has a book-selling business, whereby he sells religious and other motivational books. Some of the books are written in his local dialect of Maasai in order to reach his community at the language they understand best. He has done this work for the last seven years and makes a monthly income of 10,000 KES. He recently joined KADET LTD to gain access to microcredit, and he is now taking out his first loan, which he will use to buy more books to sell.

Joseph will use his profits to diversify into the transport business (locally known as boda boda), since he believes that he will make extra income. His desire is to see his business grow, enabling him to support his family through the provision of basic needs.

loans.use: To buy a stock of books to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie is a married woman who lives in Rizal, Palawan. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  a grocery store, farm supplies, and buy and sell of fish.  Her husband Ponciano, who is 46 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 4 and 9 years old. Melanie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Melanie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 14,300, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 to buy more products for the store and farm supplies so that she can continue to save up for future savings and expansion of her business. Melanie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase products for her grocery store and farm supplies

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Lucila;  La socia tiene 72 años de edad; La socia es soltera;  La socia  es una mujer alegre, trabajadora y llena de vida, la socia vive junto a su hermana Carmen; la socia es docente cesada, ella se ha jubilado de la docencia y en la actualidad tiene un negocio con su hermana de compra y vende ropa para niños, la socia  requiere el crédito para comprar ropa para niños. 

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Amauta". It is located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba of the department of Cusco.

Her name is Lucila. She is 72 years old and she is single. She is a very happy woman, hardworking and full of life. She lives together with her sister, Carmen. She is a retired teacher. She retired from teaching and she now has a business with her sister selling children’s clothing. She requires a loan to purchase clothing for kids.

She is satisfied with the loan that was granted to her and she is committed to making the payments at the established intervals.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 51 años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Actualmente no cuenta con servicios básicos como agua o electricidad. Desde hace más de 6 años, Elsa cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre gaseosas, abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Elsa es muy trabajadora y responsable. Agradece mucho a los prestamistas de Kiva por apoyarla crecer su negocio y sus ingresos.
texts.en: Elsa is 51 years old and a single woman. She lives in her own house in a rural part of the Motupe district. This region is located an hour and a half away from the city of Chiclayo. She does not have basic services like water or electricity. For more than six years, she has had a small store located in her home. She offers her neighbors a lot of products for daily use like soft drinks, groceries and basic needs products. She wants to expand her business with the purchase of more merchandise. For this reason, she thought it would be a good idea to request a loan for 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their support in growing her business and profits.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Eleazar

texts.es: El señor Eleazar González T. y su esposa son una pareja trabajadora que esta dispuesta en ofrecer a sus hijos una mejora calidad de vida. En esto momento ellos están construyendo su casa que con ahorros la están levantando pero aun les falta poner la losa pro por falta de capital no la han puesto para poder ver terminado su proyecto ellos necesita comprar material y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en: Señor Eleazar González T. and his wife are a hard-worknig couple who are determined to offer their children a better quality of life.  At this time, they are using their savings to build a house.  But they still need to put in the flagstone flooring.  Due to a lack of capital, they have not put it in nor are they able to see their project to completion.  They need to buy materials and pay for the labor.

loans.use: to put in flagstone.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: Adrian de 40 años,  natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, es un  hombre entusiasta en sus labores y está casado con Albina de 38 años y fruto de esa relación concibieron 06 hijos donde viven en su propia casa ubicados en la Comunidad Villa Quintiarina anexo del distrito de Quimbiri. El trabajo de Adrian es labrar la tierra, oficio que le enseñó sus padres desde que era muy niño, han transcurrido 23 años trabajando y cultivando cacao, maní y ajonjolíes, actividad que actualmente lo hace de manera tecnificada. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y  jornaleros, quienes le brindan el apoyo que necesita durante esa temporada, él sabe muy bien que sus ganancias se debe a la buena calidad de sus frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, sin embargar cargar los pesados sacos de sus productos desde la chacra hasta su comunidad le resulta muy cansado. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar la siembra y aumentar su producción. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y está dispuesto a cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. En su banco comunal es un socio participe. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de abono y fertilizantes que le serán de gran utilidad para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Adrian, a 40-year-old from the city of Quimbiri, is an enthusiastic worker. He is married to Albina, 38, and together with their 6 children they live in their own home in the community of Villa Quintianrina next to the district of Quimbiri. 

Adrian works the land, a trade that he learned from his parents from a very young age. He has spent 23 years cultivating cacao, peanuts, and sesame seeds; currently he uses machinery to do this. During harvest time he has the help of his children and seasonal workers, who give him a lot of needed support during that time. He knows that his earnings depend on the good quality of his fruits. What he most likes about his work is harvesting, even though carrying the heavy sacks of produce from the farm to the community is very exhausting. In the future, he hopes to buy new land to plant more and increase production. 

This is his 12th loan with MFP. He feels like this will help him to progress his work and plans to make his payments punctually. In his village bank he is a participating member. The loan is for the purchase of manure and fertilizers that will be of great use for improving his production.

loans.use: Comprar abono y fertilizantes.

loans.name: David Arquimides

texts.es:
David, reside en Semsembra departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y ganado, él vive con su esposa y una hija de 4 años de edad, él aprendió el negocio por su padre, quien le enseño y hoy en día sobrevive de su trabajo al igual que su familia.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: abono, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra, esta inversión le ayudara para realizar el trabajo y cultivar la milpa de maíz  y maicillo.
Los sueños de él es crecer con sus cultivos, también en su ganado, ya que su familia depende de su trabajo por lo que serian los primeros beneficiados con su crecimiento.
texts.en:
David, who lives in Semsembra in the department of Morazán, raises pigs and cattle and lives with is wife and four-year-old daughter.  He learned his trade from his father and makes a living this way just like the rest of his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizer, and to pay for labor costs.  This investment will help him get his work done and to grow corn and millet.

His dream is to expand his crop and livestock business since his family depends on this work and would be the first to benefit by its growth.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies, such as fertilizer, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.en:
For the past three years, Guljahon has worked in agriculture, raising animals. She raises cattle which she cares for with enjoyment since, thanks to them, she can cover her household expenses. She feeds her cattle for two or three weeks and then sells them in the market. Guljahon also has land in the size of 1.5 hectares for growing different vegetables. 

For Guljahon, it is very important to work raising her animals which is why she is currently seeking a loan in order to purchase additional cattle so that she can earn more money in future. This will help her family to generate additional income. Guljahon appreciates your support for her project.      
 	
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Esilia

texts.en:
Esilia, who was born in 1968, is married and has six children. She lives in a two room house in Elimighong, in the Belo subdivision. She joined GHAPE in 2009 and was given a loan of 50,000 XAF, which she repaid successfully. Life has not been easy for Esilia in the past as she was unble to provide for her family, especially when her husband had an accident. GHAPE has therefore revived her from this bondage. With the profits earned from her first loan, she has paid her children's school fees.

Esilia is now requesting a second loan which she plans to use to buy ingredients for puff puff (doughnuts), Irish potatoes and kerosene. The population of her area provides a ready market and she is experienced in the field. With any profits earned from this loan, Esilia intends to pay fees and purchase a pot. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because repayment is gradual and a lower interest rate is charged.        

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, flour, Irish potatoes and kerosene for resale.

loans.name: Ner

texts.en: Ner, 50, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Ner and her husband sell fish, earning an income of 12 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her son who is a fisherman, earning an income of 2 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 100 USD on food and 15 USD on the other necessary expenses. Ner is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase more fish to resell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Kotognogontala  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41ans,  5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à SOGODOGOLA, un des quartiers de la commune de KAI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, préfecture de Kadiolo  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec KANIMOGO  2ème à droite position debout.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et la semence pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de LOULOUNI et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 165.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group KOTOGNOGONTALA II are married women who average 41 years of age and five children living for the most part in polygamous families in SOGODOGOLA, a district in the Commune of KAI, in the sub-prefecture of LOULOUNI, Prefecture of Kadiolo (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the off-season. The group members are on their fourth loan with the institution. The past loans have been properly repaid.

The crop grown is: peanuts.  Such is the case with KANIMOGO, who is standing second from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for plowing and to buy farm inputs and seeds for maintaining 2 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold in villages, at the markets of LOULOUNI and SIKASSO, to a customer base composed of women and men.

KANIMOGO plans on making an average profit of 165,500 francs CFA per planting. The profits will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

She would like to keep up this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to make use of a larger arable plot, so she can derive better gains.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: 15 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hiền operates a food stall. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry to process and resell.

Hiền is 39 years old and is married with 2 children.
She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 15 Điện Biên  solidarity group. 
Hiền lives with 2 dependants in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hiền has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hiền has been involved in this business for 5 years.
The main hardship she faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her children to do well in school and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: To purchase poultry to process and resell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 49 years-old and married to Ely. Together, they raise their only child. To make a living, Thelma's spouse works full time providing motorcycle transport service in their village. This occupies his daily routine and earns approximately P6,000 each monthy. Income generated from this business goes to their family's daily food consumption. According to Thelma, their minimal income makes it hard to manage due to the expensive cost of merchandise.

Thelma is requesting a loan of P6,000 in order to pay for franchise renewal of their motorcycle used in the transportation service and to buy accessories such as side mirrors for the motor vehicle in order for it  to continue with its smooth daily operation. 

In the future, Thelma would like to open up a sari-sari store (a common name for a variety store) business and help lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay for franchise renewal of their motorcycle and buy accessories such as side mirrors for it.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 44 years old, married and has two children in school. He has been doing welding for two years to earn a living. He makes and sells door and window frames. In addition, he does dairy farming for extra income. Through Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business, hence improving his family’s standard of living.

Geoffrey hopes to become a successful businessman in the future. He has requested for 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: to buy  a welding machine.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: Наргис жительница города Куляб. Ей 25 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж временно не работает. Наргис занимается шитьем. У нее средне - специальное образование, она портниха. В основном она берет заказы на дому. Этим видом деятельности занимается 8 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения электрической швейной машинки.
texts.en: Nargis is a resident of the town of Kulob. She is 25 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband is temporarily not working. Nargis does sewing. She has a specialized secondary education, she is a seamstress. She mainly does custom orders at home. She has been in this business for eight years. She is taking out the loan to buy an electrical sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy an electrical sewing machine

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en: Rosela is 57 years old and married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them. Rosela runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 12,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to purchase more items to sell in her store. Rosela has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other groceries. In the future Rosela would like to save enough money to rent a space at the public market.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel tiene 26 años está casado con la señora Simona desde hace 2 años de dicho matrimonio nacieron Carlos Daniel que tiene 6 años se encuentra en la primaria y Joselin de 4 años de edad ella todavía no estudia pero muy pronto iniciara el preescolar. (Su esposa también tiene un crédito con FRAC)
Miguel se dedica a vender  timbre móviles, son figuras que se cuelgan en la puerta de las casas, los compra en la capital y los vende en la comunidad, las figuras son de plasticos, cerámicas o aluminio. Vende en diferentes presentaciones como angelitos, palomas, delfines, colibrís etc.
En la actividad lleva ya ocho años, esta ocasión ha solicitado el crédito para comprar más piezas las cuales ya vienen armadas y listas para vender, él piensa y calcula comprar entre 50 y 60 piezas el problema que presenta en estos momentos es la baja venta que ha tenido, sin embargo piensa recuperarse con sus productos nuevos que va a comprar. El espera que en septiembre que son las fiestas patrias en mexico, obtener un poco mas de ganancias.
Una de las metas que tiene es tener un puesto aunque sea ambulante ya que es cansado estar cargando todo el día las figuritas. “Gracias por el préstamo y confianza que en mi depositan ya que me será de gran ayuda para salir adelante”
texts.en:
Sr. Miguel is 26 years old and has been married to Sra. Simona for two years. They have a six-year-old son named Carlos Daniel who is in elementary school and a four-year-old daughter named Joselin who will be starting preschool very soon. (His wife also has a loan with FRAC.)

Miguel sells mobile wind chimes that have different figures and are hung on the doors of houses. He buys them in the capital and then sells them in the community. The figures are made of plastic, ceramic, or aluminum. He sells different forms such as angels, doves, dolphins, hummingbirds, and other objects.

Miguel has been in this business for eight years. On this occasion, he will buy more wind chime parts that come assembled and ready to sell. He plans and calculates on buying between 50 to 60 pieces. The main problem he faces at the moment is an instance of low sales. However, he intends to make up for this with the new products he plans to buy. He hopes to generate a little more profit in September, when national holidays are celebrated in Mexico.

One of his goals is to have a vending post since he is tired of walking around and carrying his merchandise with him all day. Miguel says, “Thank you for this loan and the trust that is being demonstrated to me because it will be a great help in moving forward.”

loans.use: to buy mobile wind chimes.

loans.name: Israel Antonio

texts.es: Israel de 36 años de edad es soltero, labora para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como operario de limpieza desde hace 4 años. Esta solicitando  su 4to credito con el objetivo de continuar con la construccion de su casa, pues el credito anterior le sirvio para levantar las paredes, y ahora necesita comprar las puertas y ventanas.
texts.en: Israel, 36, is single.  He has worked for the City of Juigalpa as a cleaner for the last four years.  He’s asking for his 4th loan to continue building his house.  He used the previous loan to erect walls and now he needs to buy the doors and windows.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Wellie

texts.en:
Wellie is widowed with 4 children. Wellie is 63 years old and lives in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga.
To earn a living, Wellie has a clothing business. She has had this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3500.She has requested a loan of 14,900 to  Wellie has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.

loans.use: to purchase spare motor parts and pay for her driver's license this motorcycle motor use for her business

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 31 years old and lives in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past seven years, Farida has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes such as blouses, skirts, and traditional Ugandan dresses called gomesis. 

To help expand her business, Farida has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more materials to make clothes, and will help Farida to generate greater profits and to improve the quality of life for her family. Farida hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another boutique in town. 

Farida is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Farida who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make clothes.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio, nuevamente está solicitando un préstamo, se decidió por que quiere comprar una refrigeradora para el negocio, sabiendo que con estos préstamos él puede ir creciendo poco a poco en el negocio, y también ir haciéndose de sus cosas materiales, Julio ha tenido buena experiencia en el negocio y con la administración de los prestamos, mejorando al lado de su familia.
texts.en: Julio is once again requesting a loan.  He decided to do so because he needs to buy a refrigerator for the business.  He knows that with the loans he can grow gradually in the business and also acquire material things.  Julio has had a good experience with the business and with managing the loans improving alongside his family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Livia

texts.es: La socia actualemnte se dedica  a la compra la por mayor D. ropa D. las diferentes tiendas grandes en Lima, Bolivia y otras y los venD. al por menor en Cusco, la socia viaja a comprar ropa para damas, caballeros y niños y los trae para vender ella actualmente tiene su stand en un conocido centro comercial D. la ciudad, la socia ha crecido mucho economicamente y tambien ahora que tiene su stand sigue trabajando el doble porque sus clientes aumentaron y ella desea invertir el prestamo para la compra D. ropa al por mayor y traer en esta temporada las nuevas novedades D. la capital del país y D. las diferentes tiendas y fabricas que estan allá. La socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra D. ropa al por mayor.
texts.en: The borrower is currently engaged in buying clothes wolesale from different large stores in Lima, Bolivia and others and sells them retail in Cusco. The borrower travels to buy wholesale clothes for ladies, men and children for later resale. The borrower has a stand at a well-known commercial centre in the city. The borrower has grown a lot economically and also now she has her stand she continues to work twice as much as her number of customers increased. She wants to invest the loan in buying clothes wholesale and offer this seasons latest fashion developments of the capital from the different stores and factories located there. The borrower wants to invest the laon to buy clothes wholesale.

loans.use: to buy clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Kounouho Sondé

texts.fr: Kounouho Sondé est âgé de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Kounouho Sondé est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Claudine. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant en charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Kounouho Sondé exerce depuis dix huit ans le métier d’ajusteur. Grâce aux revenus que lui génère cette activité, Kounouho Sondé contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Kounouho Sondé sollicite pour une deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement par Kounouho Sondé a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Kounouho Sondé is 34 years old and lives in Bénin. Kounouho Sondé is married to a hair stylist named Claudine. The couple has four children, some of whom attend school, and all of whom are under their care. In addition to their children, the couple has another child in their care. The children live together with their parents. The couple take care of the household expenses together. To meet his needs and those of his children, Kounouho Sondé has been doing metal work for eighteen years. Thanks for the revenue he makes from this, Kounouho Sondé contributes to his family’s different expenses. In order to satisfy the needs of his continually growing clientele, Kounouho Sondé is seeking his second loan from ALIDé. Kounouho Sondé’s previous loan was properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy tools for metal work

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has 2 children. 

Carol has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Carol has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Carol hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Ramona Lourdes

texts.es:
la sra. Ramona Lourdes tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposo y una hija, que la tienen cursando sus estudios secundarios, su esposo se dedica a comercialización de mariscos y juntos trabajan duro para cubrir los gastos del mes. Ramona Lourdes se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, su negocio lo abre de lunes a domingo, 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria, lacteos, granos basicos, embutidos y carnes, desea tener surtido su negocio para la espoca de navidad.
Su sueño es que su hija sea una mujer profesional.
texts.en:
Ramona Lourdes is 40 years old.  She lives with her husband and her daughter, who is in high school.  Her husband sells seafood for a living and together they work hard to cover their monthly expenses.  Ramona Lourdes sells convenience products in the small grocery store she has in her home.  Her business is open Monday through Sunday.

She will use her loan to buy groceries, dairy products, staple grains, canned goods, and meat.  She wants to stock her business for the Christmas season.

Her dream is for her daughter to become a professional woman.

loans.use: to buy groceries, dairy products, staple grains, canned goods, and meat

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 39 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Alejandra would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 42-year-old married woman with eight children. The oldest child is 17 years old. Rita's husband works as a farmer.

Rita is also a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She and her husband own a plot of land that they till to grow rice crops. They also hire laborers to help till their land. According to Rita, they sell their harvest to rice traders and this earns them about 5000 PHP per month. Rita does her best to assist her husband with their business and send their children to school.

Rita requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. Rita hopes that in the future, her family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia ia applying for a loan of $ 800.00 to improve her business and this is her first loan. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as noodles,eggs,shampoo,water,coffee and cigarettes.
Emila opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $ 200.00. She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy noodles,eggs,shampoo,water,coffee and cigarettes

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: A 62 years, Mrs. Helen I. sells foods and drinks to people in her environment. A semi-urban area in Edo State, Nigeria. High patronage by customers gives her joy. She planned to boost her business with the above amount.

loans.use: To buy more food items and drinks for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to buy high-quality seeds, fertilizers and watering cans

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.en:
Faced with poor employment prospects in his country and needing to support his family, Gustavo opened his own automotive electronics workshop in 1976. Later he moved into appliance repair and refrigeration. His shop is in Sabinas Hidalgo in the state of Nuevo Leon where he is from. Despite treatment and operations, he and his wife have not been able to have children for health reasons but Gustavo works every day to give his wife a better quality of life and make his business succeed. At this time Gustavo needs a $275 loan to buy tools and supplies he needs for his work. You can help to grow this business. Gustavo sincerely appreciates your support.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Delante la falta de empleo del país y la necesidad de sostener a su familia, desde 1976 Gustavo inició con su propio taller eléctrico automotriz, que después cambiaría a la reparación de electrodomésticos y refrigeración en la localidad de Sabinas Hidalgo, en le estado de Nuevo León, de donde es originario. Por problemas de salud, a pesar de los tratamientos y operaciones, él y su esposa no han podido tener hijos, pero se esfuerza día a día por ofrecerle a su esposa una mejor calidad de vida y sacar adelante su negocio.

En estos momentos, Gustavo necesita un préstamo por $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de herramientas que necesita en la elaboración de su trabajo, así como la compra de refacciones. Tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, no lo dudes más, Gustavo agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: To buy tools.

loans.name: Diega

texts.en:
Diega M., 48, and her husband Juliano have a small grocery store on a back street of their town. They have used previous loans to expand their inventory little by little, and now have the store stocked much better than in the past. This loan will again go to expand inventory.

This will be Diega's second loan with Friendship Bridge; she's a member of the group of women "Sololá". Her goal is to provide for her family. Of their nine children, six still live at home and all are in school, which is an admirable statistic, but requires much cash to support. Her older three children did not go to school, and Diega herself had no schooling whatsoever. She speaks only her first language, Cakchiquel and very little Spanish, and does not read or write.

Diega hopes to expand their house sometime in the future, because there's scarcely room for the six children and nine grandchildren who are often at home.

loans.use: Expand inventory for her store

loans.name: Ta Thi

texts.vi:
From Hà Nội, along route 3 toward Việt Bắc (windy city), there's a restaurant in the town of Nỉ-Trung Giã ran by Ms Tạ Thị Thịnh. This is where you can have authentic vietnamese dishes. As soon as you step inside the restaurant, you will be warmly greeted by the owner. All the dishes featured on the menu are prepared by Ms Thịnh with the help of her husband, a retiree. At the age of 47, after 9 years as a participating member of "Quỹ Tình thương" fund, Ms Thịnh has gradually built up her restaurant to be a viable business. Her 2 children are attending university. She is requesting a loan of 575 USD to buy more products/drinks for her restaurant

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Từ Hà Nội, ngược theo quốc lộ 3, về thăm chiến khu Việt Bắc, thủ đô Gió ngàn, dừng chân tại phố Nỉ-Trung Giã, ghé vào quán ăn của chị Tạ Thị Thịnh bạn có thể cảm nhận ngay được hương vị quê hương tỏa ra từ những món ăn dân tộc trong quán. Bước chân vào quán ăn bạn sẽ được đón tiếp bởi vẻ mặt rạng rỡ tươi cười của bà chủ cửa hàng. Các món ăn ở đây đều do chính bàn tay chị Thịnh thể hiện cùng với sự hỗ trợ của chồng là một quân nhân đã nghỉ hưu. Bước vào tuổi 47, sau 9 năm tham gia Quỹ Tình thương, chị đã xây dựng được một cửa hàng ăn khang trang, điều kiện bảo quản vệ sinh đầy đủ. Hiện nay chị có 2 con đang học đại học. Với mức vốn xin vay là 575 USD, chị dự định mua thêm thực phẩm và đồ uống để đáp ứng nhu cầu ngày càng lớn của khách hàng.

loans.use: buy food and drink for her restaurant

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Lê Thị Hiền, 31 years old, lives with her husband and 2 children in a shoreside village near Quảng Hùng, Quảng Xương district, Thanh Hoá. It was very difficult for her family to get a loan. All the banks required collateral. Since her family was in a difficult financial situation, it was impossible to qualify for a loan. When TYM fund opened a branch in Quảng Xương, she could qualify for loans from TYM because it was based on trust and support between women. With the loans, she buys fishes and resells at the market. The living condition of her family is not high standard but it had improved a lot. Everyday, she sells fishes at the market, she brings home about 125 USD a month. Her wish is to qualify for bigger loans. This time she's requesting a loan of 325 USD to buy fishing nets and fishes to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Hiền, 31 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ ở vùng quê ven biển thuộc xã Quảng Hùng, huyện Quảng Xương, Thanh Hoá. Việc vay vốn đối với gia đình chị trước đây gặp rất nhiều trở ngại. Các ngân hàng cho vay đều đòi hỏi phải có tài sản thế chấp nên để một gia đình có hoàn cảnh kinh tế khó khăn như nhà chị Hiền vay được vốn là điều gần như không thể. Từ ngày quỹ TYM về với Quảng Xương hoạt động với hình thức cho vay dựa trên sự tín chấp, bảo lãnh giữa phụ nữ vay vốn với nhau, chị đã có vốn để làm ăn, mức sống tuy chưa phải là cao nhưng đã có chiều hướng đi lên. Hàng ngày đi chợ bán cá thu nhập khoảng 125 USD/tháng, chị Hiền vẫn luôn mong muốn được vay những mức vốn cao hơn. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 325 USD thêm vốn vào mua lưới đánh cá và mua thêm cá để bán.

loans.use: Buy fishes and fishing-net

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Berdieva

texts.en:
Berdieva B. lives in Spitamen; she is married and has 2 children.  She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006 and she recommended herself as a serious and executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures.  

She is engaged in commercial and trade services.  Mrs. Berdieva has a business in the wholesale rice selling industry.  She has a straight supplier, which is why the prices for her goods are lower than the bazaar prices.  She is very polite, which is why she has permanent clients who want to buy only her goods.  

Berdieva B. is very experienced in the business, but working in the trade sphere she meets stiff competition, which is why she wants to provide a wide assortment.  Now Mrs. Berdieva B. requests a loan of $750 for business development and widening of assortment.

loans.use: For business development and widening of assortment.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
"My name is Yasmen A.. I am the mother of eight and all of them are under 16. All of my kids attend school. We run a business selling shoes. My husband generates decent profits out of this business.

Please give loans to my group members as well: Nasim Y. requires a loan for their shop; Aqila B. requires a loan for her family’s mobile phone store; Rukhsana B. wants to improve their fruit business; and Sarweri G. wants to start a tea stall. All of us are neighbors and wish each other a prosperous life."

loans.use: Expand our shoe business

loans.name: Lwaba East J Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret N.. She is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Margret is 48 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant farmer for work. She has 3 children ranging from age 17 to 24 and her children go to school. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

Margret is joined in her small group by Sarah N., Harriet N., Justine N., and Christine B.. Sarah N. has a business in clothing sales and wants to stock more clothes. Harriet N. is currently operating a business in cassava selling and wants a loan to add to the business. Justine N. operates a business of selling hides and skins and wants to boost business. Christine B. is currently in the business of selling passion fruit and is requesting a loan to improve business.

loans.use: To add capital to charcoal business

loans.name: Palmiro

texts.es:
Palmiro is 67 years old. He and his wife Delia own a shop together, and thanks to their hard work and sacrifice they now own their own home.

Palmiro began to work at the shop more than 50 years ago with his parents. He also owns some cows and sells their milk. Palmiro and Delia's niece also works with them; she helps out at the shop and with the housework.

Palmiro needs this loan to purchase merchandise like rice, pasta, dairy, oil, drinks, and bread so that he can bring in more revenue, since he is spending more in order to pay for his niece's college education.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

Palmiro tiene 67 años de edad, él está casado con Delia y ambos son comerciantes, y ya cuentan con casa propia gracias al sacrificio de ambos.

Palmiro empezó a trabajar en la despensa con sus padres hace más de 50 años, también se dedica a la venta de leche ya que tiene animales vacunos. Actualmente trabajan con ellos una sobrina suya, ayudándoles en la despensa y en las labores hogareñas.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como arroz, fideos, lácteos, aceite, bebidas, panificados, bebidas y otros, para obtener mayores ingresos ya que los estudios universitarios de su sobrina demandan mayores gastos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise: rice, dairy, bread, oil, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is the mother of 3 children. Her husband is working in the foreign ministry in Kabul and she is a tailor. She works in her home. She has a good number of clients and she wants to open a shop. She has requested an individual loan to complete her tailoring necessities and buy new machines to further her business with more success and help her family.

loans.use: To complete her tailoring necessities

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian A. sells clothes in Ibatedo in the state of Lagos, Nigeria. She has been in this business since 1984 and has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past four years. She is 50 years old and married with two children. Her husband also works to support the family; this reduces the responsibility on Marian and she can focus on her business to attain maximum profit. She is requesting a loan of $850 to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Thi Bac

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Bac is 35 years old. She has joined the TYM Fund since the year 2003. She used the first loan to invest in livestocks but the income was not substantial. Therefore, she used the second loan to invest in buying scrap and recyclable materials to resale to the retailers. As she was experienced in buying scrap from households as well as determined to increase her family's income, she set up a scrap-buying store at home. Her business gets better and her income increases over time. Besides income from the scrap business, every month her husband earns additional income from construction works, thus her two children can go to school. This round of loan she wants to borrow 19 millions VND (1,150USD) to increase her capital so that she can expand her business. Her monthly income is 4 millions VND (about 258USD)

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Bắc năm nay 35 tuổi. Chị tham gia vàoQuỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Vòng vốn đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhưng công việc chăn nuôi cho thu nhập không cao. Do vậy vòng vốn sau chị đã sử dụng vốn vào việc đi thu mua phế liệu từ các hộ gia đình về bán lại cho các đại lý. Do tích lũy được nhiều kinh nghiệm từ công việc đi thu mua phế liệu lẻ cùng với quyết tâm phát triển kinh tế gia đình, chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư vào kinh doanh phế liệu. Hiện nay gia đình chị đã có một cửa hàng đại lý thu mua phế liệu tại gia đình. Công việc làm ăn của gia đình chị ngày càng thuận lợi và cho thu nhập ngày càng cao. Ngoài thu nhập từ đại lý thu mua phế liệu, hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập từ công việc đi làm thợ xây của chồng chị, do đó 2 con chị đều được đầu tư cho ăn học đầy đủ. Vòng vốn này chị muốn vay 19.000.000 đ để đầu tư thêm vốn vào cửa hàng thu mua phế liệu mở rộng kinh doanh. Thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Scrap business

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en:
U. Gulnoza became a client in 2008 and showed herself to be very responsible. She makes repayments to her loans on time and has had no problem following loan procedures. She lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan and is married with 7 children.

Mrs. U. Gulnoza is engaged in trading fruits and vegetables at the local bazaar. She works directly with suppliers so she can sell for low prices and has many repeat customers. Mrs. U. Gulnoza applies to KIVA for a business support loan of 2200 STJ for 4 months in order to increase and improve her business.

loans.use: To increase and improve her business

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry C., age 26, is a rice farmer who lives with two of her children. Living in Kampong Cham province, she typically makes US$2.00 per day. Her husband, Kun Keo, makes approximately US$2.00 growing cucumbers. The Kampong Cham area has not had favorable weather conditions for farming this past year. Along with increased inflation, it has been a difficult year economically in much of Cambodia. As a farmer, Ry C. is taking a lot of the brunt of the economic downturn. That is why she has approached CREDIT with a request for a loan. Ry C. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase fertilizer, a purchase that she sees as a good opportunity to increase her income.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Mr. Chen C. is a villager in Krouy Wat Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is 29 years old and his only child is just three years old.Mr Chen C. is a poultry breeder and rice farmer. He earns a small revenue from rice farming as his current plot of farmland is small. In order to expand his rice revenue, he is requesting a loan to buy 0.5 additional hectares on which to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Chim Ra, is a Khmer cake seller also earning a small income to help support their household.

loans.use: To buy 0.5-hectares of additional farmland on which to cultivate rice

loans.name: Zalha's Group

texts.en:
Zalha sells clothes and underwear in Zanzibar. She previously received one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid on time and is now requesting her second loan so that she may buy more inventory. If her profits increase as a result of this loan, she will put the money back into her shop so that her business continues to grow.

Zalha is married and has two children, aged three and eight. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Kazija, who also owns a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and underwear to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Kholmuhamad

texts.en:
N. Kholmuhamad is a farmer.  It is how he supports his family, which consists of his wife and two school-aged children (pictured in the photo because Kholmuhamad himself was absent on the day of our visit).  

With great sacrifice, he has been able to be successful and has supported himself with the loans he has received from IMON.  In spite of the economic challenges that he has encountered, he has been able, with much sacrifice, to support his home.  That is why today, he is concerned about improving his work by investing in crops through technical assistance, and by buying seeds and fertilizers for their development.  

Today he has approached to IMON for a loan that will permit him to buy supplies for his crops.  This loan will benefit him, as well as the family that he so loves.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Bi Bi Shiren

texts.en:
Bi Bi Shiren lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and lives with her own nuclear family. She has been doing embroidery for many years. She works in her house and her husband sells what she makes at the bazaar. Her husband is also a taxi driver. Shiren wants to expand her embroidery business and exchange her husband's taxi for a new one.

She has requested an individual loan of 30,000 Afghani with a term of 12 months to enlarge her shop and complete her stock. She wants to say she is sure that after this loan, some changes will come to their life and they can support their family better in future.

Shiren is happy with this loan process in Afghanistan. She would like to thank Kiva for working with AFSG to achieve this wonderful process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To enlarge her business

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim T., 33, is a professional tailor who lives with her husband in Battambang province. She typically makes US$ 4 a day, while her husband is a soldier and makes US$ 1 a day. This couple has one child. Mrs. Kim T. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase more cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth for her business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy S. is thirty-seven years old. She is married with three children. Lucy is resourceful and enterprising. She has sent three children all the way through high school with her business earnings. She operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like “fufu” and “banku”. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantains, taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains, and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. 

Lucy says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she is no longer able to meet her production expenditure. She needs the loan to enable her to inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and maintain quality as well. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like maize, cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. Lucy is a member of a group called “Miracle” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs, meat, fish and vegetables to produce cooked food for re-sale

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa A. is 38 years old. She is a married woman with four children - two boys and two girls. She says one of her children has completed senior high school while the rest are in the junior high and the primary schools. Adwoa’s husband is a mason by profession. She lives with the family in her brothers’ house in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural-dominated town. It is about a 45 minute drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. Adwoa trades in fresh yams and crates of eggs to make some income. According to her, she procures the fresh yams and the eggs from Techiman and Kintampo where the price is quite economical. Adwoa sells her goods at the market square and also to retailers. She has been in business for five years. Adwoa wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure yams and eggs in bulk. She hopes to help her husband improve upon their standard of living and give all their children the best of education they can afford.

loans.use: To procure yams and eggs

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan S., 35, is a villager living in Battambang Province, Cambodia.  She is applying for a loan to increase her stock of grocery items for sale. Chan currently sells some products to neighbors in the village and she generates a daily income of $2.50. Chan is married to Mr. Ya, 47, who helps support the family by driving a motor taxi. The couple lives with two teenage children who attend school.  They hope the loan will help them attain a higher standard of living.

loans.use: Increase her stock of groceries for sale.

loans.name: Sophia B Group

texts.en: Mrs. N. Sophia, 45 years old, is married with seven kids. She has been selling fresh and dried fish for five years; the major challenge in her business is perishability of the fish.  Therefore, she is using the loan to purchase a refrigerator for the storage of her fresh fish. She is active and dreams of buying a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Ronald Alonso

texts.es: Ronald Alonso S. M. tiene la edad de 45 años, su estado civil es casado. Don Ronal tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Don Ronald es una pulperia. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio, los que ofrece en su vivienda donde esta ubicado y dirige de forma personal, por lo que nace con el deseo de trabajar ya que no poseía ninguna fuente de ingresos. Por lo que sus propósitos son de mejorar cada día en su negocio ya que ha sido un apoyo indispensable. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y así comprar los productos de uso diario que arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite y otros. El deseo de Ronald es asegurar un buen futuro para sus hijos y ellos puedan seguir adelante con el negocio.
texts.en:
Ronald Alonso S. M. is 45 years old, married and has 3 children who attend school.

For over 11 years, Ronald has owned a grocery store that he runs from his home in a personal way. He started the business because he didn’t have any source of income and wanted to work. Everyday he strives to improve his business since it has been an indispensable support.

He will use the loan as working capital to purchase everyday products like rice, sugar, beans, oil and other items. Ronald wishes to secure a good future for his children and ensure that they can succeed with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rose Abéni

texts.fr: Cette femme  est une résidente du quartier d’agoè, elle est divorcée de son mari et vit seule avec ses quatre enfants. L’activité qu’elle exerce est la vente de peintures. Avant de débuter cette activité, elle a obtenu un crédit de WAGES qu'elle a déjà remboursé. Elle reçoit des commandes des entrepreneurs, des maçons et aussi des particuliers. Elle a commencé cette activité en 2004.  La demande de ses clients est de plus en plus élevée, pour y faire face, elle sollicite de WAGES un deuxième crédit pour acheter 35 boîtes de peintures « SCIL » de différentes qualités.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the neighborhood of Agoe, she is divorced from her husband and lives alone with her four children. Her business is the sale of paint. Before she started this activity, she obtained a loan from WAGES that she has already reimbursed. She receives orders from contractors, masons, and individuals. She started this business in 2004. Her customers' requests are getting higher and higher. In order to meet the demand, she is requesting a second loan from WAGES to purchase 35 cans of paint "SCIL" of different quality.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cans of paint

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic G. is from the village of Napurog, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, separated from her spouse, and has five school-aged children. Marivic owns and operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In May 2008, Marivic joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to pay the labor on maintenance of the transport vehicle to improve the business. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service and to purchase stock for her sari-sari (variety) store. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service and to purchase stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is thirty-eight years old. She is the divorced mother of three children. All of her kids are in school in the community where they live. She was divorced some years ago when her husband disrespected her by getting married to another woman. Responsibility for the family rests completely on her and she works very hard to provide for the children.

She has being selling foodstuff for the past 15 years to provide for her family. She sells plantains and cassava by the main roadside that links to Koforidua Township, in the eastern region. She says her goods are usually purchased by travelers who regularly travel that road.

Mercy’s business is doing well due to the good human relation she has with her customers. Her major challenge is in accessing funds to buy more from the farmers so that she can store products when there is a price hike. Mercy wants a loan to buy foodstuff like bunches of plantains and cassava etc. to restock her inventory. It has also being her dream to save more from her business proceeds to take care of the children in school. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Mmoa’, meaning God’s Help.

loans.use: She wants the loan to buy food inventory.

loans.name: Kencha

texts.ru: Кенча Назарова проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст 77 лет. Вдова, имеет 5 детей. Кенча более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Ей в этом помогают ее дети. Один из сыновей находится в России на заработках, он также высылает матери деньги. Клиентка просит кредит, для покупки дойной коровы и в дальнейшем будет продавать ее молоко.
texts.en:
Kencha N. lives in the Varzob district. She is 77 years old, a widow and has 5 children. Kencha has been involved in animal husbandry for over 15 years. Her children help her with this business. One of her sons works in Russia and sends money to his mother. Client is requesting a loan for the purchase of a dairy cow and plans to sell milk in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Katrina

texts.en:
“The thing I’ve learned is that you can’t wait for things to come to you,” says Katrina about her mobile massage company.  Since losing her job at a spa when it closed down, she has focused on her own business working mostly with motorcyclists, racers, and mechanics recovering from injuries and surgery.  Since her clients rarely seek out a massage therapist, Katrina has built partnerships with automotive businesses who bring her in to work on their employees.  This niche market has enabled Katrina to establish a loyal customer base, but she needs to expand her client list in order to build a sustainable business.

A $3,000 loan will help Katrina buy a car to that she can travel to more businesses, and even raceways and other events, in order to expand beyond her current client base.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Katrina from  United States

loans.use: Purchase vehicle for mobile massage practice

loans.name: Jelica

texts.en:
Jelica was born in 1954. She is unemployed at the moment and lives with her sons. She worked in a textile factory as a tailor for a long time. Now, she is a housewife and makes some earnings by fixing old clothes for some secondhand stores. She cannot earn much but her sons are helping her.

Jelica is a member of our society – Women for Women International – and now she has requested a loan of 900 KM from WWI. She will use this loan to buy a new sewing machine and some materials to make clothes. Thanks to her long experience, she thinks that she will make a success in this business and become independent of her sons.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Carmen Minda

texts.en:
This is Carmen Minda P., 43, who hails from Concepcion, Marikina City, a bustling city on the eastern side of Metro Manila.  She is married to a preacher and is blessed with one child.

Carmen owns a sari-sari (general) store and she also manages a transport operation (taxi).  On idle days, she finds time to carve bar soaps, fashioning them to form any artistic shape imaginable, from figurines to flowers.  She found it to be an interesting hobby and source of income as well, especially during special occasions like mother’s day, birthdays, etc.  Combined, she makes $300 a month.

She joined the Kiva field partner, the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative, in 2007. She also wants to share with her friends the many blessings she has received since joining the CCT, so she invites them to attend their weekly meetings.    

Carmen currently needs a loan of P12,000.  She will use the funds to purchase replacement spare parts for their taxi.  She has been saving a lot so as to be able to buy more taxi units so she can help employ other people.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Spare parts for the taxi

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr: Mama est une vendeuse ambulante des vêtements de friperie dans le quartier d’Adakpamé à Lomé ; c’est en 2001 qu’elle a débuté ce commerce parce que le revenu financier de son mari, conducteur de taxi, n’arrivent plus à couvrir tous les besoins financiers de leurs 03 enfants. C’est pour cette raison que cette dame a pris la décision de se lancer dans le commerce de friperie. Elle se promène de maison en maison et dispose désormais d’une clientèle qui lui reste fidèle. Ainsi, dès l’ouverture de nouveaux bals de vêtements, elle donne l’exclusivité des meilleurs jupes et habits à ses plus fidèles clients, ce qui la rapproche à chaque fois de sa clientèle. Actuellement elle a un besoin urgent de lancer une nouvelle  commande ; c’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 05 bals de vêtements de friperie.
texts.en:
Mama is a traveling retailer who sells second-hand clothing in the Adakpamé area of Lomé; she started this business in 2001 because her husband's income as a taxi driver was no longer able to cover all the financial needs of their three children. It is for this reason that this lady decided to begin selling second-hand clothing. She walks from house to house and has built up a faithful clientele. Thus, every time a new bale of clothing is opened, she reserves the best skirts and outfits for her most faithful clients, which increases her bonds with her customers each time. Currently, she urgently needs to send out a new order; this is why she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 5 bales of second-hand clothing.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha A. runs a business of selling soft drinks at LKigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She an entrepreneur married business woman.  She sells juices, Drinking water, Ice cream and Soda to customers. Juices is made by her self by buying fruits from the market and using a blender to make it while soda and Ice cream is purchased from the whole sales shops and selling in retail to customers. Ice cream is mostly consumed by school children thus the market is during the school time. She needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to boost up her business

loans.use: To boost up the business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda D. is from the village of Salimbal, Lugait Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Rosalinda is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a business providing manicure and pedicure services in their village. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In October 2009, Rosalinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
